Reward
Load the requested goods or items at your harbour onto a ship and deliver to the location marked on the minimap
Destroy all vehicles marked on the Minimap
Pick up objects on the water using a ship and deliver to the location marked on the Minimap
Escort the following ships to their destination:
Locate the objects described by the quest giver, and click on them
Ensure you have enough goods in storage
Construct the given number of buildings in your settlement
Establish a street connection from the required building to your Warehouse or Harbour
Establish a street connection from your residence buildings to the Marketplace.
Establish a rail connection from the stated Warehouse to your Harbour or another Warehouse
Ensure your farms contain the sufficient number of farm fields
Ensure your production sites have all their Extensions
Construct the stated buildings and establish a street connection from them to your Warehouse or Harbour
Reach a certain level of satisfaction for the given goods
Are you ready to receive the item and start the quest?

You and your old pal Aarhant were living it easy, but a fateful letter from your sister Hannah means a sudden return to the old world. Since you are too poor to afford passage, you must earn it by fishing.
Fetch [AssetData(190585) Text] from [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ItemPlace]) Text]
Use [AssetData(190585) Text] on [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Pick up [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Aarhant can't believe you want to pay the passage home by dynamite fishing.
Aarhant says the dynamite you need is in the derelict lighthouse.
Aarhant hands you the dynamite nervously.
Aarhant thinks you have enough fish to pay for a ticket home.
Aarhant points you to the shack in the harbour for your ticket.
Aarhant is unimpressed with your aim.
Aarhant is impressed with your aim.
Aarhant reminds you to catch fish so as to buy your passage back home.
Select the dynamite from your ship and try to hit the fish swarm floating nearby your ship. To make a direct hit you have to anticipate the fish swarm's speed and trajectory.
Once you have all fish on your ship, move your ship close to the coastal harbor to exchange them for the travel ticket to the Old World.
The man in the shack agrees to take your fish.
The man gives you the ticket you need to return home in exchange.
The man in the shack gives you a friendly welcome.
Bring [Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ExecutionObject]) Text]
Sell more of your sensational schooners:
It may seem odd, but our next step is to sell this ship - it will show we mean to run an enterprise just as influential as father's.
Sail schooner to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text], select it and sell it

In the wake of your father's alleged treason and death, your uncle Edvard seized control of Goode & Sons, leaving you and your sister Hannah fending for yourselves. Hannah has put everything into a small island, but it's not exactly in good shape: there are ruins from the previous inhabitants all over the place. Before you can have a fresh start, you need to demolish them and clear up the space.
Clear [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Hannah encourages you to get to work on your new island.
Hannah asks you to clear the first ruin to discover its potential.
Hannah is pleased with your work and encourages you to continue.
Hannah reminds you there is forestry work to be done on your island.
Hannah mentions there are small ruins on the island to get timber from.
Clear any small ruin for Timber
Remove the old village ruins to clear the area for the new buildings.
You can also remove smaller ruins to get additional timber.

Hannah noticed that you are running low on timber, but she knows a fast way to stock up on it. It so happens that there are still several ruins scattered around Ditchwater that you could demolish for materials. She advises you do that!

The island Hannah bought for the both of you, Ditchwater, is already looking better, but it is still a diamond in the rough. There are still many ruins from the previous inhabitants that need to be demolished and cleared before you can expand your company.
Hannah prompts you to keep on cleaning the island.
Remove the old market ruins to have more space for your village to grow.
You can also remove smaller ruins to get additional timber.
Ditchwater has almost become what Hannah once dreamed for the both of you. Only a few more ruins stand now in the way of building a shipping company worthy of your father's legacy.
Hannah advises you to demolish the next ruins that are blocking your expansion.
Remove the desolated church to have more space for your village to grow.
Edvard is baffled that you would remain beyond the funeral proceedings.
Hannah feels this island has potential.

Uncle Edvard seized control of Goode & Sons, leaving you and your sister Hannah fending for yourselves. But you have your own company now. Keeping your father’s dreams alive, just as he always hoped you would. Still, there is plenty to do, before you can think of ships and a shipyard. First, you need to build a small settlement to house the loyal people that followed you and Hannah into Ditchwater.
Hannah asks that as a first step, you provide housing for your loyal followers.
Hannah emphasises the importance of having more people to clear the island.
Hannah reminds you to provide housing for your followers.
Hannah is glad you are managing to produce timber already.
To attract farmers you need to build farmer residences.
Build a market close to the farmer residences to provide them with basic needs.

Uncle Edvard seized control of Goode & Sons and left you and your sister Hannah fending for yourselves. But you have your own company now, keeping your father's dreams alive. Still, there is plenty to do, before you can think of ships and a shipyard. Producing timber, for example.
Hannah wants you to start producing timber.
Hannah reminds you to start producing timber.

Now that Uncle Edvard has seized control of Goode & Sons, you have to start your own company from scratch. Still, there is plenty to do before you can think of ships and a shipyard. The first ruins have been cleared from Dichtwater with much effort and your people are hungry. If you are to stay, you will need a stable supply of food!
Hannah urges you to supply food to your farmers, tired from the demolition.
Hannah urges you to feed your farmers.
To attract farmers you need to build farmer residences.
Build a fishery close to your Trading Post to provide fish to your farmers.

Uncle Edvard has seized control of Goode & Sons. But you have your own company now. Keeping your father’s dreams alive, just as he always hoped you would. Still, there is plenty to do, before you can think of ships and a shipyard. Housing your people, for example.
Hannah asks that you support the influx of settlers with housing and amenities.
Hannah reminds you to give your people the houses and amenities they need.
Hannah congratulates you on building a settlement that may soon attract workers.

One of your cousins writes from Bright Sands, Uncle's island. He tells you about the climate of instability that has arisen against Edvard's administration. Go find him in the vicinity of the Great Exhibition's foundations and he may be able to help you gather some followers from amid the rioters.
Find your Cousin leading a mob in the vicinity of Edvard's Great Exhibition construction site
Your cousin informs Hannah and you that workers are rioting in Bright Sands.
Hannah thinks people in Bright Sands are unhappy with Edvard's administration and urges you to look for your cousin.
Hannah urges you to contact your cousin about the worker riots in Bright Sands.
Go to Edvard's harbour south-west of your island. You can also click on the quest in quest tracker to move the camera to Edvard’s harbor.
Find Edvard's church in the harbour district. It has a high bell tower. Your sister also remembers that your cousin's house has a purple roof and a campfire in the backyard.

Having saved the unhappy workers from your Uncle Edvard’s regime, your town must grow to accommodate them. With suitable housing, more workers will soon flood into your settlement, meaning more capable hands to one day build your first shipyard.
Upgrade to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Hannah asks that you upgrade your houses to accommodate workers.
Hannah reminds you to upgrade your houses for workers.
Fulfill all basic needs of a farmer residence to have maximum amount of inhabitants.
Fully populated residences can be upgraded to the next level by using the upgrade button.

You finally have your first workers on your side, but you will need many more of them before a shipyard can be built. Your city needs to grow and if you want your company to become an attractive choice for workers.
Hannah says you must have more workers before you can build a shipyard.
Hannah reminds you to expand your city and workers.
Hannah is pleased that you have enough people to build a shipyard.
Get more Workers by upgrading more residences or by fulfilling more needs.

You have cleaned most of the island by now, but a few sturdier ruins remain. Luckily, you have workers living in your city now. They are skilled enough to take care of them and aid you in the finishing phases of making Ditchwater the perfect place to grow your new company.
Hannah advises you to remove the more robust ruins on the island.
Clear Worker Ruins

With your Uncle's debt finally behind you, you are now free to start your shipping company. Your first shipyard and ships will take you and your sister to the bright future that your father would have wanted for you.
Hannah is excited to see your first shipyard built.
Hannah is desperate to see the shipyard you have worked so hard for.
There is a whiff of salt on the breeze. With your first shipyard and ships, it will surely be a matter of time before you eclipse your ghastly Uncle.
Hannah is keen to see sails manufactured.
Hannah thinks you should make sails a priority.
Hannah discourages you from opening your Uncle’s private letter.
Hannah is shocked by Uncle Edvard’s letter and suggests you take it to Sir Archibald.

Hannah has recognised Edvard's prisoners to be your father's most trusted associates, and the documents make it clear that they were wrongfully accused. Your sister believes a higher authority like Sir Archibald Blake will be able to mediate in the matter.
Hannah urges you go to Sir Archibald and show him Edvard’s devious letter.

OR:
Bring Edvard's Political Prisoners to Sir Archibald Blake
In case you have decided to bring the political prisoners to Archibald Blake, move your ship close to his lighthouse.
Workers will migrate into a city, not into a village. You need to expand your small town.
Hannah asks you to build housing for migrants.
Hannah reminds you that new farmers need a proper housing.

Since your Uncle Edvard doesn’t trust your father’s former newspaper editor, perhaps it is an opportunity for you to employ his services instead. Rumour has it he is a loyal fellow, even a little too loyal...
Aarhant wonders if your father’s former newspaper editor would be willing to work with you.
Aarhant reminds you to find the Editor in your Harbour.

Aarhant reminds you that people often need a place to drink, rest and celebrate to recover from all the hard work after cleaning the ruins in Ditchwater. Some schnapps and a pub should keep their spirits up.
Aarhant thinks Schnapps can motivate your people to keep going.
Aarhant reminds you to schnapp to it.

Provide your farmers with schnapps to make your farmers happy. In order to do so build a potato farm and a schnapps distillery close to each other, and connect them to the nearby trading post or to a warehouse via street. Build a pub close to your farmers' residences to make your farmers happier.
You can also build more schnapps production chains to satisfy your farmers' needs faster.
Aarhant alerts you to an emergency lifeboat in your harbour. The survivors aboard are dressed in prison uniform, and no doubt have some tale to tell.
Aarhant alerts you to the arrival of an emergency lifeboat in your harbour.
Aarhant is sure the lifeboat survivors in your harbour are of interest.
Talk to survivors on [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Object]) Text]

You have rescued your Uncle's prisoners as they were being transported to be convited in Eli Bleakworth's facilities, but they claim that Edvard has forged the charges against them. Aarhant has found some sealed documents amid the wreckage that may prove this, if you dare to open them...
Aarhant dares you to open your Uncle’s sealed document.
Aarhant encourages you to oppose your uncle Edvard.

OR:
Open Sealed Document on your ship
In case you have decided to open the letter, you will find it in your ship.
Eli wants Alwin, a former prisoner, found, so his investigation into your father's death can proceed.
Eli Bleakworth invites you to investigate the circumstances of your father's death.
Alwin admits it was he who killed your father, and made it look like suicide.
Eli is concerned the security of his prison is compromised, and will speak to you later.
You delivered a letter to Eli Bleakworth, prison governor. There’s funny business between he and Edvard, of which you now are part.
The prison governor asks you to transport convicts to your Uncle’s island.
Eli reminds you the delivery to Edvard is urgent.
Eli Bleakworth asks if you are ready to hand over your delivery.
Although he now controls your father’s assets, Uncle Edvard is insisting you pay for your father’s funeral. Hannah is rightly furious, but hopes a supply of Schnapps will make him go away.
Edvard reminds you of the debt you owe him for your father’s funeral costs.
Edvard forces you to repay him.
Edvard is impatient for the funeral payment.
Edvard is satisfied with your debt repayment, for now.
Produce [Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] for Edvard to pick up
Uncle Edvard's ship is waiting in your harbour to pick up 4 tons of schnapps. You have to store at least 4 tons of schnapps in your trading post or warehouse to be able to repay Uncle Edvard's debt.
You could also repay the debt faster if you stop delivering schnapps to your farmers: Pause the consumption of schnapps in any farmer's residence building. However, they won’t like it.
Edvard asks if you are ready to hand over the schnapps.
Although he now controls your father's assets, Uncle Edvard is insisting you pay for your father's funeral. He is still not nearly satisfied and demands you deliver the next payment in work clothes.
Edvard asks you to deliver Work Clothes as your second debt repayment.
Edvard is impatient for the delivery of Work Clothes.
Edvard is satisfied with your debt repayment, for now.
Uncle Edvard's ship is waiting in your harbour to pick up 4 tons of clothes. You have to store at least 4 tons of clothes in your trading post or warehouse to be able to repay Uncle Edvard's debt.
You could also repay the debt faster if you stop delivering clothes to your farmers: Pause the consumption of clothes in any farmer's residence building. However, they won’t like it.
Edvard asks if you are ready to hand over the clothes.

Although he now controls your father’s assets, Uncle Edvard is insisting you pay for your father’s funeral. Sir Archibald Blake has informed you that your Uncle has registered this debt officially with the Queen, preventing you from acquiring a shipping license until it's settled. To make things worse, he is asking you pay him in sails, of all things.
Edvard wants a third funeral repayment, this time in sails.
Edvard sizzles with rage over the lateness of your third repayment.
Edvard seems intent on making you his dogsbody.
Uncle Edvard's ship is waiting in your harbour to pick up 4 tons of sails.
Edvard asks if you are ready to hand over the sails.
Edvard demands that you pick up the cargo from his shipwreck.
Edvard's ship crashed near your shores and is demanding you salvage the wreckage as your next errand to settle your debt to him.
Pick up [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] from Prison Transport wreck
Pick up [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] from Prison Transport wreck
The Castaways where headed from Edvard's island to the prison island. Search the sea to find them.
You can click on the quest in the quest tracker to move the camera to the position where the castaways should be located.
Edvard offers to clear the debt if you deliver the men to prison.

You have rescued your Uncle's prisoners from the shipwreck as they were being transported to be convited in Eli Bleakworth's facilities. They claim to be entirely innocent, but you Uncle has promised to lift your debt if you complete their delivery to prison...
Edvard is irritated you haven’t delivered his prisoners yet.

EITHER:
Bring Edvard's Political Prisoners to Eli Bleakworth
In case you have decided to do what Uncle Edvard told you, instead of opening his private letter, then bring the political prisoners to prison. Uncle Edvard promised to clear your debt afterwards.
Eli Bleakworth's prison island should be close to the Queen's representative Archibald Blake's island.

Sir Archibald Blake has informed you that your Uncle has officially registered your debt with the Queen, preventing you from acquiring a shipping license until it's settled. It is unclear how or when will this be though, since your Uncle seems most reluctant on letting you escape from his grasp.
Sir Archibald reminds you that your debt hinders you from getting the shipyard license.
Wait for Uncle Edvard's debt requests to get Shipyard License
Sir Archibald Blake is curious to know what brings you here.
Your cousin says Edvard’s workers are willing to jump ship for you.
The people of Bright Sands are not at all happy with your Uncle's oppressive conditions and are willing to join a fairer employee. Find the rioters and convince them to join your company.
Find more Rioting Mobs [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] in Edvard's City
Your cousin is wondering how to leave Edvard's island.
A distant camera view (mouse wheel) is giving a better overview.
Mobs have been observed around the foundation of the "World Fair".
A castaway approaches you.
The Editor would like to use a photo of your shipyard for the newspaper.
The Editor is impressed about the great composition of the photo.
Finally, your first shipyard! What better news to open the first issue of your city's newspaper? The Editor asks that you take a picture of it, one that every man and woman in Ditchwater will see.
To take a picture of your sailing shipyard, start the photo mode by clicking on the photo button in the quest tracker.
The shipyard has to be within the photography frame. You can use keyboard arrows to adjust your camera's position.

Edvard's newspaper editor is also done with having to jeopardise his work in favor of your Uncle's twisted propaganda. He is glad to lend you a ship to take your new followers home, provided you employ him as well.
The newspaper editor wants to leave Edvard as well, offering his ship for the passage.
Select the Editor's ship at Edvard's Harbour
Wait until the Editor arrives at your harbour
Select the Editor and his crew at Edvard's Harbour
It looks like there is someone in front of Edvard’s trading post who desperately wants to get your attention .
Official licence legally enabling you to trade with other parties.
Your father's former associates, who claim to have been wrongfully accused.
An order assigned to Prison Governor Bleakworth to handout a 'delivery'.
Knows how to handle dynamite.
A group of men stranded at sea.
It bears Uncle Edvard's seal. Should you open this private correspondence?
Uncle Edvard wants to send political prisoners to Prison Governor Eli Bleakworth.
Flotsam found at Edvard's wrecked prisoner transport ship.
This ticket is bringing us home.
Edvard thinks you are trying to undermine his business, and is embarrassed for you.
Edvard informs you that as Samuel’s heir, you must pay for his funeral.
Hannah is angry that Goode & Sons has not offered to foot the funeral bill.
Hannah wants to show you the news from Bright Sands.
Hannah is shocked at Edvard's news and impact on your reputation.
The Editor congratulates you on the publishing of your first news edition.
The Editor starts to work on your newspaper.
The Editor continues the work on your newspaper.
Hannah is outraged at your Uncle's abusive demands.
Hannah is shocked that Edvard is asking for so much to pay for the funeral.
Hannah doesn’t think Uncle Edvard will ever write off your debt.
Mr. Sterling thanks you but seeks further guarantees of protection.
Mr. Sterling accuses Edvard of falsely condemning innocents to prison.
Aarhant has discovered a sealed document from Uncle Edvard.
Hannah is delighted you now have clearance to build a shipyard.
Eli Bleakworth thanks you for delivering Edvard’s prisoners.
Edvard condescends to relieve you of your debt.
Sir Archibald duly awards you your long-awaited shipping licence.

Dear Governor Bleakworth,

More of the traitor Samuel’s conspirators. Crimes and sentences as follows;

Ernest Sterling – Use of foul language – 16 years with hard labour.
Verity Goodheart – Impersonation – Transportation to the Antipodes.
Elias Noble – Writing a threatening letter – Life imprisonment
Honora Decent – Character assassination – Life imprisonment
The judge saw very well my view, that any lack of proof they conspired with a traitor was, in itself, evidence they hide something. All things considered, his verdict could have been far worse. While I am under no obligation to explain such details, I thought that as a fellow dispenser of justice, the facts of the case may be of interest to you.

Sincerely
Edvard Goode
(Edvard) Goode & Sons Ltd.
Hannah recognises the prisoners to be your father’s most trusted associates.
Aarhant thinks it obvious Uncle Edvard is trying to get rid of his critics.
The Decision
Do you really want to open the sealed document?

Dear Governor Bleakworth,

More of the traitor Samuel’s conspirators. Crimes and sentences as follows;

Ernest Sterling
Use of foul language – 16 years with hard labour

Verity Goodheart
Impersonation – Transportation to the Antipodes

Elias Noble
Writing a threatening letter – Life imprisonment

Honora Decent
Character assassination – Life imprisonment

The judge saw very well my view, that any lack of proof they conspired with a traitor was, in itself, evidence they hide something. All things considered, his verdict could have been far worse. While I am under no obligation to explain such details, I thought that as a fellow dispenser of justice, the facts of the case may be of interest to you.

Sincerely,
Sir Archibald is disturbed to hear about Edvard's judicial practices and lifts your debt to him.
Sir Archibald writes off your debt and hands you your shipping licence.
Edvard is furious that you snitched on him and Sir Archibald has written off your debt.
Mr. Sterling thanks you for all you have done for him and the others.
I'm sure people would take more of our ships if they could. There can be little harm in trying!'

Now that you built your very first ship, you have to sell it. Extending your customer network is the best way to increase your reputation and your opportunities. The Queen's ambassador Sir Archibald Blake may be interested
Hannah instead advises you to trade with Madame Kahina for exotic goods.
Madame Kahina can just offer you money now, but promises to bring a payment later.

OR:
Sail schooner to Madame Kahina, select it and sell it

Progress and industrialization go hand in hand with the production of steel. The ships Sir Archibald Blake demands will need weapons, and this requires steel. Hannah is sure the island she purchased has an iron deposit site, although it looked hard to reach. She wants you to locate the iron deposit sites on the island, so a plan can be established.
Hannah asks you to find an iron mine to produce steel for ship weapons.
Hannah reminds you to find an iron mine to build the warships you need.
Hannah regrets that the iron mine lies out of reach, and wonders if there is a solution.
Contact the Prison Governor Eli Bleakworth
Iron deposits have been located in the north-west of Ditchwater.
Constructing a tunnel with the help of an expert is the only way for you to access iron mines.
Hannah wants you to pay the ransom for a tunnel expert and bring him back.
Hannah reminds you about getting the Tunnel Expert.
Hannah wants you to start the tunnel construction soon.
Hannah congratulates you on enabling the industrialization on your settlement.
Pay the ransom for the following specialist and bring him back:
Socket the Tunnel Expert to Headquarter to unlock iron mine:

You have found a suitable weak spot in the mountain. But Hannah will not allow you to fool around with dynamite yourself. While you and the workers prepare the scaffolding on the mountain, your sister wants you to find your father's acquaintance specialized in demolitions. He is still living on Edvard’s island.
Hannah is furious at Aarhant and you for planning to set up the dynamite yourself.
Hannah insists that you find your father’s demolitions expert in Bright Sands.
Hannah reminds you the demolitions expert lives somewhere in Bright Sands.
Search for Demolition Expert's Dynamiteshop near Edvard's wood production
The Demolition Expert's shop is located in the bleak area near Edvard's concrete factories.
The roof of the shop is as red as the dynamite itself.
Prisoners all look the same, but the Dynamite Expert is the one with the best education.

Hannah encourages you to get things moving so the iron deposits can be reached. You should talk to the demolition expert and provide him with all the necessary details to get the job done. The demolition expert did not seem to take a liking to you and your sister. It makes Hannah wonder why, but she is glad he is willing to help us out.
Hannah wants you give the newly-arrived demolition expert a warm welcome.
Hannah reminds you to brief the newly-arrived demolitions expert.
Talk to the Demolition Expert waiting at your harbour
The demolition expert Thomas N. Ticker questions the difference in working for you or Eli Bleakworth.
Thomas N. Ticker disapproves of you trying to build a second Bright Sands.

Your business partner Sir Archibald Blake emphasized the importance of military ships in the current time and circumstance. Trade ships won't get you very far. Construct a steel factory now to prepare for weapon production.
Hannah wants you to start producing steel to forge weapons for Archibald's commission.
Hannah reminds you to start producing steel.
Establish steel production on your island.

After learning from Sir Archibald Blake that you should talk to Isabel Sarmento in South America, Hannah mentions you will need a frigate, a ship that is better equipped to take on an expedition like that. However, your people do not have the knowledge on how to build such a ship. Hannah wants you to focus on attracting Artisans for the construction of the frigate.
Hannah insists you build a frigate fit for the dangerous mission to the new world.
Hannah reminds you a frigate is needed for your mission to the new world.
Attract Artisans to your city:
Build a Frigate:

Hannah highlights the importance of producing the ships for Sir Archibald Blake, now that you have regained access to the iron deposits and can start producing steel. Turning the Queen’s ambassador into a satisfied customer will be crucial for the successful re-establishment of father’s shipyard company.
Hannah reminds you to start weapon production for the ordered military ships.
Hannah is motivated to now start constructing the military ships for Sir Archibald Blake.

Hannah is eager to look through father’s diary. Father was a smart man, and Hannah is convinced that by going over his notes, you will be able to learn something regarding the false accusations and where to look next.
Hannah is certain your father’s diary will explain everything.
Hannah can hardly believe you would delay examining your father’s diary.
Open Father's Diary on your ship
Hannah is shocked and relieved to know that your father might have been manipulated.

You learned that father was threatened by a group holding up a mysterious symbol. Hannah believes this symbol to be the key to everything, and suggests finding someone able to help. She proposes taking father’s diary to a longtime friend of father, Madame Kahina, who has an extensive knowledge on these kind of things.
Deliver Your Father's Diary to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ExecutionObject]) Text]
Hannah wonders if your father's diary contains any crucial information on your father's story.
Hannah reminds you about looking into your father's diary.
The New World and all its mysteries await you.
Hannah advise you to start the travel to South America.
Hannah reminds you to go to South America.
Go to the world map and complete Expedition [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

Sir Archibald Blake explained that the New World island Prosperity was sold to a rebel movement leader named Isabel Sarmento. However, since the deal was signed, Isabel has been in hiding. To get to the core of your father's accusation, you will need to find Isabel Sarmento in the New World. Hannah is excited to go on this expedition.
Hannah wants you to carefully plan the expedition to find Isabel Sarmento.
Hannah hopes Isabel will be worth the effort it took to find her.
Complete an expedition to the New World via the world map:
You may get a geotechnician for the tunnel only if you help Eli on an investigation on Edvard.
The Prison Governor wants you to investigate on living conditions on Edvard's island.
The Prison Governor reminds you about the investigation.
The Prison Governor is surprised by Edvard's behaviour and enables the ransom payment for you.
Take pictures (select banners) of the current situation on Edvard's island:
Only a demolitions expert will enable you to complete the mountain excavation, and establish a safe connection to the iron mine.
Eli Bleakworth doesn’t mind you taking this prisoner off his hands.
Eli Bleakworth suggests you hurry and take your prisoner away.
Command the Prison Governor’s ship to your island
Eli Bleakworth asks if you can pay the bail of $5,000.
Wait until the Demolition Expert arrives at your harbour

Aarhant proposes a solution: Using the leftover dynamite to blow up the mountain and regain access to the precious iron deposits. You should start by looking for a weak spot in the mountain, or else you will not get through.
Aarhant proposes blowing a way through to the iron deposit.
Aarhant reminds you the mountain must have a weak spot.
Aarhant thinks this abandoned mine entrance will work as a starting point.
Aarhant is complimenting you on the progress.
Aarhant is looking forward to a professional doing the blasting.
Select the [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Object]) Text]
Complete the first phase of the excavation site
Finish the last phase with the help of Demolition Expert
Aarhant is amazed by the explosion.
Link the excavation site to a warehouse to support it with resources.

By following the lead of Thomas Ticker, Aarhant found that your father’s murderer was hiding in a cave westwards. Aarhant wants you to attack the murderer’s ship and confront him, in an attempt to reveal the truth and what really happened to your father. Aarhant stresses that you not let the murderer get away!
Aarhant urges you to attack the ship.
Aarhant presses you to act quickly if you are to avenge your father.
Sink your father’s killer's ship
Keep moving helps to avoid the damage of the flame-thrower.

Aarhant is frustrated to run into a dead end, but urges you to be hopeful and look through the pieces of wreckage to find anything at all that might help prove your father’s innocence. There has to be something.
Aarhant recommends searching the wreckage for clues.
Aarhant urges you to extract whatever you can from the wreckage.
Find useful flotsam [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Aarhant didn't find anything useful in this barrel.

Now that you built your very first ship, you have to sell it. Extending your customer network is the best way to increase your reputation and your opportunities. The trader for exotic goods Madame Kahina may be interested.
Aarhant would like you to trade the ship with Sir Archibald.
Sir Archibald values the trade, and will send you a specialist later on.

EITHER:
Sail schooner to Sir Archibald Blake, select it and sell it

After the demolition expert learned about your honest and upright intentions, he spills that he has important information for you: Your father was killed in prison, it was not suicide. He says the murderer could flee from prison before you came to take the demolition expert to your island. The murderer is supposed to receive constant supplies from a smuggler, trading at Madame Kahina's harbour. You have to follow that lead.
Aarhant advises you to follow the smuggler ship.
Aarhant urges you to extract whatever you can from the wreckage.
Sail to Madame Kahina's lighthouse
Follow smuggler ship undetected to your Father's murderer

Keeping the right distance is the key to success.
Items and cargo can manipulate the ship speed.
Extending your customer network is the best way to increase your reputation and your opportunities.

Madame Kahina is reminding you about the beams delivery.
Madame Kahina is happy about your delivery and predicts long, fruitful partnership with you.

Hannah reminds you to go and see Kahina.

Sir Archibald Blake read your newspaper about your very first shipyard. He directly issued a bulk order of ships from your striving company. He says the Queen needs a lot of ships since she is about to sail to the New World, to take back the island Prosperity which your father unlawfully sold.
Sir Archibald Blake read your newspaper and issues a bulk order of ships for the Queen.
He says that support for the Queen might be a benefit in your relationship.
Sir Archibald Blake thanks you very much for the delivered ships.

Sell Frigate [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] to Sir Archibald Blake

It turns out Hannah’s gut feeling was right: Madame Kahina was able to identify the symbol and link it to a dangerous New World organization known as The Pyrphorians. Since the diary also states that your father did not unlawfully sell the New World island Prosperity, Hannah wants you to bring the diary to Sir Archibald Blake immediately. This it might reverse the Queen's accusations of treason towards your father.
Hannah asks that you take the diary to Sir Archibald at once.
Hannah urges you to take the diary to Sir Archibald.
Deliver Father's Diary to Sir Archibald Blake

Sir Archibald Blake has placed a crate with a gift at his harbor pier

Pick up crate at Sir Archibald Blake's harbour
You decided to help the escapist escape, while not knowing exactly what scares him.
Aarhant wants you to escort the ship of the escapist.
Aarhant prefers to remain vigilant until the escapist's ship reaches its objective.
The escapist thanks you for saving him from his assailants and gifts you your father's diary.
Confront Archibald.
Only a demolitions expert will enable you to complete the mountain excavation, and establish a connection to the iron mine.
Eli Bleakworth doesn't think you will find somebody of worth here, but doesn't care.
The Expert’s wife reminds you to look for her husband in the prison.
Select the Demolitions Expert in the stone pit at Prison Governor's island
Pay 5000 credits bailout at Prison Governor's lighthouse
Hannah is excited to receive such a large ship trade order.
The demolition expert wonders if you might be able to change things for the better.
The demolition expert Thomas thinks about whether you can bring back Samuel's spirit.
Thomas admits you have the same type of eyes as your father.
Mr. Ticker is impressed by your efforts and achievements, honoring your father.
Thomas starts to see the good in you.
Hannah tells you about your next goal: gain access to iron mines.
Hannah wants you to find a specialist to help digging a tunnel to the iron mine.
Madame Kahina warns you the symbol belongs to a dangerous sect known as the Pyrphorians.
Madame Kahina didn't know your father was contacted by the Pyrphorians.
Madame Kahina urges you not to go to the new world, home to the Pyrphorian sect.
Sir Archibald reveals that the Pyrphorians are also a danger to the Queen.
He admits it is not clear how your father is involved in this matter.
Sir Archibald explains that your father sold the infamous island Prosperity to a rebel named Isabel Sarmento.
He states that Isabel is in hiding and that you need to find her.
The demolition expert Thomas N. Ticker despises it to be handed around like goods.
Mr. Ticker disapproves of your useless ambitions.
The hooded man threatens to kill you just like he killed your father.
Aarhant is surprised the killer would admit his crime so easily.
Mr. Ticker opens up to you, admitting he kept the secret of your father having been murdered.
He explains that your father's killer hides somewhere.
Mr. Ticker hints at a smuggler bringing supplies to the murderer.
Hannah’s suspicions regarding the circumstances of your father’s death are confirmed.
Aarhant is frustrated that the killer has died without giving you an answer.
The killer’s last words appear to be a warning.
Hannah realises your father's trouble stemming from the island's sale.
Wormways Prison— A first terrible night!

My island, Prosperity, is sold. That is all I can puzzle of my arrest, and present circumstance, shackled between these cold grey walls. Tomorrow I resolve to make my case again to Mr. Bleakworth, who today so cruelly refused me a proper explanation. Now I must try to sleep, and can think of nothing but my poor Hannah, and the other, so far distant.
Wormways Prison – Light through the bars.

With daybreak comes clarity. Prosperity was sold to the infamous rebel 'Sarmento' – and I must be the last to have heard of it! The Queen, the nation, is up in arms, that the jewel of the new world is lost!

The guards, from whom I heard all, thought me playing some trick! Yet it is I who am tricked; duped of my island by persons unknown! Although it can only be the same persons that came to me one ominous day, masked and embroidered with eldrich symbols. They pressed me towards a sale. But I shut the door hard I tell you, and bid them good-day!
Wormways - A third night, and alas not the last.

I have today begun the process of gathering evidence in my defence. Hannah was here, though they did not let her stay long. She gives me hope that a full and unmitigated pardon is possible. Years of loyalty count in my favour, but the very idea that I may have betrayed my Queen weighs heavily upon me. Even if the dark clouds of scandal pass, they may forever have damaged our family’s prospects.
Thomas N. Ticker sees no purpose in trying to impress your father after he has died.
Mr. Ticker admires your effort.

Isabel Sarmento needs your help to shelter her people and hide them away from the Pyrphorian threat. With this purpose, she has transferred La Isla to you. She asks that you start by providing asylum for her refugees. Maybe then she will be able to trust you with the Prosperity papers.
Isabel agrees to help you once you help them.
Isabel asks that you prove yourself trustworthy.
Shelter [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] on La Isla

The Pyrphorians have Prosperity terrorized and overworked to the brim of exhaustion. Isabel Sarmento asks that you go there to find her debilitated refugees and smuggle them away to La Isla to recover.
Isabel asks that you tend to Prosperity's sickly refugees on La Isla.
Hannah wonders what Prosperity looks like.
A jornalero rejoices on leaving Prosperity and the Pyrphorians' yoke.
A jornalero hopes it is finally safe for them on la Isla.
Pick up [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] from Prosperity Island
Isabel Sarmento asks if the sick refugees are ready to disembark on La Isla.
Deliver [Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] from Prosperity Island to La Isla
Still more people suffer every day under the Pyrphorians' clenched fists. Your haven on La Isla must expand if you are to accommodate them all.
Isabel pleads for you to expand to shelter more people on La Isla.
Isabel is grateful to you for aiding her people.
A sudden outbreak of fires plagues La Isla. It all seems a little too attuned to be unrelated. Still, before you can think of the cause, a fire station is required to put them all out.
Hannah finds the multiples fires a strange coincidence, and asks you to build a fire station.
Put out all the fires on La Isla
Check the whole island, not just the city center, for fires and build firestations near burning buildings.
Your officers have uncovered the arsonists and are ready to apprehend them at your command. Find them around the market and rid La Isla of their troubling torchings.
Isabel prompts you to capture the Pyrphorian spies with the help of the police.
Find [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] Pyrphorians to stop the arson
Isabel is happy you got rid of the arsonists.
Zoom in to your city center and search people with torches.

Pyrphorians are a very real threat to La Isla now that they know you are sheltering Isabel's people there. After the wave of conflagrations and attacks on refugee transports, Sarmento is rightly wary that they may strike soon again. She asks that you bring two frigates to their shores to keep the citizens safe.
Isabel fears her people might be in danger.
She asks you to build up your military defenses to protect them.
Construct Frigates [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] in The Old World and transfer them to The New World
Sarmento congratulates you and is looking forward to fighting alongside you.
There is no Iron for Weapons in the New World. Construct Frigates in the Old World, or bring or trade Weapons in the New World.
You can transfer ships from the Old World to the New World by clicking the worldmap button in the top right of a ship's menu.
The Pyrphorian don't seem to let go of you, they keep attacking. Because of this, Isabel strongly suggests to bring more military ships to this region to be able to defend yourself.
Isabel instructs you to bring even more ships to this region since Pyrphorian attacks intensify.
Trade [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData(100440) Text] with Isabel Sarmento.
Isabel thanks you for the ships and hands you the payment for them.

Only the Prosperity's sale contract will prove not only that it was not your father but an impostor who sold the island to Sarmento, but that she was coerced to make that deal by the Pyrphorians. You must chase the thieves and retrieve it to stop the Queen from arresting Isabel and her people.
Isabel realises the Pyrphorians have stolen Prosperity's contract.
Go to worldmap and complete Expedition [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Sarmento confirms that the conflagrations on La Isla are likely to be the Pyrphorians' doing. Police officers will keep their eyes peeled for any of their masked arsonists if you build a station.
Isabel encourages you to build a police station to arrest the Pyrphorian arsonists.

The sick citizens of Prosperity will not resist much longer. Too weak to continue working at the pace the Pyrphorians demand, they are doomed unless you bring them to La Isla to rest and recover in peace.
Isabel worries the ill on Prosperity will perish unless you bring them to La Isla.
A jornalero begs you to rescue them from slavery.
A jornalero is very grateful to you.
Pick up [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] from Prosperity Island
A masked Pyrphorian commands you to return the people you took.

Pyrphorian assaults have the people of the New World completely terrorized. Isabel will not turn her back on anyone that requests asylum on La Isla, which is why she requests that you expand your settlement on La Isla and prepare for any eventualities with a hospital.
Isabel needs you to expand to shelter all the people running from the Pyrphorians.
Isabel wants to build a hospital to prepare for a potential outbreak.
An obrera thanks you for creating a safe haven for them.
The Pyrphorian threat hovers over the whole region and Isabel's headquarters are not safe anymore. She petitions for your protection in evacuating her people to the safety of La Isla.
Sarmento asks for your help in evacuating her headquarters.
An obrera thanks you for saving them.
Escort at least 1 of Isabel's Schooners to La Isla
The Pyrphorians might have learned of Isabel's plans. Bring all of your ships to defend the escort trade ships.
Flank the escort trade ships on both sides, be ready for attacks from behind, left and right.
While you build more ships and bring them to Isabel's region, she also wants you to enlargen the town even further
Isabel tells you to keep on expanding La Isla for the obreros.

Isabel's comrades were taken hostage to coerce her into working for the Pyrphorians, but now she is confident that you will be able to rescue them from their humid cells on the western archipelago. However, evading the Pyrphorian guards will not be easy.
She asks you to free her abducted comrades from the Pyrphorians.

The Pyrphorian Hostages are ready to get on board of your ship.

There are Pyrphorian patrol ships inside the island atoll. Don't get into their sight radius, or else they will attack you.
Isabel expresses her gratitiude for bringing the missing people back home.
Isabel is under attack! They have discovered that she's been working with you to save the people on Prosperity and they have sent a fleet to burn down her island. You must rush to aid her troops!
Isabel needs your help to fend off the Pyrphorians.

Isabel pleads for your help one last time.

Isabel Sarmento claims it was your father, Samuel Goode, who sold Prosperity to her. The sale's contract will prove it, or otherwise. She keeps it still, but her people's situation is desperate and demands her whole attention. She has agreed to yield the contract to you, on one condition: you must aid her refugees first.
Isabel Sarmento asks you to secure her people before handing over Prosperity's contract.

Having returned from the New World with conclusive evidence that it was your uncle's treason that sealed your father's fate, Hannah is eager to finally confront Edvard in Bright Sands and learn the truth once and for all.

It is over. The Pyrphorian army has been forsaken, but they have done great damage. Before you can move on, the dead must be mourned. Meet Hannah at the Church in the Bright Sands cemetery for your Uncle's funeral.
Hannah would like you to be there for your Uncle's funeral.

The Pyrphorians have infiltrated your island and are causing chaos all over by setting your buildings on fire! Hurry up and catch the arsonists before it's too late!

The Pyrphorians have taken over Bright Sands! They pulled the strings behind Uncle Edvard's betrayal, causing his and your father's demise. Now, they threaten to turn the Empire to ashes along with everything you hold dear. However deadful their army, you have no choice: they must be stopped!
Sir Archibald says protecting the Queen is of the utmost importance.

Aarhant has the feeling a darker threat looms over the horizon. He asks you to prepare for anything that may happen by building up your harbour defences.

Destroy [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] approaching your harbour

Now is the time to make a dent in the Pyrphorian army! Aarhant prompted you to attack the Pyrphorian patrols that roam the oceans and decimate their numbers. And the cargo they carry might also prove useful against them.
Aarhant advises to debilitate Pyrphorian forces by raiding their patrols.
Aarhant advises not to lower your guard against the Pyrphorians.
Aarhant advises to be wary of the Pyrphorian menace.

Your island defences are suficient to guarantee the Queen's safety and the Court of Justice is ready to hold the trial. Her Majesty and Sir Archibald Blake await your welcome at your harbour before taking their place in the tribunal.
The Queen awaits your welcome.
Welcome the Queen in your Harbour
The Trial Storytext
Preparations for the trial are complete, only retrieving the defendant from his house arrest remains. The Queen has comanded you to sail to Bright Sands to fetch Uncle Edvard.
Pick up Transfer Authorisation from The Queen's Flagship
The Queen wants to hand over the Transfer Authorisation for you to pick up Edvard.
Aarhant welcomes you back from your voyage.
Hannah is furious about Edvard's treason.
Aarhant finds this news interesting, but feels left out.
The Queen expects your Court of Justice to serve the Empire well.
Sir Archibald believes Isabel Sarmento will be the perfect witness for the trial.
Isabel Sarmento agrees to testify on Edvard's trial.
She feels the Pyrphorians will not pay attention to them anymore.
Sir Archibald announces the Queen's arrival.
The Queen waves off Archibald's overly formal introduction.
The Queen is keen to start the trial.
Isabel Sarmento presents herself for the trial.
Isabel Sarmento hopes her testimony will clear their name.
Aarhant is horrified by the Pyrphorians taking over Bright Sands.
The Pyrphorian Grandmaster threatens your family.
Isabel Sarmento vows to fight with you against the Pyrphorians.
The last Pyrphorian acolyte dies.
The Pyrphorian Grandmaster threatens and ridicules you.
The Pyrphorian Grandmaster insults you.
The Pyrphorian Grandmaster refuses to accept defeat.
The Pyrphorian Grandmaster vows to return and get revenge.
Theodora Ticker is finally reunited with her husband.
Thomas Ticker is relieved his wife is safe.
Aarhant celebrates your victory against the Pyrphorians.
Hannah praises you for your victory against the Pyrphorians.
Father is innocent.
The documnet to arrest Uncle Edvard.
Hannah dropped your father's ring at the hilltop funeral, and asks you recover it.
Hannah is relieved, and thinks Madame Kahina may know more of your father's things.
Hannah would like help with a family matter.
Hannah urges you save your father's wrecked followers before they lose faith in your family.
Hannah is delighted father's faithful followers can be part of the family again.
Hannah is dismayed the cries of your shipwrecked followers were allowed to go unheard.
"My God would frown upon sausage, but I must try one. If they ask, I was merely exploring your customs."
Produce the following amount of sausages:
"I want to sample your bread, even if it look heavy as stone."
"God probably frowns at beer too, but I try everything once."
Ensure that you have the following goods in store:
Edvard will give you your father's spectacles as a reward.
Edvard is happy to be rid of something belonging to your disgraced father.
Uncle Edvard disparagingly offers you work.
Oh, you've been preparing for an expedition? How exciting! In fact, I'm itching to set out again, but my ships need urgent repairs. Help a fellow pioneer in need?
The faster we're done, the sooner we can set out!
Thank you, fellow traveler! I'll steer clear of coral reefs this time.
Society is unforgiving with what to do and not do ... but it is most unforgiving to the poor and orphaned. Us oddballs can still help!
Don't let the sneering get you down!
The children are overjoyed! People are wrong about you.

I heard you are going to set on your first expedition soon! How exciting! I am also preparing an expedition actually, and I need some timber to have the damage on my ship repaired. I can't risk sending out a damaged ship with so many lives on board.

Even though you faced some rejection, don't feel down! You just have to stay positive and keep trying. What always helps me cheer up is helping others, maybe it works for you too. You could help out the orphanage!
It must be wonderful to be back on a ship! Now you can help people out even better - I heard a trader lost cargo just close to you!
A ship is indispensable when helping people!
You should have seen the look on the trader's face!
I am glad to see you are doing so well! That ship should really help you. Right now you could use it to perform a good deed. I noticed a ship lose cargo just now, go and help them!
So you've heard of Isabel, the dreamy rebel leader? I so want to support her, can you escort my ship of supplies to her?
Isn't she heroic?
I'm sure this will bring the movement closer to victory!
My advisors finally came around to you, proclaiming things about standing ... but I've always liked you! Do you want to escape the fuss on a sailing trip?
I just told my advisors I'd step out for some fresh air!
And we didn't even need any standing for a lovely trip!

So your father knew Isabel Sarmento too? I really look up to her and how she does everything she can to fight for the rights of the people. I prepared a ship to help, and I want to make sure it leaves safely.
All this talk about social status. Although my advisors might care about these things, nothing changes for me, I always liked you. In fact, why don't we go for some sailing together, right now?
Where did you get a ship?! You look more like a deck-scrubber to me. Or can you disprove society rumours you're a worthless parasite?
A ship, how?! The least you can do is serve me with it.
Amazing, you delivered wood. We're all so proud of you and your ship.
The rumour is true, you have no use.
Independent Isabel makes exploitation of her people so hard, there must be something I can get them hooked on...
Sarmento's Movement must be prone to vice, get to it!
They drown in schnapps, and I in money!
You feeble lefty!
So now you got a ship huh? I bet you couldn't even deliver wood to my harbour. I heard some rumors of how useless you are, and I am starting to think they might be true.

Oh? So you really managed to do something right. It still doesn't prove much, though. You will need to do a lot more to earn the respect of people like myself. You can start by bringing me some more materials.
Surprised they reject you? A squit with not a gnat's cummerbund of reputability? Here's the sort of menial labour you were born to do...
Enjoy rejection while it lasts.
Down on your shins and thank me.
That's the last time I bother rejecting you!

I am not surprised people don't want to deal with you, you have no reputation to prove yourself after all. You should be thankful I am willing to give you work. Speaking of which, go pick up a delivery for me.
Finally risen up to sour the cream of decent society? Look after my rich friends, or I'll ensure you never live it down.
Standing notwithstanding, you have it all to prove.
Licking boots won't get you up the ladder, you know.
Society belches violently in your direction.

The New World seems to be the talk of the day. I am sending a ship there too, and see what sort of beneficial deals I can get out of the locals. But some ex-trading partners of mine have been annoying me, so you are responsible for the safety of my ship.
Isabel Sarmento is a simpering wisp. She needs fattening up if she is to play scapegoat on feast day. The day La Corona are massacred.
Isabel has need of our indulgence...
The turkey is plump, soon the feast can begin!
Perhaps you want to be sacrificed instead?

Isabel Sarmento huh, I don't care too much about what she wants and all that, but anyone fighting those Corona pigs gets my support. I have some unfinished business with them, so I will send a ship her way.
Proud of your standing, ehh, but what does it mean? A poor ship, an aristocrat ship. Destroy both, then come tell me how it help the aristocrats, ehh?
Show me, poor or rich, that they are equal in death.
Wolves are free from the leash to kill as they please.
Perhaps I can appreciate standing... on your tongue.
Rejection is your prison, but destruction the key to freedom. Realise violence, and imagine it is them you destroy.
Come, let destruction release you!
Yes. Life is rejection, so reject life.
You have a sordid fetish for rejection.

All this talk about social status and what it means. Do you know what it really means? Absolutely nothing, all humans are useless creatures. I will let you experience how it means nothing first hand. I marked two ships of owners of different social status.

They turned you down, so what. You know, screw them, when I feel down, blowing things up makes me usually feel better. Why not get back at them while you are at it? Sink one of their deliveries, that should hurt them.
Bright Sands
Prosperity
Ditchwater
La Isla

Chapter 2

Chapter 6
Your advisor Hannah greets you.
Hannah suggests that you settle an island soon.
You just started your company, but you own no island yet. This is your priority task for now.
Hannah is glad that you built your first Trading Post.
Build a trading post on an island that offers basic fertilities: potatoes, wheat, iron and clay.
Islands resources are different from an island to another. Potatoes, clay, wheat and iron are great for a starting island.
You need to approach the beach of the desired island to build your harbor and settle it officially.
To build your harbor, select the ghost of the harbor at the desired location, and select the build option.
Your advisor Hannah greets you.
Hannah advises you to start building your company town.
Your company first requires employees. Start building some houses, a market and some infrastructure for them to live on your island.
Hannah is glad to see your first employees arriving on your island.
Build your company town: houses, a market and some streets are the first buildings to construct.
Residences, market and streets are found in the construction menu.
Your houses need to be build close to the market to have access to it.
All buildings need to be linked to the trading post, else no one will access them.
Hannah worries about your planks stock.
New companies need a lot of infrastructure and buildings for their company town. Construction materials are the corner stone of our company development.
Build a productive planks production chain.
Hannah remarks your new planks industry.
Develop a planks production industry.
All goods are produced with production buildings. You can find them in your construction menu.
You will need a woodcutter who will produce wood for the carpenter to make the planks. Both are required to establish a working production chains.
A woodcutter needs access to a carpenter or to a storage. But the carpenter will require the access to a storage. Your trading post is the first storage you have.
Hannah reminds you to connect your residences to a marketplace.
No one will live in a house if it doesn't have access to a market.
Build a productive planks production chain.
Hannah is satisfied that you finally placed a market for your farmers.
Make sure your farmers have access to a marketplace.
Streets can be found in the construction menu.
Houses will always require an access to a market. Market can be found in the construction menu.
You can place streets by drag and drop.
Hannah is worried one production building can't deliver its goods.
All your production buildings deliver their finished goods to another production buildings, else to a warehouse. If they can't do so, their internal storage gets full and the production stops.
Hannah is glad to see your production running efficiently.
Build a warehouse close to your production buildings or relocate them near an existing storage.

Warehouses are simple storages where all your goods can be delivered. They can be found in the construction menu. But as they are expensive, it's sometimes better to relocate your production buildings around existing warehouses.

A production building can produce goods used by another production building. In this case it will deliver the goods directly to the building using it. It's more efficient to place the warehouse close to the production buidlings producing final goods (planks, fish, schnapps...).
Warehouses share the same storage: all goods delivered to a warehouse are then accessible from all warehouses of the island.
Hannah notices that one of your buildings can't access your Trading Post.
Markets and warehouses require a street connection to the trading post, else they can't access to your island storage.
Hannah is glad to see your infrastructure up and running.
Make sure all markets and warehouses are connected to the trading post.

Warehouses are simple storages where all your goods can be delivered. They can be found in the construction menu. But as they are expensive, it's sometimes better to relocate your production buildings around existing warehouses.

A production building can produce goods used by another production building. In this case it will deliver the goods directly to the building using it. It's more efficient to place the warehouse close to the production buidlings producing final goods (planks, fish, schnapps...).
Warehouses share the same storage: all goods delivered to a warehouse are then accessible from all warehouses of the island.
Hannah suggests that you keep an eye on your people's demands.
The more employees you have, the more demanding they become. If you provide the goods and services they ask for, the houses will welcome more and more employees. But if you don't, they may leave.
Build a productive planks production chain.
Hannah is sure that more farmers will soon join your settlement.
Provide fish to your farmers.
Fishery can only be built at the coast. The ideal location may be close to the trading post, but it still requires a street connection.
Once delivered to a warehouse, goods that are consumed by your people like fish are immediately accessible from the market. Make sure that you have enough stock for your population.
The range of your market and the stock your have determines how good the supply will be for a house. Make sure that those two factors are as efficient as possible, else your people may leave.
The more employees you have, the more demanding they become. If you provide the goods and services they ask for, the houses will welcome more and more employees. But if you don't, they will leave.
Hannah despises the new schnapps demand of your employees.
You second advisor Aarhant suggests that you produce schnapps.
Hannah is glad that you keep your resources for more serious projects.
Aarhant feels alone.
Hannah is worried about what you're doing with your company.
Aarhant is happy you changed your mind.
Aarhant suggests that you start producing schnapps.

Hannah and Aarhant will never agree on some topics, but you choosed to follow Aarhant's voice. Your people sometimes desire some recreation goods, that provide happiness and some additional taxes, but the production will cost workforce and resources. Schnapps is the first production chain of such a comfort need.
Build a productive planks production chain.
Aarhant already saw many farmers smiling without any reason.
Provide schnapps to your farmers.
Schnapps is made out of potatoes. You first need to establish a potato farm, then a distillery.
Farms need fields. Once the farm placed, you need to select the building and pick the field option to place the fields along the main building.
Comfort needs require some workforce to make it run, but the reward in taxes and happiness is high. Yet, you'll find new ways to provide happiness to your people later on.
Hannah is losing her temperance.
Farms are useless without fields and enclosures. If you want to grow plants or raise herds, you need to build the fields.
Build a productive planks production chain.
Hannah appreciates the farmland view you developped.
Make sure your farmers have some fields to work in.
Each farm requires its own fields to produce goods. You can find the construction option by selecting the farm.
Each farm has its own optimal area size of agricultural fieds. But you don't have to reach this optimal size to have the building working.
Farmfields are very small and can be placed anywhere as long as they stand alongside the farm. Yet pastures don't have to be placed alongside the farm, they just need to be placed in its range.
Hannah is obsessed with flames.
Hannah is certainly paranoid about fire, but her worries are not always unfounded. So many wooden huts can easily burn, hence it's safer to have a fire station around.
Build a productive planks production chain.
Hannah already feels better.
Prepare your settlement against city incidents: a fire station will prevent fires.
City institutions, like fire stations, take a bit of time to build. Don't wait for a fire to start to build one, it could escalate quickly.
Fire stations reduce the risk of fire in their reach. Also, fire chances increase for heavy factories and when houses are piled on each other.
Fire stations also automatically extinguish fires. In case the fire rages, you can select your city institution and deploy extra units to face an inferno.
Hannah suggests to improve your housing quality.
Your farmers are completely supplied with all they need, and you have enough of them to start upgrading your houses. Better housing quality will attract a new working class in your city.
Build a productive planks production chain.
Hannah is glad to welcome new employees.
Increase the housing quality of your settlement.
Upgrading a house can be done by selecting the corresponding button in the house menu, or by using the upgrade mode.
Upgrading has a cost: mostly in resources.
Only houses that have reached the maximum amount of inhabitants can be upgraded, if you can afford it.
Hannah advises you to keep an eye on your workforces.
Hannah suggests that you settle an island soon.
You just started your company, but you own no island yet. Building a harbour and settling on an island is your priority task for now.
Settle your desired island: Build your first [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Hannah suggests that you expand the settlement and meet the demands of your employees.

Your settlement is in place. Now you need to expand the city and meet the growing demands in food and clothing of your employees. If enough of them are satisfied and their housing is improved, you can expect new talents working for you, soon.
Basic Food: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Growing workforce: Provide [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Clothing: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% supply of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Renovate the housing
Hannah is looking forward to the industrialization of your settlement.

The new social class, the workers, is really fitting to factory work. Keep expanding your settlement and start the production of steel beams, as those are necessary materials to build powerful factories.
Factory work: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Men of Steel: Have [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] tons of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] in stock
Hannah is worrying about the latent workers movement.
Hard factory work and child labor lead the workers to voice claims and complaints. If you don't want to enter an instability state, you should take care of your security and provide education.
Preventing Riots: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
End of Child Work: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% access to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Healthy Housing: Renovate your workers residences
Hannah suggests to start exploring the world for exotic productions.

With your first artisans in town, your city is now ready to build stronger ships to explore distant lands. If you can reach there, you'll be able to produce exotic, valuable goods to bring back to the Old World. An opportunity no company shall neglect.
Send an [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] to the New World
Day Dreamers: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Hannah recommends to import goods from the New World for your artisans.

The New World benefits from a tropical climate that enables the growth of many different plants. That's your chance to import exotic and expensive goods to Europe, which, with a higher education, will participate in the happiness and social rise of your artisans.
Colony: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] in the New World
High Society: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
New Cotton Fashion: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% supply of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Progression of Science: Build an [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Comfortable Residences: Renovate your artisans residences
Hannah suggests to electrify your settlement.

Engineers can establish electricity networks that can empower your production buildings. If you dig oil from the oil fields and transport it by rail to your generators, not only will your engineers enjoy the night lights, but your production buildings will get a great boost of productivity.
New Black Gold: Build an [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Enlightenment: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% access to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Engineers Demanded: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Hannah is eager to start investing into lucrative production.

With electricity running through your settlement, your company is ready to become one of the major companies in the world. You can start the production of the luxurious pocket watches, and make sure to have a bank for your employees.
Aristocracy: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Luxury Watch: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% supply of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Savings Accounts: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% access to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Somptuous Estates: Renovate your engineers residences
Hannah suggests to start building the World Fair.

Some of your engineers enriched themselves until reaching the highest tier of the society. They will never agree to work, but they would surely invest in worldwide events like the World Fair. It is time to start building a monument, and prepare for the festivities.
Place the World Fair foundations
Stocks for the Inauguration: Save [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] tons of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Access for the Aristocracy: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% supply of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Investors Required: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Finish the monument construction
Hannah is eager to see your city as highest visited city in the world.

The World Fair is ready. This immense building is the perfect place to organize somptuous exhibitions where the greatest minds in the world would bring and showcase their latest inventions, discoveries and constructions. If you can successfully organize an event, you may have access to the most attractive items for your cultural buildings, and become the most attractive city in the world.
Destination of the Richest: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Legendary Artifacts: Organize some exhibitions and reach the status of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Hannah congratulates you on reaching the highest city status.
"Having doubts, old pal? I know settling down was never for you, but let's see where this leads."
"Wherever we go, marketplaces are the heart of the town. Where else would we get what we need?"
"Are you looking to imprison your people in their homes? They need roads to travel!" #3
"Your people and their carriages can't go anywhere without streets. Unless they suddenly sprout wings!"
"Alas, trains in my home do not benefit the common people. But now, you have the chance to make a railroad that benefits everyone."
"There would be little without wood. No ships and no houses. You better look after this now."
"These bags of meat intrigue me, but better for all if you give them to your people." #7
"I frown upon this needlessly strong drink, but it is part of your people's custom and you should appease them." #8
"I know we reeked on the high seas, but there's no reason your people should be deprived of soap." #9
"Have you been out at sea so long that you've forgotten about life on land? You need fields to grow anything."
"Your animals might be destined for slaughter, but this does not absolve you of giving them enough space."
"With no rivers around, your people rely on wash houses, I hear. So where are they?"
"My understanding is that pubs aren't just for drinking, but community. Don't deny your people that."
"Just a spark can be enough to start a blaze! Don't be lenient when it comes to your people's safety."
"Buildings made of bricks can withstand the strongest winds and fiercest fires. You'd be wise to invest in them." #15
"For every situation there is an appropriate garment. Do you expect your people to work in their nightgowns?" #16
"The revival of your father's business is finally within reach. Everything is prepared for a Shipyard, so why the hesitation?" #17
"Be mindful of others' needs. Unhappy followers will turn their back on you."
"How can you reach for the stars when your foundation is crumbling? You need more farmers."
"Just a spark can is enough to start a blaze! No time to waste, let's get help to these people, quickly!"
"As your guardian I must ask you to take protective measures, for your own sake."
"Disease was dangerous enough on our travels, but these people cannot just leave! Let's get them help!"
"You've got loyal followers, but they won't live off goodwill alone. You should see to their well-being."
Islands resources differ from an island to another. This overview shows the fertilities and mines of the island on screen. For a first island, make sure you have potatoes, clay, wheat and iron.
Islands resources are different from an island to another. Potatoes, clay, wheat and iron are great for a starting island.
You need to approach the beach of the desired island to build your harbor and settle it officially.
To build your harbor, select the ghost of the harbor at the desired location, and select the build option.
Drive your ship until you approach an island beach.
Select the harbor at the desired location to build it.
Here is your construction tool. You'll find market, streets and residences for the settlement, and many more here.
Start with a marketplace. As the center of a city, it needs to be placed in an open space, where you want your employees to live.
Your market needs to be linked to the trading post with a street, else your building won't be accessible.
Employees won't come without available residences. These should always be close to a marketplace, along the street.
Residences, market and streets are found in the construction menu.
Your houses need to be build close to the market to have access to it.
Your market needs to be linked to the trading post, else no one will access it.
Some of your employees don't have access to a marketplace. All residences need an access to a close market. Else, no one will want to live in them.
Streets can be found in the construction menu.
Houses will always require an access to a market. Market can be found in the construction menu.
You can place streets by drag and drop.

To deliver their goods, all production buildings need to be connected by a street, either to another production building, else to a warehouse. But if the building is too far away, the delivery won't happen!

Warehouses are simple storages where all your goods can be delivered. They can be found in the construction menu. But as they are expensive, it's sometimes better to relocate your production buildings around existing warehouses.

A production building can produce goods used by another production building. In this case it will deliver the goods directly to the building using it. It's more efficient to place the warehouse close to the production buidlings producing final goods (planks, fish, schnapps...).
Warehouses share the same storage: all goods delivered to a warehouse are then accessible from all warehouses of the island.
All your marketplaces and storages need to be linked to your Trading Post with a street.
All your marketplaces and storages need to be linked to your trading post with a street.
Your farmers are starting to be hungry! You should start producing fish. Fisheries can be built at the coast only.
Your fishery will need to deliver the fish to a storage by road. Since your trading post is your island's central warehouse, you should lay a street between them.
Fishery can only be built at the coast. The ideal location may be close to the trading post, but it still requires a street connection.
Once delivered to a warehouse, goods that are consumed by your people like fish are immediately accessible from the market. Make sure that you have enough stock for your population.
The range of your market and the stock your have determines how good the supply will be for a house. Make sure that those two factors are as efficient as possible, else your people may leave.
