The more employees you have, the more demanding they become. If you provide the goods and services they ask for, the houses will welcome more and more employees. But if you don't, they will leave.
Start by opening the production chain of planks.
You will soon miss construction materials! Place a lumberjack's hut in the middle of a forest. It will produce wood regularly.
Then, place a sawmill close to your lumberjack's hut, and make sure they have a road access. Once the wood delivered, the sawmill will convert it into planks.
Don't forget the street! The lumberjack's hut needs to access the sawmill by road for wood deliveries to happen.
Planks are final goods that will be stored in a warehouse. Make sure a warehouse is easily accessible by road for the sawmill.
Finally, all warehouses require an access to the Trading post to function. Else, no good can be delivered there.
All goods are produced with production buildings. You can find them in your construction menu.
You will need a woodcutter who will produce wood for the carpenter to make the planks. Both are required to establish a working production chains.
A woodcutter needs access to a carpenter or to a storage. But the carpenter will require the access to a storage. Your trading post is the first storage you have.
Your balance is the final result of your incomes and your expenses. Try to keep your balance positive. If you lose too much money, you may go into bankruptcy and lose the game.

One easy way to make fast money is to sell your overproduction. You can select the good you want to sell in the trading post menu and click the desired trade mode, then move the arrow to the stock limit you want to keep; ships will regularly fetch your stocks accordingly.
Some needs are not about goods, but some buildings. A pub will increase your farmers taxes and happiness.
Don't forget to send a discovery expedition as soon as possible. Build a ship and send the discovery expedition from here.
When you select an expedition, you enter the expedition menu. You first have to assign a ship.

You can equip your ship with any good and item you desire. Each of those goods and items have an attribute that can help you during the expedition. Try to match the expected threats of the expedition with those attributes.
To know if your ship is well equipped, have a look at the morale. The higher it is, the more chances you have to succeed in the expedition. Your morale increases with each good and item you equip.
Once you have decided on the ship, goods and items, you can send the expedition. Your ship will automatically acquire the selected goods and items, then go to the worldmap.
During the expedition, regular events will pop up. You have to open them and make decisions based on your equipment, and your instinct...
All farms require some fields. You can build them by selecting the farm once placed. These farmfields need to be adjacent to the farm.
All animal farms require enclosures. You can build them by selecting the farm once placed. They need to be placed in the radius of the farm.
Refinery is a modular building, from which you can place oil wells on deposits.
A farmer has access to all he needs. You can upgrade his housing by selecting the upgrade mode, then the chosen farmer house.
Upgrading a house can be done by selecting the corresponding button in the house menu, or by using the upgrade mode.
Upgrading has a cost: mostly in resources.
Only houses that have reached the maximum amount of inhabitants can be upgraded, if you can afford it.
Military towers are the best way to defend your islands. Military buildings can be placed at the coast from the construction menu.
Influence stock is a resource that increases with your global population. You can check your current available stock here.
Your quest book contains all information related to quests, even some hints to succeed.
Happiness is impacted by many factors, among which some luxury goods... You can check them in the residence menu.
Schnapps provides happiness and high taxes. You can produce some from potatoes.
The schnapps maker will process the potatoes into schnapps.
You can deploy more units to overcome an incident by selecting the option in your city institution.
You can now build a shipyard to construct your own ships! This is the only way to start exploring the world.
You can launch the construction of a ship by selecting your shipyard, then the ship you desire.
Tourism can be a great source of income when your attractiveness is high. You need a visitors harbor to allow visitors to come over.
Your workers houses are ready to be upgraded. If you do so, we will welcome a new social class in the city.
Pollution from heavy industry reduces your employees happiness. You can check the pollution of your island in the attractiveness menu.
Each production building requires a specific workforce. Make sure you always have enough of each.
Furnace and steelworks factories are quite slow. Working conditions can be adjusted per social class or per production chain, to increase the productivity.
You can edit your newspaper front articles at every new edition. It can change your employees behaviour and happiness.
You can launch expeditions. Have a look at the world map to find your possible destinations.
You also have an overview of currently available expeditions here.
All warehouses will share the same storage all over your island.
You can also deal with pirates from the diplomacy menu. This is the place where you can establish trade rights.
You can also deal with pirates from the diplomacy menu. This is the place where you can establish trade rights.
Sir Archibald Blake represents the Queen. He always has some interesting items and goods for sale at his harbor.
Isabel Sarmento is the representative of the Movement in the New World. She also trades at her harbor.
Old Nate likes to salvage things here and there and reassemble them into new items. If you take part in events, this is where you can exchange your event money for unique, special rewards.
Eli Bleakworth is the director of the jail. You can bail a prisonner at the harbor, he will thank you by serving for your company.
Madame Kahina has access to the products of the world. This is where you can trade exotic goods, but for a high price...

Bente Jorgensen is a young woman who is totally into animals. She inherited her family's company. As a rival, she will expand just as you do. You can negotiate and interact with her through the diplomacy menu.

Princess Qing is part of an eastern royal family. She runs her family company subsidiary in the Old World. As a rival, she will expand just as you do. You can negotiate and interact with her through the diplomacy menu.
Willie Wibblesock found a cursed treasure which enabled him to found his own company. As a rival, he will expand just as you do. You can negotiate and interact with him through the diplomacy menu.

George Smith is a deaf former miner who climbed the social ladder after receiving education from a noble and inheriting his company. As a rival, he will expand just as you do. You can negotiate and interact with him through the diplomacy menu.

Beryl O'Mara made herself with illegal deals and a strong charisma. Today she runs her own company, which looks more like a mafia organization. As a rival, she will expand just as you do. You can negotiate and interact with her through the diplomacy menu.

Carl Leonard von Malching is the last member of a ruined family who could make himself as a robber baron owning a big company. As a rival, he will expand just as you do. You can negotiate and interact with him through the diplomacy menu.

Artur Gasparov is an architecture lover who runs his own company for the sake of beauty building. As a rival, he will expand just as you do. You can negotiate and interact with him through the diplomacy menu.

Alonso Graves is a dangerous, not trustworthy war hero who betrayed his nation to command an army of rebel, which he organized as his own company. As a rival, he will expand just as you do. You can negotiate and interact with him through the diplomacy menu.

Admiral Vicente Silva is an admiral from another empire, fighting to conquer the lands in the Old World. As a rival, he will expand just as you do. You can negotiate and interact with him through the diplomacy menu.
Lady Margaret Hunt inherited her former husband's company. As a rival, she will expand just as you do. You can negotiate and interact with her through the diplomacy menu.

La Fortune is a pirate from the New World, a fidel support to the Movement cause. He won't expand but hunt you down on the seas with his ships. You can still trade with him at his harbor, if he accepts...
Anne Harlow is a pirate. No one knows where she comes from. She won't expand but hunt you down on the seas with her ships. You can still trade with her at her harbor, if she accepts...
South America offers new buildings to construct.
Oil can be pumped by a refinery, then later converted into electricity.
Place your refinery around oil deposits. You can place oil wells on them from the refinery's menu.
Refineries deliver oil only to the oil harbor. You need to build one and connect the refinery to the oil harbor by railway.
Power plants consume oil to produce electricity. They need to be connected by railway to your oil harbor.

Electricity is given to buildings via the streets. Some production buildings require electricity to function; also your residents may ask for it. Other production buildings will see their productivity increase greatly with electricity.
You can sell your ship to the nearest party by clicking this button.

One clay pit provides enough clay for two brick factories; this is an information that you can determine by looking at the processing time of each building. For now, you should build a second brick factory to optimize your production.
You can upgrade your Trading Post to next level. This increases your island storage capacity.
Building depots in your harbour is another way to increase your island storage capacity.
If your warehouse is being overwhelmed by deliveries, you can upgrade your warehouse to next level. This increases the amount of carts that can be hosted simultaneously.
Your power plant needs to be connected by train to an oil harbor.
Oil can only be transported by railway. You need to connect your refinery to the oil harbor with rails.
You can increase your maximum storage of oil by placing oil storages in your harbor.
A new construction material is required. windows require sand from the coast.
Be patient. Trees are growing.
A new construction material is required. Concrete requires cement from a mine.
The fire risk is increasing with those wooden huts. A fire station is the only building that helps preventing and fighting incidents.
Unhappiness can lead to riots. The police station is the only building that will help you restoring order.
Your people may fall ill with those expeditions and the growing population. Make sure they have a place to heal.
Bricks are a new construction material, but the clay pit needs to be placed on a pre-existing deposit. There must be one on the island.
The clay has to be processed into bricks in a brick factory.
Missing a certain fertility? Trade routes can easily be setup from this menu. This enables goods transportation between islands.
Cotton from South America can be used for fur coats. This exotic good needs to be imported from South America, if you setup a trade route.
You discovered a new region! You can access it from the world map, then by selecting the new session.
If you are missing certain goods, like planks, select the good in the trading post menu and setup the import and amount; ships will regularly fetch your stocks to maintain the stock amount you fixed.
Your artisans now ask for exotic goods. If you don't produce them, you can always decide to trade with Madame Kahina instead.
Some buildings require electricity to function. Place a power plant near them, they will provide electricity via the streets.
Your people now demand clothes. Cloth industry requires wool from a sheep farm.
The Framework Knitters will weave the wool to create the demanded clothes.
Steel beams are the next construction material and mark the beginning of the industrialization. You'll need iron!
You can already start the weapons production. That's essential to build military ships and buildings.
It's better to prepare your defenses in case of attack. Military buildings can be placed at the coast to defend your harbor.
Define districts and bend the rules with the official buildings: equipped with items, they can impact your population and your production.
Your advisor Hannah greets you.
Your advisor Aarhant greets you.
Your advisor Aarhant greets you.
Hannah indicates that some housing can be improved now.
Your advisor suggests to regularly visit the traders.
Your advisor Aarhant arranged a local newspaper.
Aarhant suggests that you settle an island soon.
You just started your company, but you own no island yet. Building a harbour and settling on an island is your priority task for now.
Settle your desired island: Build your first [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Hannah advises you to start building your company town.
Your company first requires employees. Start building a market and some housing for them to live on your island.
Build your company town: place a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Provide [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] for your employees: [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Host your first [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]: [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Hannah reminds you to connect your residences to a marketplace.
Some of your houses are too far from a marketplace. No one will ever live there if you don't provide access to a marketplace.
Supplies for your people: Provide acces to a marketplace for your [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Hannah is worried one production building can't deliver its goods.
All your production buildings deliver their finished goods to another production buildings, else to a warehouse. If they can't do so, their internal storage gets full and the production stops.
Warehouse Access: Connect your production buildings to a warehouse
Hannah notices that one of your buildings can't access the Trading Post.
Markets, public buildings and warehouses require a street connection to the trading post, else they can't access your island storage. Build some streets to mitigate the problem.
Make sure all marketplaces, public buildings and warehouses are connected to the Trading Post.
Hannah suggests that you keep an eye on your people's demands.

The more employees you have, the more demanding they become. If you provide the goods and services they ask for, the houses will welcome more and more employees. But if you don't, they may leave. Make sure your farmers can have permanent access to basic food by building a fishery.
Basic Food: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Hannah worries about your planks stock.
New companies need a lot of infrastructure and buildings for their company town. Construction materials are the corner stone of our company development.
Primary Resource: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Construction Materials: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Hannah worries about your company's balance.
You won't be able to progress further without money. Worse, you may fall into bankruptcy and go bust. Find a way to increase your incomes.
Bring your balance back to positive numbers
Have no debt anymore
Aarhant recommends you to build a pub.
There is no better way to maintain your employees happiness than by providing them with a pub. Currently, your farmers can just work, work and... that's all.
Leisure: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Hannah advises you to expand your setllement.
The more employees you have, the more construction options you unlock. You need to keep increasing your population amount to progress any further.
Host more [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]: [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Aarhant advises you to start an expedition to the New World.
The New World is waiting. The only way to set foot there is to send a discovery expedition.
Send an [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] to the New World
Hannah indicates that your farms have no farmfields.
Farms are useless without fields and enclosures. If you want to grow plants or raise herds, you need to build the fields.
Make sure your employees have fields to work in in your farm.
Make sure your employees have oil fields to work in in your refinery.
Hannah indicates that some housing can be improved now.
When your employees are completely satisfied and the house is completely full with people, you can upgrade your house. This cost always a few construction materials.
Upgrade your houses
Hannah is alarmed about the lack of workforce.

Each production building requires one certain type of workforce: Farmers will work in farms and small handicraft businesses, Workers in factories and mines. If one of your workforce types is negative, certain industries will suffer from lower productivity.
Bring your workforce balance back to positive numbers
Hannah is alarmed about the lack of workforce.

Each production building requires one certain type of workforce: Farmers will work in farms and small handicraft businesses, Workers in factories and mines. If one of your workforce types is negative, certain industries will suffer from lower productivity.
Bring your workforce balance back to positive numbers
Hannah reminds you about the electricity requirement of certain factories.

Electricity was a luxury so far, improving the productivity of the factories. But as new goods get produced, electricity becomes a requirement to run their production. This is the case for the motor and cab assembly lines, the heavy weapons, bicycle and gramophone factories, and the clockmakers.
Provide your [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] with electricity access
Aarhant is afraid that you lose control over your island.

Someone is buying your island's shares. If you don't own the majority of them, you may lose control of your island. Select your trading post and retrieve the shares before your island falls into someone else's hands!
Recover your [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]: [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Aarhant is afraid about the outcome of war.
When reputation turns low towards another party, chances of war increase. But now that you are in an open conflict, you have to be prepared to face the canons and mortars.
Build [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] on your coast: [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Aarhant suggests to increase your influence stock.
Influence is a finite resource that you can invest in various topics. To increase your total stock, you have to reach the next company level by increasing your global population.
Increase your available [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]: [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Aarhant suggests to check your quest book.
All your tasks are compiled in the quest book. Have a look at it regularly, especially if you need help or details concerning a task.
Have a look at your [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Aarhant would like your population to be happier.
Population happiness is not mandatory. But keeping people happy is a good way to avoid problems - and also, you may be rewarded with interesting quests.
Raise your overall [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] to a positive level: [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Aarhant urges you to end the riot.
When your population becomes unhappy, they may start a riot. Riot can grow overtime and become very dangerous for your economy. Find a way to reestablish peace in your town.
End the current [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Aarhant urges you to end the inferno.
Fire will regularly trigger in your city. The risk increases with heavy industries proximity or among wooden huts. A strong coverage with fire stations limits greatly the risk of fire.
End the current [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Hannah suggests to build ships.
You can build your own ships! Once your shipyard constructed, select it to launch the construction of a ship.
Build your first [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]: [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Hannah suggests to build a tourism infrastructure.
With the arrival of craftsman, you now have the ability to build a proper welcoming harbor for worldwide visitors. Visitors will then come regularly, based on the attractiveness of your island.
Build your first [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
"I am awaiting new police officers..."
"You might want to get an impression how your facilities work"
"These sails will help you to deliver stuff in time"
You, lumberjack! There's a bottleneck in my prime opening strategy. I've never enough timber, or scrimshank orphans to fetch it!'
Choo-choo! The locomotive of progress splinters the bones of inefficiency! Deliver wood and steel or I shall derail with impatience!'
I get the apes to two-hundred percent efficiency, and now we lack resources to feed our inhuman machine!?'
"I'm always aware about security in my realm..."
What ambitions could someone like you possibly have for bricks? They're far less likely to go to waste on my grand designs!'
With plenty of potent cannons aimed at my workers, they can remember their place, and my profits can boom!'
I curate an exclusive party for the grotesquely rich - that's me - and damn chocolates are the fashion! I abhor those obnoxious, sticky cubes - you get them!'
Do you know, very few people actually know what real gold looks like? The fools have never seen it! So please, bring me some brass.'
I disbelieve my workers' greedy demands! Maybe some new work clothes will stuff the cloth back in their mouths.'
Lightbulbs, with their bulbous luminescence, shall dangle from every shabby shack from here to Mandalay, that my workers' day-rate lasts all night long!'
My workers will never again complain their food is lacking in texture! Not once have I cut it with sand!'
"Usually, I'm not against some benefitial deals. But if my partner insists on security I cannot say no..."
I don't like the speed at which Cuthbert & co. progress. If a key shipment of theirs were to go missing, I would stand to gain a great deal!'
People I have never before laid eyes upon come to me, a Baron-to-be, and claim I owe money! Make sure we see eye-to-eye on this matter!'
The worthless workers have agglutinated into a 'union'! Better conditions?! Fewer Hours?! I want this profanity dissolved!!'
That nosy news-monger has once again belittled my city. That is the last time he calls my assets small! Skewer him before he scurries away!'
The swine has backed out, claiming he has a better offer. That business is mine! Make sure the shipment never reaches him, and our original deal shall stand!'
"One of my ships was destroyed in a storm. My factories can't wait any longer for the deliveries it had onboard!"
You, chimney-sweep! I have need of an unwashed urchin to scrape up the foetid debris from my otherwise-impeccable sea dunes!'
"Take my property and run, who do they think they are? Amateurish sailors, it would appear. Apparently there are survivors...but what do I care! Bring me back my goods!"
Get me that damn wreckage! Those insufferable legal amoebae won't file my perfectly authentic insurance claim without it!'
My police scooped up more rioters - should be lined up and shot! But no, we've to follow the limp laws of the land, haven't we? Escort them to gaol!'
Imagine getting your mitts on a machine that does a hundred weaklings' work. No more snivelling, or complaining! Keep the dratted ship with its blueprints safe!'
The pigs in my zoo have a healthy appetite! I'll need more potatoes to feed them. Let's see, maybe boiled, mashed or in a stew ...?'
"Oh, I always liked to feed these cute birds! Can you deliver some of them for me, please?"
I can't fathom why people think pigs are simple and ugly. They're highly intelligent! But how do I educate my people ... Oh I know! A parade!'
This island is home to gorgeous dragonflies, factories would surely make their wings sooty! But I do still need the products. Maybe you have spares?'
I planned a surprise for the children at the orphanage! When I was young I used to sneak into the kitchen to get chocolate, you know.'
Those hungry, desperate souls on their long voyage ... I couldn't hesitate, I gave them everything I had. Now I need to restock!'
I need new sails before I can set out! The old ones ... Well, beggars came to me asking for clothes and I had to think quick.'
I cannot abide animals dying for our food. But my polar expedition leaves me no choice ... I shall buy only what we absolutely need!'
All this time I thought shoes made of leather were sad but necessary, when in fact you can use caoutchouc! Isn't that amazing?'
A whaling crew is out drinking in my harbour. I won't force you - but if you don't destroy their ship they will destroy many more lives!'
I can barely believe it, my own advisor stole from our destitute fund! He needs to learn what loss means, even if it means sinking his prized ship.'
Please help us! My expedition hit the cliffs just off the harbour! The crew saved themselves, but not the animals on board!'
A horrible catastrophe! I just learned a visitor ship has capsized, we have an obligation to help the survivors!'
The superstitious sailors threw precious artifacts over board! To break a curse, they said, but that's no way to show respect. Please, retrieve them!'
Visitors are so careless with what they leave behind! The oceans are full of rubbish and it's hurting the wildlife. Let's pick it up together!'
The lives lost in that ship fight a while ago were tragic enough, we mustn't lose more to the dangerous debris. Let's clear the area!'
My advisors are insisting on you as an escort, but why? My expeditions aren't truly dangerous! Oh well, I shall reassure them.'
Cousin Mary cut her visit short after seeing the feline predator enclosures! Maybe she ate something foul ...? Would you bring her home?'
"I always asked myself how an antler would look at my wall."
I am the scrying portal, a mirror to the other realm. But if my legion are to follow me to the kingdom, they must be entranced.'
I need bricks for a little game. I always reassure my troops beforehand, because they fear. I say, ''what doesn't make you stronger, kills you''.'
Ever consult haruspices? You should. Sadly, I find myself sifting through many animals before the truth emerges.'
"Tony, why did you betray me?.."
Milk and blood filled the baths of the ancients. I must cleanse myself, for all our sakes, in the uncorrupted essence of animal.'
How can the sordid contraptions of man compare to nature's gifts? If I give my men bicycles, can they escape starving tigers?'
Fishing requires patience. Patience is hard. And when their skinny little mouths won't bite, it hurts. So I blow them up.'
If we are what we eat, I don't think my legion eat right. Bring me texture, bring me body. Bring me something to get their juices flowing...'
An infant rabbit flops into peril. Heart tense. Eyes wide, but blind from fear. It runs, you follow. You wring its neck.'
"I like exploding things. And this one will surely show some exciting fireworks!"
How can man be so removed from his ancestors that he cannot swim? Go! Help natural selection take its course!'
Rivals to be my mate? Where are their horns, these bulls who do not rut like the beasts they are?! Stab their haunches and passions shall race!'
Burn me. Each scar the cruel, licentious blister that is man. Drown me. I long to swim up from below, a vision appalling yet pure, like a demon.'
Dolphins cavort behind us, fed fish and lies by my sickening simpletons. False Gods! Smash them, and let the dolphins know freedom!'
In time, the sea will rise with the smoke. No Atlantis, just man killing man until the oxygen runs out. I only keep those who float.'
Swells your spleen, doesn't it? Competition. A powerful armada appears, and you just have to scratch the itch. Snap those buds before they blossom!'
Their clocks scream in my mind. Foghorns, pigcrap hawkers. Crumple these trader automata, their schedules will shatter my visions no more.'
"I heard this expedition returned from asia! So there might be some tiger bones on board! I need them to complete my collection."
"One of royal frigates went aground. I heard, it had some heavy weaponry."
Humans like to count, it's so reassuring. Do you like to count? Your coins, your friends? Then don't be shy, help me count these bodies.'
The ordinary fascinate me - peeling back their blindfolds, holding them to the light. I tried everything, but I couldn't make the last ones see. Now I need new ones.'
"A ship sank in the area. I got a ship ready to bring the castaways to safety, just drop them off there."
Let's play a game. A visitor ship will pass through the area soon. I will attack it, and you must defend it. I don't see you succeeding, but surprise me!
"I am really bored, so I thought it would be fun to send one of my strongest ships into enemy waters and watch the show. I will hold you responsible if my ship somehow sinks. "
I am terribly excited to surprise Her Majesty on her birthday... the chocolate menagerie is of the utmost secrecy, we cannot have her finding out any of the intricate little details we have planned!'
Lady Cumbersmythe embarks for the East African uplands, where her researches in cross-cultural musical variations require the distribution of a large volume of Gramophones.'
Her Majesty commissions a munificent banquet for important Antipodeans. We.. er.. neglected to factor in the post-prandial cigar posturing, which is so vital to the success of such evenings…'
A delicate matter. Her Majesty is lately aware of The Movement's ailing cause, and wishes to donate off-the-record. We trust you to keep it all on the quiet.'
I'm an avid wood carver you know. Yes, give me a chisel, a fishtail gouge or a mallet and I am quite content. The thing is, I'm so keen I've run rather short of planks!'
All the way from the equator, I don't blame them for feeling the chill. Her Majesty will be most vexed if we don't warm them up!'
Believe it or not, I used to have a wild streak. Wagered a castle against a fellow, and lost! The rashness of youth! Better do the honourable, and build it, hadn't I?!'

"Her majesty needs to strengthen the relationship with one of her foreign relations. She tasked me with finding the perfect gift we can present during our next visit. I want to present the gift of music from our culture."
First impressions count! It's unthinkable that south sea dignitaries should catch a whiff of piracy during their visit - those bygone days are over!'
Sometimes we are delicate, other times we must pound the cream from the eclair, so to speak. Ma'am's favourites, The Movement, will suffer if enemy reinforcements reach the colonies!'
Her Majesty has lost enough, without also losing King Svalbard as a trade partner. The saboteurs of our once-doughty bond must be met head on!'
You know, the fools stole my least interesting sculptures! Still I'd rather such naive carvings weren't inflicted upon the general public!'
Oh goodness, the treaty cannot be signed unless the storm-wrecked delegation is returned to my harbour and restored with a good dose of smelling salts!'
Oh, er, this is awkward. We wouldn't normally ask you to wade for flotsam. Trouble is, this particular cargo may or may not connect Her Majesty to Isabel Sarmento!'
The Maya expedition was a success, but rough seas have deposited one of Her Majesty's treasures en route. She would be most indebted if you could recover it.'
The Duchess of Powys can be quite lemony with me, but perhaps you could whizz by and explain the jolly mix-up - vigilant times, the sinking of her barge, etc.'
Her Majesty received an alarming missive over second breakfast. Threats to 'undermine' her authority. Perhaps you could bring the matter to a peaceful climax?'
The Movement is back - not that, my bowels are fine - I mean the group to whom Her Majesty may well be somewhat sympathetic. Could you ensure their safe passage?'
Viscount Foxweasel has borne a grudge ever since I smothered him in manure at public school initiation. He plans to sink my exhibition of recent carvings. Can you ensure it arrives intact?'
They are not traditionally a sailing nation you see, the hill-dwellers. Lost last time, and the time before that. Perhaps you can save us, and guide them in?'

A person who has evidence, who can testify, who has certain knowledge (scientist etc).

Can be someone who helped them, has to be escorted out safely - Or someone who has to be escorted in safely

Reason for player involvement: don't draw additional attention with royal escort

Archie needs the players help to escort an expedition he is either about to send out, or that is returning.

The expedition was to gather new types of wood he heard awesome rumors about, in an attempt to find the ultimate carving wood.

However, jealous competitors got word of it too, they might want to sabotage. So the player gets asked to help out.
"Well, regretfully I have to admit that this scum needs some investment. Otherwise who else should work in the mines?"
If every guard had a pocket watch, I would never again feel we are somehow running at the leisurely pace preferred by the ruddy prisoners!'
Dying prematurely in one's cell is the easy way. Since a fair few of the rotters are on their last legs, I need you to help me feed them back from the brink.'
They nearly clawed their way out last night. Every damn cage needs bolstering, if we are to keep humanity's vermin confined!'
It's only a matter of time before the sea is free of pirate-kind. But Her Majesty's mercenaries must have the arms to match them!'
I never drink, but turnkeys must. Do you have lubricant to keep their keys turning smooth?'
Stay here too long, go insane. But some arrive mad, and want cells thick enough not all of us have to hear their frenzy.'
Damnation! My gunboat as getaway? By all means use lethal force, but only if absolutely necessary will you destroy my ship!'
The woman is a blatant criminal who would be dangling from the gallows, if not for lack of evidence. Yes, I know one when I see one!'
Release a life-long fraudster just because he has unscrupulous friends on the royal council? Bend the law, and the law bends you!'
Holy Bibles in which escape tools have been secreted, are extremely unlikely to pass me by. Pursue the smugglers and burn their sacrilegious stock!'
Floating bottles may look innocuous to a lay person, but messages inside facilitate a significant number of escapes. They must be collected for me to smash.'
You might think we have enough slippery characters, but it's for me to see they clean up their acts. Find the missing surfactants or I'll die of this stench!'
We know the H.M.S Murgatroyd was sunk by a detainee of mine. It disgusts me that he is to be released. There must be some evidence against him among the wreckage!'
Three swam for it in the riot. Bring the silly sods back, or they'll drown. They will serve the full sentence!'
This man is to be taken to a place of execution. A kindness if you ask me, but the verdict is apparently contentious.'
The ship carrying a Category A is overdue. Find it and bring him in. I have the isolation block ready, I'm certain he'll feel right at home.'
My superiors have no idea what it's like out here, deep in the filth. Yet I'm obliged to powder their noses. Can I trust you to preserve their blissful ignorance?'
Once a criminal, always a criminal. But the occasional snitch gets ''mercy'', and the others don't like it. I need you to keep the rats from the cats.'
Keep family and friends close. They give us purpose, they guide us. Please take this to some like-minded friends of mine.'
Potatoes are poisonous was the rumour at afternoon tea. I doubt it, but dreadful if true! Perhaps it's worth investigation?'
...then all proceeds to schedule- Oh, hello my young acquaintance. I presently have need of some dynamite, for a household project.'
I believe in slow penance for wrongdoers - counting grain, for example. You see, if even small crimes go unpunished, one's whole world may go to seed.'
I can't bear to know my people feel the chill. All I can think of is drapes for the windows. To keep from them the bitter winter soon to come.'
I make monument to someone special. Have I told you of my brother? He was a fine man, Benjamin. I think on him a great deal of late. A great deal.'
Earl Smedley is a danger to our poor vulnerable Queen! Twelve years ago he crushed my cat beneath his Landau. I have never forgotten.'
"I noticed a ship pretending to be a trading ship, then attacking other ships. Someone has to take care of it before it can cause even more trouble. Would you be so kind?"

"A pirate ship connected to my niece is in trouble. While I don't support what they do, most of them had everything taken away and they were forced down this path, just like she was. I simply cannot ignore family in need."
A plot against our frail young monarch! The ship may seem proper, but do not let yourself be fooled. Kill the snake, and secure our Queen a surer destiny.'
Shocking to hear rumours of dissidents nearby. Such a brazen threat to our inexperienced Queen. Play the patriot and stamp out the growing fire.'

"Someone found the necklace I lost years ago, but now their ship sank. It was a gift from my brother when I was young. An old woman like myself can have a strong sentimental attachment to things bringing back good memories."
"I saw an unfortunate ship get destroyed by a mysterious ship earlier, it looked like it belonged to those Pyphoreans. Seeing these wreckages reminds me of the tragedy, could you remove them dear?"
"A visiting ship forgot some cargo in my harbour. Would you be so kind to pick up and bring it to them my dear?"
"Poor guys, shipwrecked in a storm by the looks of it. I want to get to the bottom of this and ask them some brief questions, after which I will take care of their safety."

"Even though I don't approve of these pirates, I still want to make sure my niece is doing well. I prepared supplies for them and left them at the designated map point. My niece should be waiting for you at the border of the region."

"I tolerate many things, but someone has crossed the line by disturbing my brother's grave and throwing the decorations into the ocean. Could you retrieve them while I think of a proper, deserving approach?"
Her Majesty commends you to those of us on the royal council. It can only serve to increase that trust then, for her to see us sail together, and presume I also trust you.'
Some innocent merchants have had a bit of bother. Could you guide them to my harbour, where they will be quite safe?'

Hunt wants the player to escort a scientist who just made a "great discovery", the greatest discovery. Really. She will be able to save humanity.

She is afraid others might want to stop this or steal the knowledge/ideas, so asks for an escort just in case (do we spawn attackers?)

Maybe royale attackers? Or is this too direct?

She portrays the mission as "for the good of humanity", can't imagine anyone wanting to interfere - then there are a lot of attackers, makes the player wonder if intentions are good.
"While Jean and I have a very different approach, we share a goal in which we face a common enemy. If he does well, it benefits the movement as well."

I have three ships ready to set out and help the people from a recently liberated piece of land. La Corona did not even provide them enough food or good clothes. I cannot wait to take action against these animals, but we have to be patient.
The enemy is using the latest technology, and we have to adapt if we want to keep up. We have been offered engineering help, but we lack the required materials.

The strength of the movement will only increase as we expand our territory. I have my eyes set on certain pieces of land, belonging to private owners. I will need a good amount of gold to compensate them.
La Corona are way out of line torturing and killing local people. Even though we can't openly act, they have to be stopped, I can't bare seeing this.

I have reports coming in of a group of colonial war ships entering the region. I don't know what they are up to, but last time we did not act, things got nasty. I learned the hard way that in these situations its either them or us.

George Smith, a man I deeply respect for his actions, recently helped us out by sending a scout ship. He successfully identified La Corona were delivering weapons. Please make sure his efforts are not in vain.

I am very much against it, but I am afraid not giving in to the current request to take action against an La Corona ship visiting us, will cause internal conflict or even a division. One united movement will be required to win this battle.

La Corona started rapidly construction a huge bridge. This bridge means they have a much stronger position, preventing it is our top priority. I already noticed several ships carrying materials, those are easy targets.

An important, secret weapon delivery got disturbed by an inspection. The ones helping us were forced to drop the cargo overboard to not get into trouble themselves. Luckily I got word of the location.
What is happening here in the region bothers me, more than you can imagine. But engaging in a battle we cannot yet win is not the way to go. These members of the movement tried and failed.

I heard disturbing news from my family. They are in need of medical supplies which they are not getting. I have some ready, including a letter for them, and arranged a good friend who is willing to head there, but she cannot be seen near my harbour.
Sometimes these waters can catch ships by surprise. In this case, I saw a Corona ship get wrecked. I want to have the wreckages of the ship analyzed to understand what we are currently up against.

La Corona complicate everything. These pigs think they own everything, even the region's waters. Just the other day they halted my shipment of trading supplies, and took it all. I arranged the next shipment to be dropped at a designated map point, so this won't happen again.

Bente Jorgensen has her heart in the right place. She came here to help as soon as she heard of the situation. However, the poor thing has no idea what she is getting herself into. I don't want her to get involved.
The empire has been helping us out in secret. Another ship with supplies will soon arrive again, but La Corona have stepped up their presence in the area. I am afraid it will not reach us.
I sent out a ship to gather information on La Corona and what their next move might be. I got word the ship returned with crucial information, and we can't afford to have it travel unguarded.

We managed to get these children away from La Corona. My harbor has been a safe haven for them, but they are still in the middle of conflict. They will travel to a safer place with this ship, and I want to ensure their safe leave.

Pearls, I love threading them. However, my current supplier was acting up, so I told him that he is no longer needed. I want to show him my words have meaning, and that he truly is instantly replaceable.

Looks like I have run out of Champagne. Don't you sometimes wonder how things would look if you made a different decision somewhere in the past? It's so fascinating how decisions result in chains of irreversible consequences.
Customers repeatedly ask me for these Pocket Watches. I don't exactly find them exotic, but seems that I might be able to make good money with them. I would like to try a sample batch.
My next shipment will not be here for a while, and some of my stocks completely depleted. It would be foolish not to take money when I have the possibility to do so.

Maintaining social contacts and status is very important, something you will learn at some point. For this reason I don't want to disappoint an old client, although I don't do these things myself anymore.

An old friend in need reached out to me. He made a huge mistake; told the client it was done without confirming himself. Turns out the target is alive and well, here in the Old World. If the client finds out it could cost him his live.

Under normal circumstances I would just feel sorry for these sad, petty criminals. but they decided to steal from one of my shipments this time around. If I would be dealing with it myself, I would cut off their hands.

I recognized a ship as being part of the organization that once betrayed me. Its presence in the region might be a complete coincidence, but it might have come to track me down, a risk I am not willing to take.

One could argue killing people is never a good thing, but I would say they are wrong. The jobs I took helped the world get rid of some terrible people. But this local assassin is only in it for the money, taking every job.

Suhail Salim Rostamina, a Sheikh with great power and influence is visiting the region. We did some business before, but I want to further invest and refresh his memory. Make sure to mention Madame Kahina sent you!

Years ago I made a mistake and took a job I should not have. It left the wife and children of my target in a bad position. From time to time, I arrange an anonymous delivery for them, containing things they might need. It soothes me knowing they do well.

You show up just at the right time. Perhaps a bit boring, but I have a small job for you. One crate of this client's purchase was accidentally left behind by the ship picking it up. I do miss the thrill of my old life in my moments like these.

Someone I used to know is running from authorities. She needed to get rid of a few pieces of evidence, and notified me where she left them. I am afraid I have to provide them to the authorities, she should have been more careful.

This client requested their purchase to be delivered to their ship rather than coming to pick them up. While small requests like these annoy me, take my word for it when I tell you the importance of gaining people's respect and keeping them close.
I have always been a role-model citizen, so there is nothing to compensate for, but from time to time, I donate things I can miss so they end up with those needing them.
I couldn't explain you why exactly, but an eerie feeling has been bothering me ever since this morning. I can't help but feel something bad is about to happen.
Friends from back home are paying me a visit. These are the type of people at the very top of society, used to nothing but the best. They surely expect a proper escort.
The side effect of providing exotic high-value wares is that it has the tendency to attract certain buyers. The kind that feels too important to travel without escort.
I have a very expensive shipment coming in soon. The value is likely beyond what you can imagine. Point is, it is the kind of shipment one does not allow to travel unguarded.

This lord claims he no longer purchases from me because he is too afraid of pirates to send his ships into the region. An excuse of course, but I knew how to deal with it. I offered him an escort, and guess who is buying again.
I'll come down on you like a tonne of bricks' he used to say. Well let's see who has the last laugh, now we're all grown up eh?!'
Alfred and Filbert are a lovely pair of shillings. Now, I couldn't remember if it were ten tonne or twenty owed. But being gents, they were quick to remind me it was thirty.'
My latest trick is called 'The Devil's Vessel' a fearful extravaganza of sea-fire! Got a bit hot the first time...'specially for the crew, but its getting there, getting there...'
A pocket watch I can guess your card,' is how the trick starts. Shame the cards they keep choosing are the hardest ones to find.'
Asking for gold, I was sure it was the ghost, come for his due. Luckily it's only a brigand, and he gave his word it'd just be this once!'
Lord Flattenflee and I had such a cultured chat, I think he loaded up one too many crates! Haha. I've got loads more, course...but I do need those materials.
I get through quite a few stage assistants...I mean, you know, they leave. Can't take the city lights, the glamour. P'haps if they looked the part, they'd feel the part?'
Woe is me! Jove and Juno converge upon me! Chandeliers above the audience was a genius idea!...as mum always said try and try again!'
Why'd he have to shout out how its done?! Time that bully Astronomo got a huge kick up the interior - it's what mum wouldda done.'
I'm caught between a frog and a toad! Board want off with a dangerous geezer. I'm like the David to his Goliath, but can I leave all that glory to you?'
I may be amazingly powerful, but I'm hardly cruel. Take this darkness off me 'ands, you'll get a reward. Just don't tell the board, alright?'

Whoopsiedaisies, some crates fell into the ocean when I was moving them on my docks. My mom would always tell me to keep things clean. I don't even recall what's in the boxes, so you can keep them for your efforts.

Magic is truly underappreciated. Was just performing in front of the board during the trip, and out of the blue, one ofthem grabs my entire magic box and throws it overboard. He is lucky I am so calm and let it slide just like that.

I was instructed to not look in these boxes, so I will respect their privacy. I just don't understand why the board wants me to store them, they have warehouses too. I also don't get this whole secret drop off thing, they could just bring them here.

Heard of some boxes floating out in the ocean. I tell ya, never underestimate what one might leave floating around. Get them before someone else does, this is Willie's deserved little moment of luck after all this misfortune.

GO AWAY! No no, not you, I was talking to the ghost. I heard one can order a ghost to leave. Salt tends to keep them away too. I ordered a few crates, and even personally secured the shipment, but the ghost threw them overboard!

If you ever want to get business advice from me, I might consider it. Just got a wonderful discount on these goods with minor defects, the supplier just dropped the goods and notified me where, not sure why he didnt just bring them.

You could learn from my networking skills. Met this lovely chap, big scar over his eye. He is so kind to offer and pick up the payment he accidentally forgot. He just needs an escort because he apparently has some enemies.
I could swear I had it just a minute ago, where is my wand?! Good thing you are here, I refuse to travel alone without my wand, not as long as the ghost is out there.

Let me tell you about The Amazing Willie. Helped the board without hesitation when they requested help. Problem is that Amazing Willie is now involved in this conflict, and the board won't help me. My ships get constantly attacked.

I guess I should have read the contract more carefully before signing it. But you know what, I don't mind having to give my close trading partners a free escort with every purchase they make, they are quite lovely really.

I feel it, he is coming for me, the ghost! I need your help getting back to my harbour. I know what I will do! I will head to the lower deck and think about how to work on my tricks while you be on the lookout for the ghost when he strikes.
Last time my delivery of magic supplies got mysteriously attacked. Who would possibly want to do that? I perform for everyone I know, frequently, without them having to even ask or pay for it!
Beryl wants the player to deliver bread to her, so she can feed her network of 'little birds' and reward them for their good work of gathering information.
Beryl needs more Champagne for a party to keep people talking. She thinks it's the best way to mingle with people and catch the latest rumors. Or even make up new ones.

Beryl asks you to deliver concrete to her. She found out that some of her former supporters betrayed her and stomped on her "kindness" with their dirty feet. Now she wants to stomp back on them by burying them to the ground.
Beryl says that there are two things she is really good at: Baking and Business. She would like to combine both for a special delivery and asks the player for his help.
Some people started to spread rumors about Beryl. She asks you for soap so she can wash their mouths and teaches them a lesson.
Beryl asks for tobacco to get people addicted so they would buy more tobacco from her. She wants to regulate the demand.

A former trading partner dared to betray Beryl by spying on her and threatening her street network. He tried to beat information out of some of the children and sold the information to her enemies. Now she wants you to respond by destroying the betrayers ships.

Beryl wants to teach the player about her business and wants him to practice the most useful method to put pressure on a trading partner. She wanted to trade bread (or whatever) but her partner already had enough and declined her offer. She asks you to destroy one of his bread deliveries to raise his demand for bread again

Another trading partner tried to trick Beryl by sending her low quality material. They thinned gunpowder with some fake powder, but she managed to look through it. Now she asks you to bring them their 'payment'.

Beryl mentions an inspector just visited her by surprise and got to see some things he should not have seen. It is of high importance this information does not get out.

I will absolutely not go to prison.

They say piracy is in decline, and sadly, this is true. Unfortunate for local pirates like Anne, and even more unfortunate for their business partners like me. Parties like Lady Vistash, hired to hunt pirates, don't help the case. It is about time to fight back.

Trust is the cornerstone of business relations. Lord Malkov, regular buyer of mine, broke this very trust. Several crates disappeared from my warehouse during his latest visit. Needless to say, I have no interest in further dealing with Malkov, and punishment is at place.

I have many enemies from whom I know what to expect, the problem is unexpected enemies. Just last week I helped out a friend who needed mines. Today one of my ships reported spotting a mine on its route. I want to make sure these are not the mines I provided.

Yesterday the ship I was on, ran into an unexpected inspection. While my crew was standing there I took it into my own hands to throw the crates of illegal goods overboard. I dodged the inspection, but I do need those goods, my buyers are waiting for them.

Good money can be earned by dealing in smuggled alcholic drinks with high tax rates, such as rum, geneva and brandy. However, there is always a risk involved when selling them again. I received an unusually large order, which has my senses tingling, and I am afraid of walking into an ambush.

It is important to realize when someone you believe to be an ally, is your enemy. Bottom line: I am putting someone in my network who I don't trust to the test. I mentioned the route my ship full of riches will travel. If it gets attacked, I know enough, and you can interfere.
Beryl wants to store her money somewhere safe and asks you to escort it out of the area. She does not trust the local bank.
Beryl invited some of her friends to play cards and talk about business that they owe her. She wants you to "escort" them and to make sure that they aren't followed.
If you think we want courage, sharkbait, I'll dice you. Our bellies are good and full o' fire - drink's just something to do as we watch the world burn!'
I'm a pirate through-and-through. What keeps us bound is the code! If my lads give life and leg for the fight, only right they get what's shiny.'
If he has one-leg, one-arm, or three of each, don't matter. I polish what I find. That means you too, dogsack! Equip my fresh blood, or suffer.'
"Don't think I won't strap fire to my breast and charge your throne rooms, if you don't bring me more of it."
Just received big news from my crew. They managed to steal the ship of someone trusted by the queen. With this, we will be able to get very close to her, I can't risk anything happening to it.
Help anne identify some lazy pirates
"Solve this and you will reach knighthood..."
"You reached knighthood, congratulations!"
"Solve this and we can prevent a war..."
"I will grant you one more chance!"
"You will be no longer part of my kingdom!"
An army marches on its stomach, Da Silva wants lots of bread to feed his troops marching west.
The pen is not mightier than the swords, Da Silva orders you to send him weapons to supply is ever extending army.

A Man O'War is truely a sight to behold but much less frightening without the range of cannons on the deck. Send advanced weapons to Da Silva to replace the cannons his pigeons brains workers have damaged.
While it is not the right time to openly fight with his great enemy Andrea Fricke, Da Silva still needs to prevent her from growing strong.
Vicente wants you to destroy the weapons merchants' ships.
Da Silva has studied his enemy fleet and know one of his ship is carrying much, too much, gun powder. Time to blow them up using the new weapon Da Silva has had crafted for the occasion.
There is only one thing that I love about my enemies' weapons merchants: their ships are so full of powder that you just need a spark to create a beautiful firework.
One of Da Silva's ship is transporting highly valuable goods. It needs an escort worthy of the name, Da Silva advices you to be prepared.
How nice to have brought your fleet to the edge of the world, the perfect opportunity for Vicente to attack.
Da Silva's nephew is paying him a visit. The seas aren't safe with all these pirates trying to get their hands on blue blood for ransom. Escort Da Silva's nephew to his city.
Da Silva is strongly displeased. No doubt the kidnapper will make themselves known soon.
The kidnapper have reached Da Silva. Staging a meeting during which he will give them gold against his nephew, he sat up a trap for them. Clean up your mess, destroy them.

Da Silva has invited a foreign princess to his city to conclude an alliance. Nobody must know that she comes, overwise their enemy will be at her throat. Escort her, Da Silva's ships would be too suspicious.
Da Silva is bitter, for his enemies to have known that the princess would be escorted by you it means he surely must have a spy in his rank, he will pay for his treachery.

A ship has left Da Silva's island precipitately this morning, Da Silva is sure the spy is on board for he wouldn't want to be caught and face Da Silva's wraith. Destroy the ship and all its crew, no pity for treator and their accomplices.
Are you a lion or a sheep? Prove your worth to Da Silva, destroy Anne Harlow ships.
The little Anne Harlow seems to have some ressources after all, but nothing Da Silva thinks you cannot destroy, right?
Anne is ready to take her revenge on your pesky attack.
Wipe out Anne Harlow, she has been a bug on Da Silva's paw for too long.
Pick up the new weapon at Silva's trading post
Gasparov world fair design is complete, soon he will be able to show to the world his superior vision ... if only he gets glass.
Monsieur l'Ambassadeur is visiting Gasparov island to decide on future investments, he must be entertained with the best champagne.
Gasparov's personal orchestra refuse to play in the middle of the night to stimulate their master creative process. Phonograph will do to replace them.
Sailors are partying and whoring for days in front of Gasparov island, this does not look great for visitors. Destroy them.
Gasparov needs you to pick up a paradise bird a friend has captured for him. It will look great in the Golden salon.
Gasparov wants to write his autobiography in the most manificient of leather book. Pick the leather and enluminures in the ship werkage.
Despite disliking Old Nate, he has some interesting goods Gasparov ordered to ornate his city. Pick them up at his harbor.
Freddy Chapin is invited to play at Gasparov gentlemen club tonight, the occasion for him to shine in front of la haute societé. Make sure nothing happens to him on the way.
Gasparov has finished to work on the design of the Queen next palace. Bring it to Archibald safely.
Gasparov has bought a marble statue in an aunction but other had their eyes on it. Protect it during its transportation.
Following his shrink advice, Gasparov wants to take some fresh air and be taken on the high seas.
Gasparov thinks his city is better than anything he has seen on the way, he wants to go back.
Farmer would like to give you her aunt unheritance.
Farmer would like to give you something she found while digging her field.
Farmer would like to give her extra production of potatoes.
Farmer would like to give you a seagull she caught.
Nu-uh, too lanky!
His teeth are crooked as a donkey's!
Ugh, look at his spotless shirt, such arrogance!
Look at those scrawny shoulders! He'll snip in half if he tries to lift two potatoes!
Haven't you seen those dead fish eyes? He gives me the creeps!
He couldn't tell his mother from a sheep!
Too fancy for my taste.
Farmer asks you to find her escaped pigs.
The farmer's husband has disappeared again, she needs help to find him.
Farmer is anxious and hopes you will find her missing child.
Farmer wants to find a man to marry and asks for your help to find the best one.
Farmer's cat has escaped and his running around the city.
Farmer asks for your help in locking the stray hounds away.
Farmer needs help dealing with the fox which eats all her hens.
Farmer had her pigs stolen by one of the Willington's brothers. She needs help identifying which one is guilty.
Farmer's chicken have escaped, she needs help finding them.
He... he might do! Hmm, yes, I shall give this one a chance.
Farmer hopes you can take a picture of an alapaca farm in the new world.
Farmer wishes you take a picture of the wedding occuring at the church.
Farmer would like a picture of the cows at the International Agricultural Show for farmers craft to be recognized.
Farmer wishes you take a picture of her son in front of the fire station.
Farmer would like to build a fountain.
Farmer wants a tool shed.
Farmer would like a tree to rest in the shade.
Farmer would like to receive bananas.
Farmer would like canned food for her wedding feast.
Farmer things winter will be rough so more wood is needed.
Farmer asks for help finding the mysterious man she met in the forest.
Worker would like to give you a gift.
Worker would like to give you a gift.
Worker doesn't find his pals in the city to meet for the socialist congress.
Worker needs help finding his mates.
Worker needs help finding his runaway son.
Worker wants the man rioting alone to be stopped.
Worker needs help to find the opium house.
Worker needs to find the herbalist house.
He... he might do! Hmm, yes, I shall give this one a chance.
We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig in our mine the whole day through!
To dig dig dig dig dig dig dig is what we really like to do!
It ain't no trick to get rich quick if you dig dig dig with a shovel or a pick.
In a mine! Where a million diamonds shine! We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig from early morn till night.
We dig up diamonds by the score! A thousand rubies, sometimes more!
But we don't know what we dig 'em for. We dig dig dig a-dig dig, heigh-ho! It's home from work we go.
Worker wants a picture of him in the fight club.
Worker would like a picture of all of his comrades in front of the factory.
Worker would like to have his photo taken while he is protesting against bourgeoisie.
Worker needs an hospital built.
Worker would like sewing machines.
Worker would like to taste chocolate.
Worker would like to taste Champagne.
Worker would like to organize a barbecue.
Worker needs bricks.
Artisan would like to receive ponchos.
Artisan wants coffee.
Artisan wants rum.
Artisan wants sails.
Artisan would like to find a farmer family ready to teach him the job.
Artisan would like to meet the grand music composer.
Artisan daughter is singing in the hills and needs to be brought back to town.
Artisan needs to find his lost cousin.
Artisan wants the grand tragedian to be welcomed in person by the governor.
Artisan needs help finding the runaway apprentice.
Ah, the hardships of the lowly life...! I... I don't think I am quite fit for this...!
These modern fancies... He'll be broken by noon! Forget it!
He'll only be a burden! We have no time for such nonsense!
He wants to work a simple life? Fine, he shall work! Bring him to us!
Artisan wants a picture of your New World island.
Artisan needs a picture of the back to school day as a souvenir for his daughter.
Artisan would like a picture of him taking the community children to the zoo.
Artisan would like a picture of the shop grand opening.
Artisan needs a picture to be taken of his duel to prove his love to a lady.
Artisan wants a new museum exhibition.
Artisan would like to give you a book.
Artisan would like to give an artefact from the warriors of the past.
Artisan would like to give you his masterpiece.
Artisan advice you to visit the Annual Artisan Fair.
Engineer would like to give you her newest invention.
Engineer would like to give you seeds for new plants to grow on your island.
Engineer would like to introduce you to a doctor ready to work for you.
Engineer would like to teach to Workers' children to grant them a better life.
Engineer would like you to meet with El Professor, a man who whishes to visit the city bank.
Engineer would like you to help Charles Darwin to conduct his study on evolution.
Engineer would like you to stop the Shelley couple from pulling pranks on gullible town people.
Engineer would like to find the exotic animals lost on your island.
Engineer would like to have a picture of her daughter and her in front of the university for graduation day.
Engineer would like to prove to people she worked on the steam engine.
Engineer would like to have a picture of her taken in front of a factory.
Engineer would like to have a picture of a train.
Engineer would like to receive tallow and quartz sand for her experiments.
Engineer would like coffee for her study group.
Engineer would like food to feed all her lab helpers.
Engineer would like high-wheelers to move in the city faster.
Engineer would like light bulb to prove to people the benefit of it.
Engineer would like you to solve her enigma.
Engineer would like you to solve her enigma.
Investor would like to give you part of his factory sur-production.
Investor would like to sell for a portion of the price, 100 000 credits, phonographs his trading partner refused to take.
Investor want to give you a souvenir from one of his travels he has no use for anymore.
Investor would like to offer you a machine to use in a factory.
Investor wants to provide goods for the universal exhibition.
Investor wants to get the news of the day.
Investor want you to stop the maniac running in the streets.
Investor needs help finding his escaped kitten.
Investor would like you to convince his competitors to leave the business.
Investor would like you to find a good business partner for him among the visitors.
Investor wants you to remind his employee that despite Christmas being tomorrow, he better be on time for work!
Investor would like you to convince the Queen best craftmen to work for you.
Investor wants you to take a picture of his cheating wife.
Investor wants his picture taken to be a role model for the workers.
Investor would like a picture of him in front of his factory.
Investor would like a picture of him and his employee's family celebrating Christmas.
Investor wants to have a statue of himself built to inspire the masses.
Investor wants you to build a club house.
Investor wants champaign and cigars for his party.
Investor wants you to give him products to distract him.
Investor wants to taste burrito.
Investor would like a gift for his grandchild birthday.
Investor would like you to give supplies to a charity on his behalf.
Jornalero would like you to listen to the story of his life.
Jornalero would like to give an object he found.
Jornalero needs you to find his missing grandson, Miguel.
Jornalero would like to pass on his knowledge to kids.
Jornalero needs you to find the escaped alpacas.
Jornalero needs you to deal with the dangerous crocodiles near the city.
Jornalero needs you to take care of the sharks threatening the pearl divers lives.
Jornalero hope you can give a letter to a woman he once knew.
Jornalero would like you to have a strange gift a pirate gave to his son.
Jornalero is forced by his family to have a family portrait taken.
Jornalero would like to have a picture of himself taken to put on the ancestor altar once he passes.
Jornalero would like to have a picture a big sail ship.
Jornalero considers that the traditions will only be respected once a church is built.
Jornalero hopes you can build a new house for a poor man who lost everything in a fire.
Jornalero would like to build guitars for the whole community.
Jornalero would like to build toys for the children.
Jornalero would like to cool a fresh meal for all the poors in the community.
Obrero would like you to find the child in the forest.
Obrero would like you to end police corruption.
Obrero hopes you can reassure Jornaleros that they can take a break.
Obrero hopes you can help her friend captured by Jean LaFortune.
Obrero would like to help street orphans.
Obrero wants to give you a gift for being so good to them.
Obrero would like to distribute the leftover of her wedding to the poors.
Obrero would like to give you an artefact of her culture to educate the Old World about it.
Obrero would like you to sell her mother's necklace to help the poors.
Obrero would like to have a picture of her revolutionary friends.
Obrero wants to publish a picture of the island to encourage immigration.
Obrero would like to show her country as progressist by taking pictures of women at work.
Obrero is heart broken by whales hunting and would like to have a picture of whales to raise awareness.
Obrero would like to receive weapons to send her revolutionary friend under the yock of La Carona.
Obrero wants to distribute bread to the poors.
Jornalero wants alpaca wool to make blankets for those in need.
Obrero would like you to build a museum on the island.
Obrero wants a town hall for the people representative to govern.
Obrero would like to have a machine used in a factory.
Obrero wants to have a book exhibition in the museum.
Obrero wishes you to build houses for the war refugees.
Pick up the gift offered by your resident
