The sea of angry voices softens, leaving both sides wondering what this now means for the city.
REVOLUTION AVERTED
Crowds of furious demonstrators are convinced to leave the streets of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] by well-organised authorities.
REVOLUTION TARGETED
Swift government intervention saves [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] from the otherwise unshakeable grip of revolution.
PICTURE OF HEALTH!
Disease 'near impossible' in breezy [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], say its fresh-faced children, preserved in sweet flights of rose-petal.
EVE OF EPIDEMIC!
[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] disease chance high! New 'black death' descending! 'Invisible killer' to manifest in pus-filled buboes!
OUTBREAK!
Disease breaks out in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], with calls to flush locality of foul air, close schools, even forego church services!
SICKLY SPECTRE DEPARTS
Illness in [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName] abates, but leaves locality drained of life.
PRAYER BEST MEDICINE
As disease in [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName] fortunately abates - thank heavens - locals ascribe recovery to angels watching over them.
OUTBREAK REMEDIED
Locality given the all clear in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as brave doctors and nurses do fine job with the equipment they have.
INFECTION ISOLATED!
As special measures taken to curb further infection succeed, there is now no longer any need to panic in [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName].
PANDEMIC PESTILENCE!
Putrefying epidemic ravages [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Victims probably contorting in sickening agony! Malefic miasma to end humankind!

Epidemic leaves [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] empty, 'It was medieval! The whole place with the mark on their door' says one who fled.
ACUTE CASE OF APATHY
As vile epidemic relents in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], citizens bemoan lack of official intervention that may have prevented it entirely.
MIRACLE CURE!
[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] fit-as-a-fiddle again, residents declare [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] patron saint of the sick and infirm!
ANTIDOTE FOUND!
Special measures ensure [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName] disease epidemic is neutralised at epicentre, and a triumph of modern medicine!
LOW RISK OF EXPLOSIONS

Safety inspections in [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName] show that town industry is unlikely to experience too many blow-outs. "The possibility always remains," inspector remarks, "while the accompanying science is still in its infancy."
HIGH CHANCE OF EXPLOSION!

Haphazard management of industry in [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName] means a catastrophic blow-out is "likely", according to quivering investigator, "we are dabbling in that we don't understand!"
CATASTROPHIC EXPLOSION!

Roof blows off industrial heart of [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Tremendous boom precedes widespread destruction by fire, as something goes terribly, terribly wrong in one of its factories, with lack of council foresight blamed.
THE CANVAS IS STRETCHED!
World's fair foundations complete! [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] ready for global prominence!
WONDER ENTERS NEW STAGE!
New World's Fair construction phase underway! Excitement builds across the globe!

World's fair completion edges ever-nearer as significant phase of construction is finalised.
WORLD'S FAIR PROGRESS SMOOTH
Magnificent monument 'firmly on track' to have ribbon cut on expected date.
WORLD'S FAIR BID STALLS
Significant delays plague [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] in the construction of their centrepiece, amid fear they may be overreaching.
WORLD'S FAIR STANDSTILL!
Desperate concern for halted monument construction, which some already label a 'white elephant.'
MONUMENTAL ACHIEVEMENT!
[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] construct sublime World's Fair venue, a feat only imaginable in the present century!

HOPEFULS DEPART!
Expedition finally underway, after months of careful planning. Crew have 'spring' in step says Captain, but for how long?
RAPTUROUS RETURN!
Expedition achieves the unthinkable! 'We survived monsters, both real and imagined…' the proud Captain had begun, before we cut him off.
DISASTROUS VOYAGE!
Expedition goes terribly awry! Captain asked for interview, but all he could do was shake his head.
Ship sold
The [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ObjectName] was sold to [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName]
Ship bought!
The [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ObjectName] was bought from [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName]
ALLIANCE OF CIVILISED NATIONS!

A firm alliance between proud nations is achieved! The new partnership is set to be of vast importance to the immediate, even long-term futures of both sides. The final deal was mooted and passed under the noses, and more importantly, pens of the diplomatic suits in record time—
ALLIANCE STRATEGICALLY DISSOLVED!

"The decision does not mean our ongoing relations need turn nasty," was the official statement on cancelled alliance with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName], and "no reason" why "alliance wouldn't be possible again in the future."
LEFT IN THE LURCH!

Key alliance breaks down! With former ally [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] providing no answers, officials left to speculate the reason they withdrew support. It is unclear how this disappointing news has been received at the highest level.
NEW TRADE PARTNER!

A profitable new partnership with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName]! Our correspondent furnishes us with the latest figures, and trumpets the immediate economic gains from the deal.
TRADE AGREEMENT DROPPED

Future plans do not include trade with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName], if the rumours are to be believed. Who benefits the most from the decision? More perspective on the economic landscape on page 12!
TRADE SNUBBED!

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] severs trade ties in shock for local business! What might have been a fruitful relationship comes to cruelly to an end, as partner reneges on promises. Sharp decline in economy forecasted with steep-looking graphs on page 4.
THE WAR IS OVER!

Peace at last! [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] signs treaty! Ambassadors return from the negotiating table with olive branch, white doves rise to the skies, children skip gladly through meadows. The war is over! Let the colour return to our cheeks!
A REPRIEVE FROM THE VIOLENCE!

A ceasefire has been agreed. Whether moved to act by the destruction, or the strategic value of a pause, matters not. Wounds can now be licked, the situation reappraised, and perhaps, peace may be contemplated. The leaders of forces on both sides are said to be content with the situation.
WILL THE WAR NEVER END?!

"No," say Admirals as conflict resumes following a period of ceasefire. Navies muster, sailors polish their cannons, powder is poured from kegs as the parties re-enter the pugilist's ring for another round. When will this needless bloodshed cease?!
WAR DECLARED!

The powers that be have elected to go to war! Recruitment has already begun, lives at stake to uphold our values, to preserve unity and order, to meet danger half-way with zealous alacrity. Time will tell if it is a choice founded on wisdom.
WAR IS DECLARED ON US!

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] declares war! Peace and humanity desert us, as Mephistophelian adversary rises from the depths to confront us! We can only trust in our bravest to fight back this nemesis, and drive ruination from our shores.
PROPPING UP EACH OTHER

An alliance has formed between two of our rivals. Speculation mounts as to what they may be up to. Of course, their intentions could be perfectly chivalrous, but while any doubt remains, speculation of the more ignoble variety shall no doubt stir in the pool.
UNFRIENDED

An alliance between our rivals has broken down. In the following days, rumour is likely to gather as to that which broke the spell between them. It is unknown for example, whether this development will be seen positively or negatively here. More to follow.
COMMERCE GROWS OVERSEAS
New agreements reached among our neighbours this forenoon—more details in today's Foreign Diplomacy, Trade and Things You Should Care About But Won't column.
OVERSEAS TRADE INSTABILITY

A trade agreement between rival powers has been cancelled. It seems they no longer saw eye-to-eye on the subject. Whether boom of this minor diplomatic eruption will reach our shores, remains to be seen.
ENTENTE CORDIALE

A peace treaty between rivals overseas has finally been kissed with a seal. Perhaps this grand gesture can seed a future of peace and progress. Or perhaps such wimpish withdrawals are symptomatic of this too-liberal age!
WAR BETWEEN RIVALS SUSPENDED

A truce has been established between our neighbours. Pious hearts, non-partisans, will be glad that for a time, the suffering does not have to continue. How long will empathy last? Hortense McGough remarks upon the situation from the place of amnesty.
RIVAL WAR RESUMES

A ceasefire has ended between two of our neighbours, meaning that it cannot be long before the first shot rings out into the night, and their forces are on top of one another once again. Let us hope the same winds of war do not blow this way. Full report pages 31-37.
RIVAL WAR BREAKS OUT

Our neighbours have declared war on one another. An intercepted telegram confirmed the news, which many believe had been brewing for some time - now the line is crossed, the damn burst! No reason for us to react however - neutrals should dissemble and play dumb!
BACK FROM THE DEAD!

Pirate nuisance return, disproving reports they had been wiped out! Hidden coves making motley, pestilential denizens of the black flag hard to sniff out. Let us hope it is only a matter of time before these skeletons of the last century go under for good!
RELATIONS SOUR

Diplomatic relations with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] have "deteriorated" recently, say disgruntled ambassadors, as "consequence of innate differences between us". We hope importance of maintaining good relations with neighbours is not being overlooked.
RELATIONSHIP BRIGHTENS!

Relations with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] have improved recently, say jovial ambassadors! Glasses clinked, and trays of finely-wrought chocolate pralines did circulate, as improved standing with our counterparts called for celebration.
NON-AGGRESSION PACT
Reliable partnership with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] deepened with new contract.
DEEPER BONDS!
[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] signs non aggression pact with another player.
LIKE LAMBS TO THE SLAUGHTER!

Many ships lost! Naval defeats follow with painful frequency, as calamitous maneuvers and decisions show weakness in leadership. Admiral first sealord asked for comment, but wiping tear from corner of his eye, he would only put his palm to his heart and solemnly sing the anthem.
OUR HOME CRUMBLES!

So many fine buildings lost to destruction! City ravaged by war! Architects frantically unroll emergency plans to rebuild as violence continues. Many parts of the city are unrecognisable! Full scale of devastation sketched out by ou artist-at-the-scene Henri Dugarry...
ENEMY STAMPEDING OUR CITIES!

Enemy makes mockery of our defences, seizing several key trading posts! Embarassing lack of prowess in war likely to spell the end, if wholesale changes to our forces are not undertaken soon! Revel in full scale of devastation as covered throughout today's edition.
NAVAL POWER!

We have sunk countless ships— proof of titanic fortitude in the face of enemy aggression! As the waves swim red with the blood of our foe, whisky shoots from the nostrils of our admirals as they guffaw with laughter! More on the genius minds behind our navy below.
DIRECT HIT!
Enemy structures crumble under fire! The crashes, bangs, and rumbles paralyse the enemy! Praise for our brave forces, and their ruthless expertise in demolition!
SEA BATTLE CAPTIVATES THE PEOPLE

The vast sea battle is unsurprisingly the major subject of discussion at home and abroad, with the outcome arguably decisive in settling the ongoing feud with our rivals. With the outcome in the balance, we must remain hopeful of a famous triumph. Continues p.3.
MAJOR SEA VICTORY!

Enemy fleet taken apart! Singular success for our proud fleet, in one of the largest sea battles in recent memory! Surely now the war shall be over, and all our enemies shall lay sword and shield at our feet in due deference! Speculation as to precisely how it was won pp.2-19.
MAJOR DEFEAT AT SEA!

Humiliation! Huge sea battle ends as enemy cuts through our fleet! Eyewitness accounts of the failure sadly lost to the deep! Will crashing defeat finally condemn us to being forgotten footnote in history? Post-mortem continues pp. 2-15.
WE'RE UNDER ATTACK!

Assault begins on our beloved home! Is it true we are left undefended by sea? That we must fight back this foe alone? Seeking advice as a civilian? We shall endeavour —for as long as we are able— to bring you round-the-dial reports on the situation.
ENEMY SIEGE REPELLED!

Rejoice, our city endures! Foolhardy enemy assault rebuffed after skirmishes! The coast is clear, at least for now. Debrief at headquarters due later today. Armchair accounts of the final battle in our beleaguered city correspondent's testimony throughout this edition.
ENEMY TRAMPLES THROUGH CITY!

The enemy has captured [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], putting an end to our brave, but ultimately futile resistance. The local residents will have no choice but to swear allegaince with their new masters now.
WE BEGIN OUR ASSAULT!

Enemy harbour receives barrage from our forces, sure to collapse under the indefatigable efforts of our nation, proudly united in the belief that this is a fine and wonderful idea. We here at this paper, certainly, are unanimous in our support!
SIEGE IS SUCCESSFUL!

Assault on [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] ensures island is taken by force! The enemy resolve was whittled down, until their defences were breached, and a flagpole bearing our colours was driven deeply into the soil, to make official our newest territory!
SIEGE AN ERROR OF JUDGEMENT!

Overly optimistic assault on [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] duly ends in failure for our bumbling forces! Cavalier attitudes to the enemy will "not pay in the long run," say many worried this will now turn the tide against us!
OUR DEFENCE FALTERS!

People of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] already imagining life under enemy as their will to hold out wobbles. Reports show morale is at its lowest ebb! It cannot be long before we are forced to give up our city to the enemy for good!
RIVAL ISLAND UNDER SIEGE

One of our rivals is besieged by an enemy fleet, news has filtered through from over the water. What is no doubt a disturbing development for them, may "not necessarily" be so grave for us, remarks our expert Commander Button, whose full appraisal may be enjoyed overleaf.
RIVAL OUTLASTS ENEMY SIEGE

The island of our rival will remain in their possession, following a successful defensive campaign against the enemy. Regardless of the result, the news is sure to be a relief to the long-suffering people on both sides.
RIVAL'S ISLAND CONQUERED!

Our rival's island has fallen to the enemy, after a prolonged assault finally broke the local resistance. The transfer of ownership is immediate, but the lasting effects of this coup are yet to emerge as an outline from the clouds of gunpowder. More on Politics, pp3-5.
ENEMY CLOSE TO GIVING UP!

The morale of our enemy is drained, according to letters intercepted by friends of this publication! It cannot be long before assault on [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] succeeds, with the city liberated to our cause!
MISSION SUCCESSFUL!

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] is a good samaritan, offering help to those in need. Recent success in trial of public responsibility proves our esteemed leader's equanimity in the face of adversity.
BENEVOLENT LEADER SUCCEEDS AGAIN!

Our sublimely philanthropic premier [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] achieves success after success in the public sphere, displaying remarkable compassion and willigness to intercede whenever others appear in need of support.
MISSION FOUL UP!

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] attempts to help, but only makes things worse! "It's all very well agreeing to do something, provided that you then do it," stated source close to our leader, wishing to remain nameless.
RENOVATIONS BOOST CITY APPEAL!

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] has become noticeably more attractive! Recent campaigns to beautifiy the city's avenues and boulevards have begun to pay dividends for tourism, as scenic vistas captivate the popular imagination.
CITY BECOMES UGLIER

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] "has let itself go," according to one of many visitors who claim the city is losing its appeal. Travel agents scratch their heads, saying, "there must be something we can do to get the turnstiles spinning again."
MOST BEAUTIFUL CITY IN THE WORLD

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is the fairest city of them all according to independent panel of aesthetes! In exhaustive list of magical destinations, our wondrous city emerged at the top! Scoff at the rest on the list pp. 24-25.
RIVAL CITY IS MOST BEAUTIFUL

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is now the most beautiful city ever built, most likely that shall "ever be built", according to renowned art historian. "A beauty timeless, universal— unsurpassable, may this singular jewel never be taken from us."
RIVAL SHARES SOLD

A share in a rival company has been sold, we hear. The news broke during trading, and the full effects are not expected to be seen for a short while yet. It is not clear if the party who sold were forced into the sale, but the move won't fill their backers with confidence.
FIRE SALE!

Our company sells shares to a third-party! On the reasons for doing so, it is pure speculation. We debate the move in an opinion piece, questioning the long-term objectives, but in praise of the short-term gains of such an arrangement.
INVESTMENT IN RIVAL WITHDRAWN

We have sold our company shares in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], for reasons as yet unknown. "Perhaps the investment just wasn't paying off," says bookkeeper, "in which case it would be a sensible decision."
RIVAL WITHDRAWS INVESTMENT

Rival sells their share in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], for reasons as yet unknown. "Perhaps their investment just wasn't paying off," says bookkeeper, "in which case it is sensible for them to back down."
INVASIVE INVESTMENT!

Rival buys shares, targetting future takeover! Sinister intentions transparent at stakeholder meeting, according to sources present. A complete transfer of assets would be effectuated, should rival party ever hold a majority. Can we buy back a slice of the pie? pp. 13-14.
SHARE AND SHARE ALIKE

A rival has bought shares in another business, according to reports. A prestige move for them, indubitably, but our economic expert writes of the inevitable repercussions in the small world of finance.
SHREWD INVESTMENT

Shares bought in rival business! A finger in the pie, leading to future takeover perhaps? While a sizeable initial outlay, the investment in our rivals can come good later. Should a majority ever be had, the door would open for a tantalising takeover.
RIVAL SNATCHES BACK SHARES!
Shares bought back by rival! Company investment trumped by greater purchase power. The bi-monthly shareholder dinner was ruined by the news, with flabbergasted guests busting out of their suits.
SHARES BOUGHT BACK FROM RIVAL!

Shares now under our control again! A victory in the long struggle against a majority takeover, this decisive play could mean our independence is secured for sometime yet. Only with such determintaion can we show our would-be usurpers we mean business.
HL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought Back NPC From NPC - Neutral
SL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought Back NPC From NPC - Neutral
HOSTILE TAKEOVER IMMINENT!

Rival ready to seize [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Catastrophic financial takeover seems inevitable! Not content with partial ownership, our adversary would seize this nest of ours, and all that lieth within, like the most indecent variety of cuckoo!
CLEVER TAKEOVER POSSIBLE!

An island is there for the taking, and opportunity never knocks twice at anyone's door! "More is more!" say hopeful henchpersons of our company, lips a-drool with the prospects such an acqusition would bring about.
JUICY ISLAND ACQUIRED!

Devious hostile takeover success! Investment pays off, as new city joins the fold! A mail steamer brought with it amended company valuations for the start of trading— a great and instantaneous surge in assets! Improved portfolio is celebrated in our special pull-out within.
SCANDALOUS TAKEOVER!

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] swiped by our rival! As hostile takeover goes through, does it spell the end for our company? What future plans for the place our rival has, are not ours to know, but grim faces on the streets tell the story.
RIVAL COMPANY STONY BROKE!

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] trades for the last time as debts become insurmountable! Whatever the reason for this sorry state of affairs, it is history now— and hardly a concern for us.
RIVAL SUFFERS FINAL DEFEAT!

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] surrenders everything, as last defenders fall! Sharks swarm over corpse of trading empire, now gone for good. Once the smoke has cleared, we may gauge what all this portends for us.
Banana Bread
1/2 Cup Butter
1 Cup Sugar
2 Medium Eggs
1.5 Cup Flour
1 TL Natron
1/4 Cup Nuts (chopped)
3 Bananas
Pre-heat the oven - 200C.
Beat Butter and Sugar until fluffy.
Smooth Banana - mix Natron and Flour - mix everything.
Butter the loaf pan and put the bread for ~1h in the oven.
GRUEL TREATMENT?
A bowl of watery slop is a sad lot. But perhaps fermented sardine and nutmeg can bring it back from the dead!?
CELERY-BRATION!
'Two heads of celery' are better than one!' says Chef Antoine, in luxurious celery cream soup.
PRIDE OF PLAICE
Plaice can make for a half-decent fish supper. Just remember to take out the bones!
HEART AND SOLE!
Sole is a superior fish! Chef Antoine kindly reveals famous recipe that won him his spurs.
HEDGEPIG DEAD?
Serial: sleuth Fetlock Hedgepig missing, presumed dead. Sidekick Dr. Whatsit must investigate singular 'Five Clocks' problem alone...
HEDGEPIG ALIVE!
Serial: sleuth Fetlock Hedgepig miraculously recovers from vicious tree frog poison! Can he and Dr. Whitsun unravel the singular 'Five Clocks' problem?
FOGG IS THICK
Noxious society bore Fogg squanders vast sum on boorish wager - a ludicrous brag he can circle the world in 80 days.
FOGG-GET ME NOT!
Exuberant eccentric Fogg waves handkerchief to excited crowd, as he embarks on latest promise to travel world in 80 days!
FLYING MACHINE CRASH!
Featherweather's dubious claims of crossing continent in carrot-powered 'Bunny-faithful' not helped by homecoming plunge.
ASTOUNDING FLYING MACHINE!
Morris Featherweather crosses continent in carrot-powered vehicle, 'Bunny-faithful'. Long-eared contraption comes spectacularly down to earth.
FROGMAN' A HOAX!
Life seems so ordinary again, now 'Frogman' revealed to be costume fashioned from fish skin and sewn-on head of giant toad.
SECOND FROGMAN SIGHTED!
Excitement in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as 'Bulging yellow eyes' tally exactly with first sighting. Amphibiae expert speculates as to probable evolutionary lineage.
DEADLY JOKE HORROR
Man laughs for two torturous hours before it kills him, authorities fear the joke responsible is circulating!
LAUGHING IT OFF!
What better way to depart this world than by dying of amusement? Man pops clogs over 'best joke ever'.
The Real Goode
TRAITOR SUICIDE IN PRISON
Reports Samuel Goode couldn't face humiliation of a trial. Miserable few at funeral still more than 'Judas ever deserved'.
EDVARD THE SAVIOUR
Mr. Edvard Goode speaks of 'bold new era' for Goode & Sons, nobly bearing the burden 'terrible traitor' brother dropped at his door.
ISLAND SALE CALAMITY!
Empire rocked by sale of strategic island 'Prosperity'. Young Queen facing first major scandal thanks to traitor Samuel Goode's selfish actions.
Approved by Edvard Goode
Bright Sands, Thursday 08.01.1800
PHOENIX FROM THE ASHES
Goode’s heirs create breakaway shipping company in the image of their father, who they knew only as a man of principle.
WAS SAMUEL GOODE INNOCENT?
The man never had the chance of a fair trial, besides, can selling strategic islands to rival Empires really be treason, or is it just business?
WE WANT YOU!
Farm Experience? Bright futures await! Be a force for Goode! Apply within!
SHIPS, GLORIOUS SHIPS!
[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] unveils beautiful first ship! Daughter dedicates it to dead father.
EXPLOSIVE DEVELOPMENT!
Big blast in the mountains secures vital iron lode for fledgling [Game Profile Info Name] venturing into warships!
BRIGHT SANDS TAKEN OVER!
Who are the hooded figures setting the island in flames, and ending Edvard Goodes life?
BRIGHT SANDS RESCUED
The Goode siblings have saved their home from the evil Pyrphorians
GOODE & SONS REUNITED
The company Goode & Sons is reunited under the peaceful reign of the Goode siblings
THE QUEEN IS SAFE
With the Pyrphorians driven back, they are no threat for the Queen anymore.
ARE YOU A GENIUS?
Only people with high self-opinion can answer these questions...
YOU MUST READ THIS!
Man rides boneshaker over cobbles, what happens next will explode your mind!
TEN SURPRISINGLY DELICIOUS CREATURES
Praying Mantis knocked from top by one you won't believe!
IS YOUR HUSBAND ADULTEROUS?
He is if he keeps these five things in his garden shed...
ARSENIC KILLER CAUGHT!
What she did next will leave you doubled-up...
YOU ARE HAPPIER THAN YOU THINK
Swing a pendulum before your eyes, repeat "I am happy." You will feel a positive change within - or else be sure to keep doing it until you do.
BE GRATEFUL YOU STILL LIVE
Typhus, typhoid, influenza, cholera, smallpox, yellow fever, malaria, scurvy - the list goes on. Remember, living itself is a good outcome.
IMAGINE! YOU COULD BE FOREIGN!
Depravity and peculiarity lie beyond your borders! It is not greener on the other side! Blissful ignorance is your friend.
YOU ARE FAMOUS!
Angel Florence Nightjar only wishes that all could be as humble and gracious as the people of [Game Profile Info Name], people like you.
CONGRATULATIONS YOU HAVE WON!
As a citizen of [Game Profile Info Name], you have qualified for the final gyration of the tombola! To claim your prize, enclose fee for your entry ticket below...
BE AMONG THE STAINLESS!
Help wash away the rioter nuisance, good, upstanding citizen! Or better, take justice into your own bare hands!
FOIL THE REVO-LOOTERS!
Radicals will look for any excuse to pillage! No rumours you hear are too small to bring before your local police!
RAT THEM OUT!
The fairy tale will not end, as these radicals would have you believe! Those simpletons sing along to the next tune they hear!
DIM ENOUGH TO OPEN THIS BOX?
Only an ignoramus forgets what befell poor Pandora! Inform the authorities of anyone who would believe anything else.
REPORT THEM!
Isolate, name and shame them. These upstart delinquents are nothing alone and broken, away from their flock.
BANISH THIS BARBARITY!
Civilisation always outlasts these misguided, violent spasms. Report radicals, and guarantee you last along with it!
YOU ARE BEING JUDGED
Do you enjoy depravity, sin, filth? The word trousers? Then there is a place for you - it's called hell!
PURGE YOUR DEMONS!
Give yourself not unto temptation, sever the many-heads of beelzebub and free your foul and corrupted flesh!
IS THIS GLUTTON YOU?!
Repent your greed! St. Peter's pearly gates are not half as wide as you imagine!
YOUR SIN IS ENVY!
Set aside your materialism, your acquisitiveness, and learn to nourish your spirit.
STOP THIS CONSUMPTION!
Disease is everywhere. Everything we touch spreads illness, therefore touch as few commodities as possible!
ARE YOU RATIONAL?
Rationing is for our greater good, and without a greater good, what good are you?
IT'S PAY DAY!
Before you go spend it at our marvelous boulevards, consider that it's our taxes only that keep your workplace running. If you want to see another pay day, forget not to pay up!
YOU TOO ARE AN INVESTOR!
Disagree? Think again! You invest in flawless services, well-paying jobs and the safest borders everytime you pay your taxes! Be smart, invest in your city!
YOUR FAMILY IS IN DANGER!
Cruel invaders lurk beyond our borders and only your money stands between them and your loved ones! Pay your taxes before it's too late!
DREAMS OF VICTORY?
Stop dreaming, seize it! Wake up and join our troops today! Be the hero our city needs and vanquish our enemies. You too deserve a win!
ARE YOU AFRAID?
You should! Our brilliant shores lay unprotected, soft bellies open for the vultures of piracy and subjugators! Be the spear to cast them away! Join our local forces and protect your home!
THEY'RE COMING FOR YOUR CHILDREN!
Alien conquerors are coming to enslave our little cherubs for their evil purposes. Will you stand still and watch!? Enlist now and destroy the fiendish barbarians!
YOU ARE THE HERO!
It may be others doing the fighting, but what would they fight with if it weren't for you!? Go the extra mile at work, your production will win the war!
FINISH THE JOB!
Only by the united action in our nation's war industries can we crush out our villainous adversaries! Turn out more guns, ships and ammunition, repair faster too!
COMBATANTS DON'T TAKE TIME OFF
Why do you!? Our troops need arms and support to fight for victory. Speed up production and repair works!
YOU ARE WANTED!
Illness, war and calamity threaten our civilised way of life, but you can put a halt to it! Join your local Neighbourhood Watch today and show you care!
WARNING!
Thousands of hazards prowl around every corner! Be on the lookout, join your local Watch today!
ARE YOU A SLUGGARD!?
All your neighbours have already join the Watch to protect you and your family from every possible danger. Don't be the talk of the town, quit sitting on your arse and assist your local Watch now!
BRAVEST NATION!

Brand new findings show a significantly higher value in courage in our soldiers, who will refuse to surrender 47 out of 50 times. Do you belong? Or are you perchance a coward? Answer these simple questions and find out.
FEROCIOUS RESISTANCE!
Armed conflict "very close to conclusion" according to reliable sources, victory guaranteed if and only if our brave men and women on the barricades stand tall and strong against repulsive pillagers.
HUMAN EATING CANNIBALS!?
Latest reports on our enemies suggest they regularly enjoy the consumption of living human flesh! Local professor surmises they harvest their contenders! Don't take a bite from the cannibal invaders!
YOUR WAR!
Glory awaits you, brave young soldier! Your lust for adventure, your proud family behind you, and your enemy who want sticking on your bayonet.
TAKE BACK WHAT IS YOURS!
Your cause is just, your blade is true, and your spirit as keen as the fabled Marie D'Artois!
WE HOLD ALL THE CARDS
If our enemies try to run once our suite of aces is turned, it'll be time to go "all-in".
BEHOLD OUR SEA POWER!
Our rivals have everything to fear, for we are Poseidon God of the Sea, brandishing mighty trident!
ABSOLUTELY UNIFORM SLAUGHTER!
Burnished boots and shining steel, our immaculate soldiery will slice through our dim-wit enemies like putty!
SENT BACK TO THE DEEP!
We have our rivals by the tentacles. Their grubby suckers shall threaten our prosperity no more!
A FOREGONE CONCLUSION!
We have the sharper wits, even if they did - and they don't - have the sharper sticks.
PLOUGHED-DOWN FARMERS!
Abject misery of farming community - "bedrock" of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] - could trigger social collapse say worried economists.
A FARMING IDYLL!
Local farmers express extraordinary happiness, with ceilidh dancing amid uproarious celebration of the bucolic in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName].
WORKER WOE!
"Life's a bloomin' misery" say [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] workers, amid fears their extreme unhappiness will grind society to a halt.
WORKER WONDERLAND
Workers blissfully happy in the hustle and bustle of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], where all believe life has a greater purpose.
ALAS THE ARTISANS!
Poor artisans awfully unhappy thanks to artless governor, meaning dreadfully dreary poetry inflicted upon rest of us.
ADORING ARTISANS!
Artisan ecstasy in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as romantic dream blooms streets into garden of enraptured petals.
TAXATION ABOMINATION!
Taxes wrenched from sorry [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] people, leaving many destitute, as frost-faced misers count their ill-gotten gains.
OUTRIGHT SLAVERY!
[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] governor ruthlessly exploits own people, snatching away every last satisfaction of their working lives.
BON VOYAGE!
As fabulous first ship departs [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] dock, joyous sailors dust off squeezeboxes for jolly jigs.
POPULATION STABLE
[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] numbers remain the same, 'Things are as they've always been,' declares unconcerned resident.
CORNUCOPIA OF SAUSAGE
Sausage cascades from the heavens upon the people of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], who are dumbfounded by their astonishing Good fortune.
STUFFED TO THE GILLS!
Fish cascade from the heavens upon the people of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], who are dumbfounded by their astonishing Good fortune.
CORNUCOPIA OF SCHNAPPS!
Schnapps cascades from the heavens upon the people of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], who are dumbfounded by their astonishing Good fortune.
CORNUCOPIA OF BUBBLES!
Soap cascades from the heavens upon the people of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], who are dumbfounded by their astonishing Good fortune.
CORNUCOPIA OF CLOTH!
Work clothes cascade from the heavens upon the people of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], who are dumbfounded by their astonishing Good fortune.
CORNUCOPIA OF BREAD!
Bread cascades from the heavens upon the people of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], who are dumbfounded by their astonishing Good fortune.
CORNUCOPIA OF BEER!
Beer cascades from the heavens upon the people of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], who are dumbfounded by their astonishing Good fortune.
CORNUCOPIA OF CANNED FOOD!
Cans cascade from the heavens upon the people of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], who are dumbfounded by their astonishing Good fortune.
EDVARD CHRONICLES
As unsightly a blot on the landscape as you are ever likely to see.
A stirring-the-sneeze-in-a-handkerchief kind of place.
A town as cacky as a well-used dog path.
A bleak panorama drained of all optimism and colour.
Visiting is like watching paint dry, or perhaps peel away...
If only anyone with any damned taste worked for the local council...
Dull, dull, dull.
About as exciting as a puritan's sitting room.
Ordinary, as in, a bachelor with a 'fine personality'.
A place at least one person doesn't absolutely hate.
Nice enough while still remaining deeply weird.
Peculiarity can be attractive.
Genuinely interesting, rather than 'interesting' in the 'Anglican sense'.
Pleasant? Now we're getting somewhere.
Handsome is sometimes a put-down, but not here.
As well-groomed and presented as a prize cow.
Something about this places stirs people. Don't ask me exactly what that means.
Allure', not 'a lure'. That could be a maggot on a hook...
Scenery that beckons like siren song. Let's hope it doesn't shipwreck!
If you did fall in love with this town, you might just be kept here forever!
Pretty, like bright balloons, riverbanks and calligraphy.
Not merely conventionally attractive, this model village is possessed of a certain uniqueness.
As pretty as a postcard and redolent of all the fond memories you'd expect to follow.
A place with the not-to-be-sniffed-at capability of moving others with its looks.
So wonderful, it has cheeky scamps skipping down the streets with dripping ices.
A very serious and grave kind of attractiveness that touches the soul.
Gorgeous may be a vulgar word, but one expressing beauty otherwise inexpressible.
This city is so fine, it has caught the interest of persons far and wide!
The kind of place you might expect dresses of the highest feasible circumference.
A charismatic city is no longer in any doubt as to whether it is beautiful or not.
A flawless, ineffable beauty. Like moondust settled upon ice shards.
Sumptuous in its sprawl, elegant in its limbs, this city is one of glossy celebrity.
Notoriously, deliriously beautiful in the most ambitious conceivable way.
As magical as Cinderella's evening at eleven fifty-nine.
The kind of beauty conferred upon mortals only in dreams, by the kind and impish hand of faeries.

The first workers move in.
The first artisans move in.
The first engineers move in.
The first investors move in.
The tourists are excited about your first visitor harbour.
Hannah thinks building a settlement of farmhouses will grant you a little standing
Aarhant believes checking your Uncle's harbour may yield recruits and ships for your cause
Aarhant believes these people may be willing to join us
Aarhant is pleased the farmers and flagship arrived, but troubled that two ships went missing
Hannah thinks workers essential if you are to build on the meagre standing you have.
Hannah is relieved some workers are willing to join your company.
Hannah proposes to attract more workers.
Hannah is happy to see that more workers are arriving at the town.
Hannah believes producing ships from a shipyard will finally give you sufficient standing.
Hannah is tearful but glad your first shipyard is christened, and notes you now have a good bit of standing.
Hannah is happy to see your first ship, and since you now have standing, you should be in a position to sell it!
Hannah is relieved you found a buyer willing to set the past aside.
Hannah proposes to construct and sell three more schooners to Mrs Hunt!
Hannah is thankful that Mrs Hunt has proven a good trading partner.
Aarhant wants to sample sausage, once you have established a stable production of it.
Aarhant doesn't want to make a habit of eating sausage, but thinks there should be enough to keep your people happy for now.
Aarhant would like to try some of your bread.
Aarhant is surprised and delighted at the quality of your excellent bread.
Aarhant is tempted to try your beer, against his better judgment.
Aarhant finds beer unimpressive, but is glad your citizens manage to enjoy it.
Edvard Goode refuses to buy your ship, or publicly associate with you.
Sir Archibald Blake is sincerely sorry he cannot buy your ship, his hands are tied.
Lady Margaret Hunt would like to buy your ship for $[NotificationContext Value(Ship) Object Sellable SellPrice MoneyCost >> sellShipPrice].
Uncle Edvard is giving you the cold shoulder.
Lady Margaret Hunt welcomes you warmly.
Sir Archibald Blake reluctantly asks you to leave.
Hannah remains somewhat distant.
Aarhant appears mildly disgruntled.
The Farmers fondly remember the past and your father.
The Workers are optimistic about their new life under you.
Eli Bleakworth dismisses you.
Bente Jorgensen doesn't see a problem with your difference in standing.
Von Malching is disgusted by your presence.
Alonso Graves stares at you in fascination.
Anne Harlow wants to be left alone.
Madame Kahina looks disinterested.
Aarhant can't wait to board the new ship and explore the area.
Hannah is busy leveraging your new standing to gain insights.
Uncle Edvard looks at you dismissively.
Sir Archibald Blake is invested in your well-being.
Lady Margaret Hunt is worried about your upcoming expedition.
Eli Bleakworth keeps the details of your father's death to himself.
Bente Jorgensen is proud that you've established yourself.
Von Malching taunts you.
Alonso Graves is disappointed in your return to society.
Anne Harlow scarcely holds back her anger.
Madame Kahina smiles politely.
The Farmers are sure your shipyard is wonderful, even if it's a bit too busy for their liking.
The Workers are proud of your shipyard.
This prisoner is not the one you seek.
Thomas N. Ticker confirms he was your father’s demolitions expert.
Hannah introduces you to your neighbour.
Bente Jorgensen is amazed you finished your very first shipyard.
Beryl O'Mara acknowledges you working hard, having the odds against you.
Vicente Silva acknowledges your progress into naval trade and warfare.
Willie Wibblesock is thrilled seeing you bailout a sentenced prisoner.
Artur Gasparov is disgusted seeing you getting help from a prisoner.
Lady Margaret Hunt finds it repulsive you bailing out a prisoner to help you.
Princess Qing admires your honorable intentions for the upcoming expedition.
Artur Gasparov shows somewhat respect for your upcoming expedition.
George Smith encourages you to defend yourself against the Pyrphorians.
Beryl O'Mara supports your military ship production against the Pyrphorians.
Alonso Gravez takes part in despising the Pyrphorians.
Bente Jorgensen regrets the situation got so violent.
Willie Wibblesock is proud you took inspiration from him to defeat the Pyrphorians.
Princess Qing pays her respects to your sacrifices.
George Smith is proud of the Goode in you.
Beryl O'Mara warns to keep an eye out for the Pyrphorians' return.
Artur Gasparov commands you to protect his works of art from the fire.
Carl von Malching is relieved there is still an Empire to be a baron of.
Alonso Gravez is glad the vermin has been driven away.
Vicente Silva ponders adopting Pyrphorian warfare methods.
Lady Margaret Hunt has nothing to say.
Anne Harlow thinks the Pyrphorian Grandmaster sounded somewhat familiar.
Jean La Fortune is relieved to have one less threat to worry about.
Archibald Blake is delighted that you protected the Queen.
Eli Bleakworth regrets not having had the chance to punish Edvard for his crimes.
Madame Kahina praises your audacity in defeating the Pyrphorians.
Isabel Sarmento breathes easier now you have casted the Pyrphorians away.
The captain informs you that you didn't obtain the Prosperity Contract.
The captain received new information on how to catch up with the Pyrphorians.
The captain is devastated that the whole crew died and you failed at obtaining the Prosperity Contract.
The captain brings you hopeful news that one crew member survived, knowing where the Pyrphorian hideout is located.
The captain is disappointed that the crew failed at obtaining the Prosperity Contract.

If you must linger here, at least make yourself useful.
As a reward, your father's spectacles - they are worthless to me.
Here, perhaps they'll help magnify your microscopic reputation.
Father's funeral so upset me, I mislaid the ring by his grave. Dear sibling, can you recover it?
I am glad you found the ring, many of his other effects vanished in the aftermath. Perhaps Madame Kahina can help trace them?
There's a family matter, on which I feel I must speak.
Save these poor souls from shipwreck, and prove that like father, we deserve their loyal support!
How wonderful to have them return, so many kind and gentle faces!
Father turns in his grave. He'd never have let the cries of his shipwrecked followers go unheard.
It's strange the day your father died, his neighbour Alwin was released. Still, your the only one who might care enough to open an investigation...
If you can't find an orange giant, with a history of poor health, then I'll assume you're no sleuth.
Please...they made me kill Samuel Goode! Them masked devils who threatened to kill my daughter!
Masked shadows? Even I have to admit, there may be something in this. Until later then...
Your father's trinket may not have much material value, but I sense there's more to it than that.
This ring embodies the present; a serpent chasing its tail. Your father's child, you'll only break the cycle by escaping yourself.
Through these lenses the future manifests...first in darkness; an angry spark - then riots of flame!
Master

WARNING: READ BEFORE PLAYING

A very small percentage of individuals may experience epileptic seizures when exposed to certain light patterns or flashing lights. Exposure to certain patterns or backgrounds on a computer screen, or while playing video games, may induce an epileptic seizure in these individuals. Certain conditions may induce previously undetected epileptic symptoms even in persons who have no history of prior seizures or epilepsy. If you, or anyone in your family, have an epileptic condition, consult your physician prior to playing. Treaties
Request diplomatic treaties or cancel existing ones.
Alliance
Alliance
Form an alliance to support each other in wars.
Allies will follow you into war against other parties. If your ally goes to war, you will also be at war with your ally's enemy.
Revoke Alliance
Disband the alliance to free yourself from its mutual defense obligation.
You cannot ask for an Alliance when at war with this party.
Trade Rights
Trade Agreement
When Trade Rights are signed other parties' ships will trade in your harbours.
Trade Rights allow you to trade in the other party's harbour. They will also come to trade in your harbour.
Ongoing trade brings you reputation.
Revoke Trade Agreement
When Trade Rights are revoked other parties' ships won't trade in your harbours anymore.
You cannot ask for Trade Rights when at war with this party.
Peace
Request Peace Treaty
When the Peace Treaty is signed the war is over.
In Peace you cannot attack each other.
War
Declare War
Declare War to attack this party's ships and buildings.
In War you can attack each others' ships and buildings.
To start an Island War, destroy your enemy's buildings to make them lose morale until they surrender. Then you can take over the island.
Ceasefire
Ceasefire
Ceasefire stops War for a fixed duration. After that, war will continue.
Non-Aggression Pact
Request Non-Aggression Pact
A Non-Aggression Pact prevents War for a fixed duration. Without this pact, War can be declared anytime.
Actions
Interact with this party to influence your reputation.
Higher reputation raises the chance for better treaties.
Flatter
Try to gain reputation by flattering the other party.
Insult
Try to lose reputation by insulting the other party.
Offer Gift
Try to gain reputation by giving money. But it will go to waste if the other party feels bribed!

Bente Jorgensen is a young heir of the Jorgensen Trust. She is a very friendly person, caring for those around her. She is excited about exotic things and doesn't like injustice.

Princess Qing is a young and relatively unexperienced member of a foreign Imperial family. She doesn't know the local customs and reacts awkwardly sometimes. She is a peaceful person, loving art, poetry and beauty.

Willie Wibblesock is a leader of his own young company, but overestimates himself sometimes. He is scared of a lot of things, believing that demons are haunting him. He has been bullied a lot in his past. He is a hobby magician.

George Smith is not his real name. Having grown up as the son of an enslaved miner, he was able to flee slavery. Since then, he had multiple professions, growing as a kind, honest and rightful person. Fairness and honesty are his main virtues.
Beryl O'Mara is a career criminal, having her very own moral code and taking risks or getting her hands dirty. She doesn't see the necessity to follow established rules if she has a higher goal.

Artur Gasparov is a visionary, in pursuit of architectural and civic perfection. Inelegance infuriates him. He likes to make a good impression, but otherwise has little time for others. He seeks critical acclaim and prestige for his designs, and to build a legacy.

Carl Leonard von Malching is a tycoon. He is always looking for his own advantage, without any moral constraints. Money is his main focus. He is jealous of everybody that he feels is some kind of superior to him.

Alonso Gravez is a violent leader. Passionate, intimidating on one hand, charming on the other. He is very hard to read. He appears insane, instinctive and unpredictable. He makes decisions based on gut feelings and not strategic analysis.

Admiral Vicente Silva is a quiet, calculating and insightful general. The military has prepared him for everything. He is self-confident with a strong sense of honour and prestige. He is a long range thinker who has deep insight into politics, and a very good leader.

Lady Margaret Hunt is a soulfoul old lady. Being a member of the Hunt enterprises she is extremely resourceful. She is a woman who knows what she wants and how to get it. She has seen it all come and go and is very hard to impress or intimidate. While she seems very kind and nice, disappointing her might have severe consequences.

Anne Harlow is a highborn woman who turned to piracy after her father's decapitation. She is charismatic with a strong personality. She deeply hates the Queen, seeking revenge and attacking everything that belongs to the new Queen and her supporters.

Jean La Fortune is a highborn illegitimate son of a foreign prince. As such, he became a slave who lately climbed the social ladder. He became an iconig figure of civil rights and now wants to get rid of any form of superior authority.

A collection of the most elegant and refined architectural models through history.
The showcase of contemporary intellect through astonishing devices.
The largest cabinet of curiosities featuring antique sculptures, writings and art pieces.
These splendid artifacts from the past will make our curator happy!
These new devices will forward our industry to a point never reached before!
These construction plans are now free for us. They will enrich our city with their smooth lines and rich materials!
The exhibition is wonderful, but sadly no one can admire it !
Have you seen those tall sculptures? No one will tell me that humans built it, they are so gigantic ! It would fit so well in my garden !
The World Fair is a cave of wonders. But not the old one, the new, the technological, the brilliant one ! No wonder if we land on the Moon one day !
Columns, exotic constructions and monumental architecture! The World Fair has become a fabulous gate to ethereal worlds! A splendid success!
There is a problem with the World Fair. Everything will remain stopped until you find a solution!
The event will start a bit later than expected; more investors would help speeding up the process.
I am not sure if it was really better before, but these remains of past civilizations are breathtaking. Hopefully sphinxes and dinosaurs won't get out!
We have entered a new era! Our techonological and industrial progress is so fast that I worry about the space we offer for all these inventions!
I can already imagine the symetric and elegant constructions our contemporaries will bring. The somptuosities of our cities are peerless, and what a great journey for the eyes!

Aggressive
The vehicle will attack and continuously pursue any enemy target within its attack range
Defensive
The vehicle will attack and pursue any enemy target within its attack range until a certain distance has been reached. Afterwards the vehicle will return back to its initial position.
Stand ground
The vehicle will attack any enemy target within its attack range but will not pursue it.
Flee
The vehicle will attack any enemy target within its attack range, but it will flee if under attack.
Mixed
Some ships in the group have different stances.

This shiny lighthouse is a place where characters will offer you quests from time to time.
A link with nature in the middle of the city.
A young washerwoman rests under a vast vast tree. She secretly is in love but she only dares to carve her beloved's face within the wood. For the boy is very busy person and must not be disturbed.
Colorful and with delightful fragrance.

A young painter sits alone in his vast vast workshop. He wishes he could trade the painted flowers for their actual fragrance but he cannot. For his every waking moment must be spent in service of his art.
Artists like to take a walk in the shade of the orchard.
The painter was devoted to his art but his strokes failed to invoke the real world. So one day the painter chose to abandon the brush and engaged in a walk in the shade of the orchard.
Quite faithful to the famous royal garden.
The washerwoman quivered at the glimpse of her beloved above the hedge. "This will be my only chance" she told herself. "As he may notice me today or never".
A haven of peace for ducks and dragonflies.

The painter approached the pond and gazed in the water for hours. The washerwoman put down her basket; joined her hands; sipped some water and prayed that he will remember her for eternity. She then walked into the pond and never came back.
Handy to satisfy a thirst.
"How long can I bear these buckets full of water? How long I wonder?"
Local and exotic goods mixed together.
"How long can I transport those crates for the good of their rich owners? How long I wonder?"
Separates the street from the properties. Can also serve as a bench.
"How long can I continue to pursue a life enclosed with borders? How long I wonder?"
Boys usually throw coins and wait for their wish to become true.
"How long can I accept a fate filled with dust instead of pure water? How long I wonder?"
The sight of this statue lightens the heart of the hard working women.
"How long did I wait until I put an end to my terror? How long I wonder?"
Total attractiveness provided by all ornaments on this island.

There's always a chance of fire. Areas with high building density are more likely to suffer a fire. Fire stations reduce the chance of fires.
Not fully satisfied residents have a chance to riot. Rough working conditions multiply the probability of riots. Police stations reduce the riot chance.
Illness probability is reduced when all needs are satisfied. Dense cities are more prone to illness. Hospitals reduce the illness chance.

After the tin rush, everything went to dust and decay.
They came here for salvation; never did they find it.
The ghostly emboss of a meeting place, but not a spirit of togetherness lingers.
They say the price of copper went up, and Ditchwater was no more.
A house for the tin that drew them here, and took them just the same.
Even during the boom, the tin men preferred to drink alone.
A hole within a hole. That's how much this place meant to them.
They were the last to leave, but by then there was no town to feed.
The water still passes through, as if it never existed.
The bailiffs put hundreds out of work, desolation being their duty.
The tin-pot dictator is first to leave when fortunes turn.
These are sturdy ruins, farmers do not have the tools nor skills to demolish them.
You need more people before you can demolish these ruins.
The prospect of building a blooming town once filled this place with vitality.
Once refuge of a solitary man, one of the few that remained.
Hard to picture children playing in these yards.
Only strong liquor kept the miners going.
Only creaking wood replaced the sounds of the livestock.
Barren as it ever was.
Only ashes remain to attest that this was once a lively place.
Ran dry along with the rest of the town's lifeblood.
Desecrated and devastated.
The owners gave up on them along with their hopes for a future.
There was never much to manage.
A small attempt at educating a new generation that never came to be.
Prosperous as ever during the tin rush, now left behind with the rest.
This once was a training camp for soldiers of a foreign Empire.
A bunch of barracks and overwatch towers used for slave workers.
Small encampment for overlooking intruders from the outside world.

NO LOCA MetaSession
Polar
Temperate
The New World
Calico's Rogues Snare a Merchant Ship

A helpless merchant brig is being pillaged by despicable pirates. Its captain is a friend to many of your crew, who are ready to die in order to save him. The pirates answer to Calico Roberts - the last terrible pirate - but the light is dim, and they have not noticed your ship.
Ask the advice of your former pirate

'I knew this would come in handy someday,' the old cove mutters, as he unravels the flag of Calico Roberts. 'They wouldn't dare tear their master's cloth!' As your ship steers into view with the new flag, the pirates do nothing. They fully believe you serve the same master! Your guns fire and surrender is quick. The merchants are grateful and offer considerable compensation!
Fire cannons at the pirates' ship

Success comes quickly. Volley after volley of ordnance so cleanly perforates the pirate hull, it is turned into alpine cheese. The surprised pirates are suddenly waving the white flag, and the skirmish is won. The merchants are thankful to see their goods returned and offer a fitting reward.

The attack is an abysmal failure. Almost every cannon shoots wayward, giving the pirates ample time to prepare their own onslaught. They laugh and cheer, and shout awful things as your tattered ship is forced to flee in shame.
Try to board the pirates' ship

It's a good fight in which the crew hold their nerve. At first range-finding proves difficult, alerting the pirates to ready their own guns. But after a few exchanges it is clear who is better-equipped, and the pirates raise the white flag. Although some of the men sustain injuries, the merchants are able to offer financial recompense.

The courageous crew triumph, rushing aboard quickly enough for it to be a surprise, before blowing half the pirates to dust with their blunderbusses. The remaining pirates drop their weapons, and the merchants are able to come out of hiding. 'A great reward is in order', they say, giving you a generous portion of the recovered loot.

Victory comes at a cost. Luck often plays a part in deck skirmishes, and your crew, unable to surprise the wary pirates, must take many casualties before asserting dominance. The merchants are indebted, and reward your rash heroism appropriately.

Boarding the ship is a grave mistake. The pirates are too quick and already have the initiative. The men are forced to retreat, kicking the boarding plank away. [AssetData([ExpeditionEventRequirement]) Text] and the others are condemned to a no-doubt gruesome fate.
Avoid the trouble spot entirely

'We're bloomin' cowards!' cries a furious sailor, as your ship whisks about, and sails briskly from danger. With the merchant ship left to the dogs, the crew fume at such a display of weakness at their friend's time of need.
Dockyard Dupe

Robbed! Thanking the generous innkeeper, your ship is ready to leave. Everyone at the dock smiles and waves you off, and no wonder, valuable equipment is later discovered to be missing. You must decide now if it's worth going back for.
Have the detective investigate
Return and plunder the Harbour
Return disguised and bait the robbers
Ask the local authorities to take action
Take the loss on the chin

The detective already knows. 'I was waiting to see if our crew were complicit, but am satisfied they are not.' Your ship returns and lays a watertight case before the local authorities. With the guilty arrested your equipment is returned and your ship fully resupplied gratis.
Swift justice. Petty defences crumble in the dawn light. Your ship yawns unopposed into the smouldering harbour, and turns its guns upon the harbourmaster's office. 'Please, take anything!' he yelps.
Your assault is too slow. As you gain the upper hand over the harbour defences, the cavalry appear. Cannons pop from the west; local authorities come as reinforcement.
An absolute shambles. Couldn't even best a few locals and their primitive demi-cannon. 'What shall defeat us next?' yelp those who are not killed by the blast, 'A small, but angry gang of tortoises?'
Fight them all

You put an end to corruption! Brought to their knees, the local authorities admit a conspiracy in which all are involved. 'It was never meant to go this far. We vow our people shall never rob again!' Proud to have effected change, you take back your possessions and leave.

The enemy force is vast. 'How many are there, captain!? We must turn back.' But it is too late. Soon it is not just the western cliff lit up with cannonfire, but your ship. Many lives will be lost before you crawl out of range.
Make peace, and reason with the officials.

They are wiling to listen. After an exasperating few days, you are finally able to prove your losses. The authorities take in the guilty dockers, and most, but not all of your possessions are returned.

The authorities stand with their own. You put your case as best you can, but it's not enough. Furthermore, you must answer for the damage you've caused. Unfortunately, this means leaving one of your best behind to help with repairs.

You rumble the schemers! The crew set aside superstition, daubing your ship a new name. Cut-throat sailors pose as officers, with cabin curtains repurposed as sashes to mark them strangely. Taken in by it all, the innkeeper and his dockside associates are caught in the act. You make sure to relieve them of far more than they stole.

It works, at first. A lick of paint, and the ship differs enough to blend in at the busy port. Moustaches and clothes aren't enough for the crafty innkeeper though. 'Thought you could fool us?' he scoffs.

With feeble disguises, your party can't believe the inn doesn't out them. But then there's laughter, as patrons turn in unison, guns held to your heads. 'Better hope its not cold where you go!' the innkeeper says. Your crew are stripped, bound, and packed off to sea.
Take back what is yours by force
Threaten to expose their scheme

Sometimes a fistfight is the only way. The inn is a hurricane of chair and glass, as your crew express themselves the only way they know how. Once the locals are subdued, the innkeeper is dragged outside, his life now security against whatever plunder you please.

The locals are brutal. Home-made knuckles, knives and cudgels scrape open the faces of your crew. Some are to bleed out on the sticky hostelry floor, the bloody remainder, to be packed off by the authorities for disturbance of the peace.

The innkeeper relents. 'We've got a good thing going here, and I don't want you spoiling it,' he sniffs, 'take what's yours and leave.' The crew have back what they lost, but thoughts are spared for the scheme's next unwary victims.
'Get out, before we scratch you out!' growls the innkeeper, true colours plain. It seems the whole port is on his side. The expedition must take the loss of time and equipment on the chin.

You make the case well. 'You are quite right. Terrible corruption such as this must be put to an end!' says the governor, 'you shall have back what was taken.' His disingenuousness stinks to high heaven, but there's no time for deeper digging.
They are corrupt. 'What a fantastical story. I am so glad our country has fired your imagination!' smiles the governor.
Risk implicating the governor
Resort to violence
Give up and leave

'Clever. Very clever.' He lights a cigar. 'How did you know the innkeeper was my brother?' Your emissary sensibly avoids the truth that it was guesswork. 'Take whatever you want,' he says gesturing to a warehouse bursting with seized goods.

'That was your last mistake,' chuckles the governor, as his poplar-lined palace swarms with militia, 'arrest these fops!' Your delegation try to resist, but they are armed only with the toothpicks that came with their canapes. Your expedition must manage without them.
'Alright, alright!' says the amused governor, bayonet to his neck, 'take what you want. But then you leave.' Since the harbour is now well-guarded, you've done well to force a compromise.

'That was a mistake,' chuckles the governor, as his poplar-lined palace swarms with militia, 'arrest them!' Your crew would rather die than be locked-up for life, so they fight their way out. At least, one or two of them do.

Widespread frustration among the crew. 'The instruments were vital for my research!', 'You let those beggars off scot free?!', 'This expedition is an embarrassment!' Hard to argue with their assessment, and bad for morale.

Widespread frustration among the crew. 'The instruments were vital for my research!', 'You let those beggars off scot free?!', 'This expedition is an embarrassment!' Hard to argue with their assessment, and bad for morale.
Wall of Ice

The ship has hit an iceberg! Navigating in the dark proved to be folly: what little lighting the ship provides for itself does not compensate for the absence of moonlight. A low thud shakes the entire boat, and the swinging lights of night lanterns reveal the rampart-like block of ice they have run into. A crevice splits the iceberg and the ship is stuck inside.
Destroy the iceberg with dynamite

No obstacle can prevail before human might. Sticks of dynamite are tied to the iceberg's flanks and lit in a perfect synchrony, exploding in a tidy and devastatingly efficient manner. Impressed by their own skill, the crew happily resumes the trip.
Bombard the ice with all cannons

The iceberg crumbles under the impressive firepower of the ship. The port and starboard cannons are fired, denting the ice inch by inch until it breaks into pieces which fall into the water with huge splashes. The ship's iron prow pushes against the formidable obstacle and breaks through under the cheers of the crew.

Those puny cannons cannot take down the wall of ice. Frozen shards rain on the deck with each new cannon blast, and they cut and slice into the sailors - tiny wounds which make it seem like the iceberg is fighting back. The crevice surrounding the ship has gotten bigger, but still refuses to let it go.
Climb the iceberg to plant explosives inside

A risky reward for a risky attempt. Using what nails and planks they can hammer into the wall of ice, a group of sailors climbs it and manages to reach its top, where they plant a barrel of gunpowder. The explosion lights the night, pulverizes the wall, and nicks the ship's hull. The vessel can leave after light repairs.

Climbing does not simply consist of walking upwards. The men slip, slide, shift and totter, and their best effort resides in climbing on each other's shoulders to try and reach new heights. They don't, and the human ladder crashes onto the deck, leaving all of its rungs bent or definitively broken. The remaining crew must wait for the ice to melt by itself before they can leave.
The iceberg is weakened, wait for it to melt

Days melt into weeks which melt into months. With each passing moment, the ice grows a bit weaker, but constant observation makes it seem like nothing is changing. The wait drives the crew restless and their tension escalates into regular, if unjustified, brawls. When the ice finally lets them go, all sailors have gained their small share of madness.
Build a device to push the ice away

The crew assembles a perfect lever to free the ship. Unbolting the decorative guardrail of the prow and roping it to the starboard railing, they manage to create a semblance of a pry bar which sneaks between the hull and the ice and pushes the latter away. The sailors row their way out to the cadence of a beloved song.

There is a difference between imagining and actually creating. The lever mechanism devised by the engineers is as unmanageable as it is ugly and the shape of the thing, which defies the very concept of aesthetics, is a testimony to its chaotic behaviour. The crew gives up any idea of building their own escape device.
Pray for help

Patience and good faith reward the sailors' prayers. The following day is devoid of clouds or wind and the perfect weather attracts fishing boats to deeper seas. The stuck ship is seen and rescued right away. The navigators hasten to warn their fellow seamen of the danger and are even offered a space in the prestigious Practical Pilot navigation guide. Such an accident will never happen again!

Prayers take a long time to reach whoever is listening. The crew waits, digging into their supplies and entertaining themselves however they can. Rescue finally comes after one full week in the form of a whaler which drags the ship out from its ice prison, and the sailors, relieved but tired, can't help but wonder if they could have made it out on their own.

Nobody is answering these prayers. After days of idling in the cold and gnawing through their supplies and patience, the crew's discontent rises to the extent that they cannot bear to wait any longer. If help does come, it will come from themselves.
Sea Still

Tangled! The Sargasso Sea was made famous by Columbus' sailors and their fear of entrapment: indeed, the vast surfaces of algae that stretch above the diamond waters look ominous, and their menace is confirmed by the ship standing still in their midst. Your own vessel avoids the brown plants, when a call rings from the stuck ship. There are still sailors onboard! You have no proper rescue equipment and risk getting tangled - should you try to help?
A steam ship fears no entanglement - go rescue them!

Your steam ship rides through the algae as if it was nothing. In fact, it is. The algae parts before your ship from the sole movement of the waves. Your sailors stay stunned as they see the legend break before them, and the rescued crew reveal their truth: it was the dreadfully calm winds of the Sargasso sea that caught their ship, not the flimsy algae. The saved sailors happily join your own and marvel at the steam ship's independence from the winds.
Help from a distance and fire a roped harpoon at their ship

A perfect shot. With just the right dosage of propulsion strength and aiming power, the harpoon strikes the stranded ship's starboard without damaging too much of its hull. The rope is collected by the crew onboard and they bind it to their railings before waiting for your instructions.
Tie a buoy to the improvised zip line and create a transportation device

A flawless breeches buoy. The buoy is tied with ropes and cloth to create a solid leg harness, allowing the stranded sailors to be pulled to your ship in an almost comfortable manner. Once freed of the algae embarked on their clothes, the rescued crew eagerly offer their services to repay their life debt.

The buoy comes undone with the first rescue attempt. As soon as a sailor climbs onto the contraption, it slips and swirls and sends him into the water. The ripples part the algae, revealing how meek the obstacle was: it was the still winds, not the plants, which prevented the ship from moving. The crews from both ships watch helplessly as the man drowns in the clear waters, before resuming their rescue in gloom and shame.
Encourage the sailors to climb the rope and cross the distance on their own

A surge of courage animates the stranded sailors. Under the cheers of your crew and the repeated encouragements of your lieutenants, they grab the rope and, with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Their miraculous rescue leaves them stronger and confident in both their skills and your crew's good will - they join your sailors without a second thought.

Hope alone cannot give them strength. Encouraged by your crew, one of the sailors of the stuck ship takes hold of the rope and suspends himself, legs crossed and hands gripping the hemp. As he begins his travel the coarse fibbers nibble his skin and the blood rushes to his head. He grabs a new handful of rope, fails, slips, falls. If he manages to climb back onboard, no other volunteer wishes to attempt the crossing, and you have to leave without a single sailor rescued.

Harpooning a ship without sinking it requires skills you crew doesn't have. The harpoon crashes into the stranded vessel and breaks through its starboard, allowing water to gush inside. Panicked screams emerge from the ship as several sailors jump into the water's algae in a desperate attempt to save themselves.
Send strong sailors with buoys to rescue them

The rescue is cruelly easy. Your sailors plunge into the waters and see the algae part before them: there's no real obstacle here. They grab the stranded crew as it drifts to them and bring them back onboard, where the rescued men explain that it was the dead winds which forced their ship to stay still. Their thankfulness is barely enough to erase your wasted efforts and the shame of your crew.

The rescue is a failure. Your sailors push each other, trying to swim while pulling the huge buoys, and they paddle like young dogs discovering their first waters. They are exhausted way before they can reach the stranded ship, and they turn around despite your crew's encouragements and the lieutenants' orders. There is no ignoring the curses of the drowning sailors as your ship sails away.
You will not risk sharing their entangled fate: leave

We did what we could. Fully aware that your crew's attempt did nothing but worsen the stranded sailors' fate, your lieutenants attempt a speech to lighten their burden. The sailors pretend to cheer up, but the thought of the abandoned ship stays with them.
Do not take any risk and leave

Someone better equipped might come their way. Or we will call for help at the next harbour. Or this could be a trap. Or we didn't really hear a call. Excuses after excuses are discussed this night, and none sounds true enough for the sailors' hearts to be at peace.
The Ghost Ship

After weeks of hot weather, supplies of drinking water have become dangerously low. It therefore seems a minor miracle when a fellow ship appears on the horizon, for surely they have water to share? But as it draws near, the crew is aghast, for there is no sign of life aboard. 'It is a ghost ship, we must flee before it is too late!' they cry.
Send a diver to check it out

The diver does remarkably to spot the fiends furled in sails, or waiting under barrels to ambush, should your men have boarded. Your ship draws alongside the vessel as if to pass, but then unleashes enough cannon-fire to drown it. The crew are elated, believing they have done the oceans a great service.
Heathen superstition! Board the ship!
Heavens shine upon you, for whatever caused the crew to vacate this ship seems no longer a concern. Better yet, the lord has seen fit to provide the water you seek.
The ship's hold contains an unholy mound of corpses. 'God hath forsaken these men', says the doctor, 'but how?'
Have the doctor investigate what happened
'We are lucky indeed, for malaria cannot reach us now.' says the doctor confidently. This swift diagnosis confirms the crew are pleased to load up the drinking water they have been gasping for.

'Touch nothing! Get off the ship,' frets the doctor, who believes a dreadful plague has taken the crew of this ill-fated vessel. Perhaps drinking water is itself the cause. The crew are miserable time has been wasted, and that their thirst is still not slaked.

The doctor is inconsolable, 'it is plague. I lanced a bubo, and it ruptured suddenly upon my person!' That the water be contaminated is misery enough, but to have to abandon the good doctor is a disaster! Your expedition drifts glumly on.
Leave the ship immediately

No relief at escaping the grotesque mound of corpses, can compensate the terrible thirst of your crew. There are murmurings that no such expedition can succeed if 'gift horses always be looked in the mouth.'

The crew are so faithless, that every creaking plank aboard the ghostly ship raises a whimper. So when a banshee howl erupts from below deck, every sailor runs for their life. One poor soul trips in a coil of rigging and cracks their head upon an iron capstan. The death exposes all the more the crew's foolishness.
Leave and hope to find an island with drinking water soon

No relief at escaping the disturbingly empty ship, can compensate the terrible thirst of your crew. There are murmurings that no such expedition can succeed if 'gift horses always be looked in the mouth.'
Terrifyingly, the ship takes after yours in pursuit. Who knows what dread hands operate its multifarious controls!
Try to outrun the awful vessel!
Your ship manages to escape the ghoulish clutches of that unwholesome adversary, but have no drinking water, or anything else, to show for the ordeal.

Your ship is not agile enough. Men pour into the waves from where enemy cannons punch holes. Seemingly contented with this sacrifice, the dread sentience commanding the vessel calls off its dreadful pursuit.
Turn and face it, whatever it is!

Pirates! But trickery cannot match the power of a modern seaship! Summarily demolished, a few of them are left clinging to wreckage. They beg to join your cause - unpaid. Such are the dwindling prospects of piracy in this day! The crew will jibe at them, but secretly all must be elated to have acquired such sea-wisdom for free.

A pirate nuisance! Though their scurvy deception gives them advantage, they are like many of their creed, rather jaded. By the time their ship is sunk, it has cost you a few good men. Yet the recovery of precious drinking water in among the flotsam, assuages the grief of your crew.

Bloody pirates! A terrible menace even in this day and age! Your crew are outmanoeuvred, outsmarted, and your ship is reeled-in for boarding. Many are killed in valiant defence of the company, but to no avail. Your vessel is duly ransacked for supplies, before the villains are again on their way.
The Visitation

An undesirable visitor haunts the ship. Fleeting silhouettes, knocking and screeching sounds. Each morning the ship appears in utter disarray. 'A night fiend,' gulps the hardiest of old crewmen, as he sweeps debris from the deck. As night draws in again, you realise something must be done.
Listen to your expert

Every right to a little joke. 'These claw marks!' the naturalist feigns horror. 'Is it something terrible?!' asks a fearful sailor. But the naturalist can bite tongue no longer, and succumbs to laughter; 'No! Good heavens. We have a mother and kittens aboard!' The cat family is found in a barrel, which, it is agreed, shall serve as their home for the duration. The crew dote on the little rascals, their presence a great comfort.
Perform an exorcism

Each sailor strides with inner conviction, as they form a procession of candles behind the smug-looking priest, flooding holy light into every heathen crevice. The priest's ritual is unfaltering, and not only are the crew rid of the night-time menace, but now believe it is god's plan the expedition will succeed.
