You are true navigators. Stick to the map no matter what. Yes the odd hack with a machete is wanted, but that's the terrain! Ramón's 'S' mark lies above a promising cleft in rock. Could this be the domain of the elusive Sarmento?! Oil lamps light the way to a large cavern. A fire prevails in its centre, and at your arrival, figures about it stand and draw their weapons. The foremost of them has a face most charismatic, a picture of defiance.

There is a dispute regarding the map. Some of the group go ahead to check. When they do not return, the rest try to follow. They fall straight into the same trap. 'One false move and we kill you,' growls their leader. It appears these are Isabel's people. If only you could prove you share in their cause.
Follow the human tracks

You hunt well. Believing the tracks too good to be true, your crew stay alert. Sure enough, a second, faint set leads away from the first - which were surely there as a red herring. You find a promising cleft in rock. Could this be the domain of the elusive Sarmento?! Oil lamps light the way to a large cavern. A fire prevails in its centre, and at your arrival, figures about it stand and draw their weapons. The foremost of them has a face most charismatic, a picture of defiance.

Suspiciously easy. 'It feels liked we've missed something. Any old man and his dog could follow these prints,' says your tracker. 'That's the idea,' says a voice. Uh-oh...'One false move and we kill you,' growls their leader. It appears these are Isabel's people. If only you could prove you share in their cause.

'Why didn't we stick to the map?!' moan your crew at gunpoint. Someone thought taking a shortcut through dense undergrowth was a good idea. Turns out it was perfect for an ambush.'One false move and we kill you,' growls their leader. You realise these are Isabel's people, but it seems they take you to be executed! If only you could prove you share in their cause.
Wait for your moment to disarm them

A classic ruse! Your men know it from the army. "Watch out! Jaguar!" bellows a former soldier. Your captors look to the trees, only to have their weapons ripped free in the same moment. Your men show they mean no harm. Naturally Isabel's men remain cautious, as you are led to a promising cleft in the rock. Oil lamps light the way to a large cavern. A fire prevails in its centre, and at your arrival, figures about it stand and draw their weapons. The foremost of them has a face most charismatic, a picture of defiance.

You choose the wrong moment, and one of you gets a good whack on the head for it. 'Lucky we are expecting you,' says the leader, 'you can come with us, but I warn you, no funny business.' Naturally Isabel's men remain cautious, as you are led to a promising cleft in the rock. Oil lamps light the way to a large cavern. A fire prevails in its centre, and at your arrival, figures about it stand and draw their weapons. The foremost of them has a face most charismatic, a picture of defiance.
Convince them of your good intentions

They visibly soften, when it is mentioned your father is Samuel Goode. "Isabel will see you," says the leader, "just don't ask me what she will do with you." Naturally Isabel's men remain cautious, as you are led to a promising cleft in the rock. Oil lamps light the way to a large cavern. A fire prevails in its centre, and at your arrival, figures about it stand and draw their weapons. The foremost of them has a face most charismatic, a picture of defiance.

This is no time for delicacy. Your diplomats are too roundabout in their explanations. 'Shut up, shut up, shut up!' the leader knocks your silly sod out with the butt of his rifle. 'We know who you are, come with us already.' Naturally Isabel's men remain cautious, as you are led to a promising cleft in the rock. Oil lamps light the way to a large cavern. A fire prevails in its centre, and at your arrival, figures about it stand and draw their weapons. The foremost of them has a face most charismatic, a picture of defiance.
Build a raft and take the quicker river route
It holds well enough, accommodating all. The current is getting stronger, as if up ahead some hazard awaits. 'I don't know if she'll take a bump,' says the captain.
Disembark and follow the map instead

'Bingo!' bark your proud orienteers, pointing at the tunnels. 'Guerrilla tubes,' says the captain with a sage nod. They match the map, leading to a promising cleft in rock. Could this be the domain of the elusive Sarmento?! Oil lamps light the way to a large cavern. A fire prevails in its centre, and at your arrival, figures about it stand and draw their weapons. The foremost of them has a face most charismatic, a picture of defiance.

'Why didn't we stick to the map?' lament the crew. But the lure of guerrilla tunnels they found beside the river was too much. After crawling forever, they come to an opening. Above, a battery of guns are trained on their heads.'One false move and we kill you,' growls their leader. It appears these are Isabel's people. If only you could prove you share in their cause.
Reinforce the raft and keep paddling

Huzzah for bootlaces! The tightly-wound logs bounce over the edge..."Waaaaaah! What a thrill!" exclaims the captain, as you splash into the clear pool. Beside it is a promising cleft in the rock. Could this be the domain of the elusive Sarmento?! Oil lamps light the way to a large cavern. A fire prevails in its centre, and at your arrival, figures about it stand and draw their weapons. The foremost of them has a face most charismatic, a picture of defiance.

Not sturdy enough! A hard knock on the rapids leaves your men clutching timber. It is only then they realise they are being watched. There is laughter from the riverbank, before the bystanders pull them from the water at gunpoint.
'One false move and we kill you,' growls their leader. It appears these are Isabel's people. If only you could prove you share in their cause.

A feeble craft! One bump on a sharp bend leaves your men clutching timber. It is only then they realise they are being watched. There is laughter from the riverbank, before the bystanders pull them from the water at gunpoint. 'One false move and we kill you,' growls their leader. It appears these are Isabel's people. If only you could prove you share in their cause.
That's the spot!
You have discovered a suitable area for a base camp! The first step to rescue Captain Faithful is done. Lady Faithful will be thankful.
The Chasing

Through the canons heavy smoke, the lookout sees a Pyrphorian gunboat sailing away and disappearing in the distance. The contract might be on board, chasing the ship is crucial! While the crew sails away in the same direction, it is time to think about a strategy.
Study the maps to estimate its next supply stop and the way to it

Navigator is good, seeing the destination the ship took, knowing the small size of the ship will require him to resupply soon, along with the study of local map it is clear it will have to round around the Ventura island to resupply in Montoya harbour. Sure enough, catching up by skirting the island from the other side, the Pyrphorian ship is on sight! If the contract is on board, we must be careful not to sink the ship captain!" says the first mate.
Shot at the mast to immobilize the ship

Perfect aim, the canons break the mast in two, the ship is immobilized. When falling the mast crash several Pyrphorian under it. The crew gets on board and kills the few resisting Pyrphorian easily. Search the ship, find the contract in the captain cabin.
The mast is touched but does not break. If we can't disable their mast we must make the crew stops operating the ship.
Rope swing to the ship and kill its crew
Continue to shot canons at the mast
Land on the ship perfectly, next to Pyro. Kill them quickly and capture the rest. The ship is immobilized, search the contract, find it in the captain cabin.

Miss completely, the rope swing might look cool on book illustrations but in real battle it needs real skills. Most of the crew fall to the water, the few which land on the ship are easy target. The small Pyrphorian ship crew know they won't be a match in the long run so take this opportunity to leave at once, using the back flamethrower to burn your ship hull and deck badly. Assured you won't be able to follow them due to the intense repairs now necessary.
Seeing their direction, the captain knows it is likely they will resupply at Montoya harbour. Once all the repairs are done, sail there.

Perfect aim, the canons break the mast in two, the ship is immobilized. When falling the mast crash several Pyrphorian under it. The crew gets on board and kills the few resisting Pyrphorian easily. Search the ship, find the contract in the captain cabin.

The crew misses completely, the canons balls fall to the sea. The Pyrphorian fire the flamethrowers to full power toward your deck and your crew, burning wood and flesh badly. The small Pyrphorian ship crew know they won't be a match in the long run, takes this opportunity to leave at once. Assured you won't be able to follow them due to the intense repairs now necessary they leave to the horizon.
Seing their direction, the captain knows it is likely they will resupply at Montoya harbour. Once all the repairs are done, sail there. Find the Pyro ship docked.

The crew misses completely, the canons balls fall to the sea. The small Pyrphorian ship crew know they won't be a match in the long run, takes this opportunity to leave at once while using the back flamethrower to burn your ship hull and deck badly. Assured you won't be able to follow them due to the intense repairs now necessary they leave to the horizon.
Their overconfidence will be their down fall. The captain knows it is likely they will resupply at Montoya harbour. Once all the repairs are done, sail there.
Board the Pyrphorian ship and kill its crew

The crew are master killers, they don't leave a chance to the Pyrphorian sailors. Their heavy technology is of no use faced to the quick attacks. In a few minutes the ship is wiped out of his occupants. Searching for the contract, they find it in the captain cabin.

The fight is even, the Pyro are good fighters, as is the crew. However the Pyro are now running toward their flame throwers which can cause damages to the crew. A change of tactic is necessary to overcome them, and fast!
Take down the flamethrower shooters one by one

Great gunslingers, the hunters manage to take down every Pyrphorian rushing to the flamethrower. The one remaining on deck are easy target for the seasoned sailors without their piece of technology. Once all dead or captured, search the contract and find it in the captain cabin.

Miss shot completely, the Pyrphorians manage to get to the flamethrowers and burn your ship badly. The small Pyrphorian ship crew know they won't be a match in the long run so take this opportunity to leave at once, assured you won't be able to follow them due to the intense repairs now necessary.
The captain knows it is likely they will resupply at Montoya harbour. Once all the repairs are done, sail there.
Disable the flame throwers with the ship canons
Manage to, the canons operators are bull eyed. The crew gets the upper hand, kill and capture all the Pyro. Searching for the contract, they find it in the captain cabin.

Hard to aim precisely with a canons, only master operators would have pulled that through. The canons balls fall to the sea while the Pyro put their flame throwers to full power, carbonising the members of your crew who didn't manage to get back to the ship on time. The Pyro ship sails away quickly, the remaining crew is too weakened to be able to chase them. However the lookout notices the Pyro ship hasn't sailed far away, they headed to a huge harbour.

Despite the low number of Pyrphorian, the poor sailors are no match for the skilled Pyrphorian warriors. After a few blow most jump back to the ship cowardly, not ready to be killed over a piece of paper.
The small Pyrphorian ship crew know they won't be a match in the long run so take this opportunity to leave at once, assured you won't be able to follow them due to the intense repairs now necessary.
The captain knows it is likely they will resupply at Montoya harbour. Once all the repairs are done, sail there.

The navigator is lost and can barely make sense of where his own ship is. The Pyrphorian ship is now far gone, chasing after him now is a gamble. A small colonial harbour is close to the ship position. It might be worth to ask crews stationed here if they know where the ship is most likely to have headed to in the area. But it might also very well be risky, colonial harbour are not the most friendly toward the Queen men.
Don't stop, check all the harbours in the vicinities and hope to find them

The captain chooses to go first to the huge commercial hub of Montoya, which from instinct seems to be the most obvious option seeing all the ships heading toward it. At the harbour recognize the Pyrphorian ship. The crew fled into the city but it might not be too late.

The captain makes a list of all harbours in the vicinities and orders to visit them all one by one, from the closest to the furthest. Unfortunately they don't find the Pyro ship anywhere. Maybe it was never there, maybe it left before they finally arrived. After days of travelling they have to face the truth: the ship is definitively lost.
Stop in the harbour and ask for the information

The diplomat recognizes correctly among the ships stationed the flag of the one who is an ally to the crown. Its captain is happy to help, saying the harbour of Montoya is the biggest in the area and the most logical stop. Indeed, once there, the crew recognize the Pyro ship among the ships docked there. They lost a bit of time, the crew has fled into the city but it might not be too late.

The diplomat asks to the crew of the first ship their encounter, failing to recognize the flag of an adversary of the crown. Smirking, the captain gives the crew a direction. Obviously, his indication leads nowhere and it is far too late when they realise they followed the wrong track. The ship is definitively lost.
Rely on the lookout to guide you to it

Despite the Pyrphorian ship being fast and almost out of sight, the lookout manages to never loose it. Even better, he notices that the ship is rounding an island which has a sea inlet going through it. By manoeuvring carefully in it, the crew might manage to arrive on the other side at the same time as the Pyro ship.
Take the risk and sail in the inlet

Tricky manoeuvring but masterfully executed by the captain. The other side of the island is quickly reached. The Pyro ship is right there, easy to intercept for the crew who takes advantage of the surprise effect. Stunned, the Pyro crew doesn't even have time to reach for their canons and flame throwers, they are surrounded in a mater of seconds. Searching for the contract on board, the sailors find it in the captain cabin.

Was too difficult for the inexperienced captain. The boat takes time to cross the narrow inlet, damaging the hull at every chock on the shore. quickly get stuck in the too narrow inlet. When they finally sail off the inlet they realize it flows into a huge harbour where they recognize the distinctive Pyro ship. All is not lost, they might still be able to regain their honour.
Take the same path as the ship, round the island
When the crew arrives on the other side of the island no Pyro ship is sailing. However there is a huge harbour with the Pyro ship docked there. They fled into the city but it might not be too late.

The lookout completely fails to recognize the Pyro ship among the other ships sailing away. Leading the crew in the wrong direction they eventually realize they are not catching up with the ship. A small colonial harbour is close to the ship position. It might be worth to ask crews stationed here if they know where the ship is most likely to have headed to in the area. But it might also very well be risky, colonial harbour are not the most friendly toward the Queen men.
Study the map to estimate their most likely docking point

The navigator is sure of himself, considering the small size of the ship and the time which has passed since it left Izabel's island, the Pyrphorian will need to resupply. The best place to do that is the harbour of Montoya, a huge commercial hub. Indeed, when on sight, the crew recognizes the Pyro ship docked. They lost a bit of time, the crew has fled into the city but it might not be too late.

The navigator is as much as a failure as the lookout. Proposing a series of harbours , none of them is actually likely to have crossed by the Pyrphorian ship considering its initial direction. Loosing their time they also lost the track, there is no way they will be able to find them now.
Stop in the harbour and ask for the information

The diplomat recognizes correctly among the ships stationed the flag of the one who is an ally to the crown. Its captain is happy to help, pointing in the right direction toward the harbour of Montoya. Indeed, once there, the crew recognize the Pyro ship among the ships docked there. They lost a bit of time, the crew has fled into the city but it might not be too late.

The diplomat asks to the crew of the first ship their encounter, failing to recognize the flag of an adversary of the crown. Smirking, the captain gives the crew a direction. Obviously, his indication leads nowhere and it is far too late when they realise they followed the wrong track. The ship is definitively lost.
The Investigation

Montoya harbour is huge, clearly a centre for commerce in the region. But it is also known to be a gathering point for all the scum and criminals who have their networks here. Finding people here will be tricky.
Convince the harbour master to give information about the Pyro ship occupants

Diplomat manage to make the crew appears as authority figures, ready to take care of the problems the ship owners cause in the city. The harbour master is relieved, hope the crew will repair the wrong the Pyro have been doing. "Every time they come here iit is a nightmare for us! I would be glad if you manage to deal with them!" He gives them the contact address written on his register. Go there, outside the city.
The diplomat simply states the crew need to find the owner of the ship stationed in the harbour. The harbour master seems to have information but is scared to give them.
Bribe, money always calm nerves
Bribe
Bribe
Give info, on the register an address is noted. Go there, outside the city.
Cancel

The harbour master looks at the goods, clearly interested, but dismiss the proposal at once when he sees the so small amount the captain is ready to give away. "No sorry, I am not taking a risk for so little!"
Threaten him
Reassure him
He is intimidated, give the address on the register. Go there, outside the city.
What an impressive display of strength! Shaking, the harbour master leads them to a house. "This it, now leave me out of it please!" and leaves at once.
He is reassured, give the address on the register. Go there, outside the city.
"You are such good people, I ... I think I can trust you." He leads the crew to a house. "This is it, please do what needs to be done!" and he leaves at once in fear.

A speech for the ages! The diplomat was lyrical, impressive in his description of the madness the Pyrphorian are capable of, emotional when he states what is at stake. The harbour master is clearly moved. "Oh if only we had more people ready to stand against evil like you do! It is my pleasure to help you." He leads them to a house. "This is it, I count on you." and leaves at once, visibly frighten he could be seen by the house occupants.
Break the door open and rush in

The crew uses a bench as a ram and break the door open. They storm in, sure to find a bunch of surprised Pyrphorian. Instead, they realize they were expected. The men are strong, armed, and ready to strike. The battle is harsh but fortunately the men didn't expect for the crew to be so numerous and strong. Crew has the upper hand but suffer from several injuries. Interrogate roughly a surviving attacker and learn they are from the local mafia, allied to the Pyrphorian and charged to take care of any nosey coming around. Get adress, go there, outside the city.

The sailors rush on the door at the same time, entending to break it with their shoulders. The only result is a few broken bones but a perfectly standing door. And the second attempt the door opens suddenly before they touch it, making a few sailors fall. They are immediately slained. Each sailor entering is met with a blow, clearly showing the men inside were well prepared for their arrival. The battle is unbalanced and quickly turn into a slaughter. One young sailor manages to escape while all his comrades are killed.
Sneak inside

Manage to sneak around the house discretely and enter through the back door. Once inside, while they were expecting a fairly empty house realize there is a lot of man patrolling in it, all very well armed, prepared around the front door for intruders entering. A trap! Fortunately their discretion gives the crew the upper hand and allows them to attack by surprise. The battle is harsh, the crew suffers from several injuries but they end up winning. Interrogate roughly a surviving attacker and learn they are from the local mafia, allied to the Pyrphorian and charged to take care of any nosey coming around. Get the adress, go there, outside the city.

Not discrete, are noticed as soon as they try to enter the house. It is not a normal house, it is clearly filled to the roof of armed men, awaiting intruders. A trap! The battle is unbalanced and quickly turn into a slaughter. One young sailor manages to escape while all his comrades are killed.
Spread the crew in the city, ear picking discretely for info

Are spread and discretely occupy the space. Overhear conversations. One if particularly interesting about an unknown man who recently bought a magnificent orange house in the Placa district. Since buying it, the house is constantly guarded and visited by the strangest bunch. Go there, outside the city.

Do not hear anything of substance but are discrete enough to not have been noticed ear picking. Two sailors suggest to talk to people known for knowing everything about the city habitants: one sailor suggests to talk to the priest, with the confession they always know what nobody else knows. Another suggests to go to the brothel, it is known many secrets are shared when lying in bed.
Go to the church and ask the priest help

Priest see the faith the crew has and believe them when they say the Pyro are to be stopped for the greater good. Tell them that several of his flock have reported being worried about the visitors of a house in the Placa district, bought recently by a wealthy but anonymous man. Go there, outside the city.

Priest is glad to be able to help to crew. "God always help those who put faith in him!" He leads them to a house. "Many of my flock have told me about their fear of the people living there, a faithless organization devoted to evil spirits. It would be real blessing if you deliver us from them." He then leave at once, refusing to part in violence.
Go to the brothel and ask for the prostitutes help

Gladly help. Tell them some of their clients belong to a strange group gathering in a house in the Placa district. Their activities seemed suspicious but they were too proud of themselves not to discard some information about it. Go to the address, outside the city.
Refuse to help if you don't pay for the service. Time is money.
Pay for the service and have the men behave

Sailors are good guests. Not only pay their parts but also behave correctly. Once the hour ends the Madam decides to give the crew the info they are looking for. Some of their clients belong to a strange group gathering in a house in the Placa district. Their activities seemed suspicious but they were too proud of themselves not to discard some information about it. Go to the address, outside the city.

After an hour several bottles have been consumed, many words exchanged, the crew is having a great time. One prostitute then asks the crew to follow her to the house of one of her client, outside the city. "He is part of a strange organization but he is too boastful to keep it for himself. I am sure they are the people you are looking for, they match in every way."
Threaten them
Work. Give right address, outside the city.

Comply, seem afraid of what the crew might do. One prostitute asks the crew to follow her to the house of one of her client, outside the city.. "He is part of a strange organization but he is too boastful to keep it for himself. I am sure they are the people you are looking for, they match in every way."

The crew waits and ear picks for hours but ears nothing. Couldn't handle it more, sailors starts to ask directly to people in the street if they know about the Pyrphorian. Luckily, after they gave a coin to two boys who promised they knew everything going on in the city they agree to lead them to a house where "a strange religious group" gathers often.
The Infiltration

House and its grand French garden around it is seeable from the street but is surrounded by a high fence with two guards at the gate. Many guards are patrolling in the garden. Infiltrating the house won't be easy. Finding the contract there even less.
Play it bold, launch a group assault on the house guards
Attack the two guards at the door, kill them, take their keys and storm in, combat position. The guards are surprised and scattered, easier to get them now before they regroup.
Attack the guards frontally

Take one guard after the next before they have time to form a group and defend each others. In a few minute the beautiful white roses of French garden are painted red. The way to the house is free.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Not good enough and fast enough to kill all the guards before they have a chance to regroup. Gathering their spirit they manage to put on a good defence before they are defeated. A few sailors are injured but they got the upper hand.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Take down the guards from a distance

Fall one after the other. In a few minutes it is silent again, the way to the house is free.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Don't aim well enough. Most guards have time to regroup. Gathering their spirit they manage to put on a good defence before they are defeated. A few sailors are injured but they got the upper hand.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

The crew storms at the two guards at the gate. However while the guards clearly benefited from military training, the crew is more disorganized. The guards manage to hold them just long enough for the reinforcement to regroup before falling, defeated. When the crew opens the gates the bulk of the troop is waiting for them, ready to harvest them.
Let them pierce the crew centre group to surround them on the flanks

Marathon battle style. It works, the guards are defeated. A few sailors are injured but now the road to the house is open.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

A good military strategy is only good when well executed. This move cost more lives than if the un properly trained sailors had fight like they usually do, bar fight style. The battle lasts long and many good men are killed before the crew manages to finally get the upper hand. The road to the house is free but they must clearly act fast to find the contract before the reinforcement come.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Have the captain charge first, giving courage to all

Lord of the Ring style. The captain takes his swords and run toward the guards. The crew follows him and closes on the guards in a few seconds, as if animated by a divine push. The guards are defeated. A few sailors are injured but now the road to the house is open.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Who did he think he was? Hero of ancient tales? At the first blow on their captain the crew conviction that they represent a greater good and will therefore be protected shatters. The battle is a bloodshed like many, nothing heroic about it. Many good men are killed before the crew manages to finally get the upper hand. The road to the house is free but they must clearly act fast to find the contract.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Play it sneaky, have the most discrete man go around the house
Climb above the garden fence discreetly, manage to sneak around and find the kitchen door on the east aisle aside from the patrols. Unfortunately it is closed.
Use the sword as a lever and push

Success, is in.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Make too much noise and even hurt himself in the process. The door resists. The noise of the guards boots is getting closer, he must run away. Hides in a grove but a lot of guards are passing by, alerted by the noise.
Shape a pin to pick the window lock

Success, is in.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
The lock resists the incapable hands.
Risk staying longer and use the sword as a lever

Success, is in
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Makes a lot of noise and even hurt himself in the process. The door resists. The noise attracts the now close guards. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
Be safe, leave quickly
The man runs away and hides in a grove. A lot of guards are passing by.

To be as effective as a shadow one must not simply need to move discretely but also pick the right path to do so. While discrete when climbing the fence, the man chose a too risky path and is forced to jump down in a grove. Many patrols are walking around him and it is now too dangerous to back track.
Kill one of the guards and take his uniform

The man is quick and strong. Without having the time to scream or gasp of surprise the guards is on the floor. The man hides him in a grove and take his uniform. He can know walk into the house unsuspiciously.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Jumping on the guard as fast a possible, the man is not strong enough to knock him in one blow. The guard screams and alerts his companions. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
Climb quickly in a tree and wait for the right opening

Manage to climb fast enough to not be spotted. From up there see a balcony with a window open to where he will be able to jump. After a while the sneaky guy has an opportunity to leave his spot and jumps successfully.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Is spotted as he climbs. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
Play it subtle, disguise a man as a servant to enter through the main gate
Convincing disguise. "The password?" enquires the guard at the gate.
Hades
Inferno
Hel

"After you sir." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.

Good password, enter.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

"After you sir." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
The disguise is absolutely not convincing. "Who are you?" barks the guard. "State your intentions!"
Talk your way in
"Fine but nobody enters without the password!"
Inferno

Right password, enter.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Hel

"Oh sorry, I didn't realize you were from the house. After you." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
Hades

"Oh sorry, I didn't realize you were from the house. After you." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.

"Oh of course! Pardon me my lord!" Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
No more talking, launch the assault
Look for the archive room

Large shelves with a lot of documents classified and objects under glass protection. Don't find anything 'P like Prosperity, G as Goode, etc' but notice a beautiful diamond. Sailors ask if they can take it, the expedition would come back richer than when it left.
Look for the master bedroom

Beautiful room, large bed, royal like. Open the night stand, find a silver ring in it but no contract. Sailors ask if they can take it, the expedition would come back richer than when it left.
Go to office, break the desk open, contract inside.
Look for the office

Office, a single desk made of beautiful polished wood. Drawers closed. Break them open with a dagger, find jade pearl inside but no contract. Sailors ask if they can take it, the expedition would come back richer than when it left.
Go to master bedroom, in the nightstand find the contract.

Beautiful room, large bed, royal like. Find no contract but a Poseidon statue is here for decoration. Sailors ask if they can take it, the expedition would come back richer than when it left.
Go to archive room. One of the files as been badly put back in place, take it, inside there is the contract.
Look for the archive room

Large shelves with a lot of documents classified and objects under glass protection. Don't find anything 'P like Prosperity, G as Goode, etc' but notice a jade pearl. Sailors ask if they can take it, the expedition would come back richer than when it left.

The Investigation

Discouraged, the crew comes back to Izabel's island. "We lost them" says the captain. But a few days afterward, Izabel receives a letter: "Pyrphorian spotted in Montoya harbour. Their ship is docked but their hide is nowhere to be found." Receiving this information, the crew leaves at once.
Montoya harbour is huge, clearly a centre for commerce in the region. But it is also known to be a gathering point for all the scum and criminals who have their networks here. Finding people here will be tricky.
Convince the harbour master to give information about the Pyro ship occupants

Diplomat manage to make the crew appears as authority figures, ready to take care of the problems the ship owners cause in the city. The harbour master is relieved ship to repair the wrong they have been doing. "Every time they come here iit is a nightmare for us! I would be glad if you manage to deal with them!" He gives them the contact address written on his register. Go there.
The diplomat simply states the crew need to find the owner of the ship stationed in the harbour. The harbour master seems to have information but is scared to give them.
Bribe, money always calm nerves
Bribe
Give info, on the register an address is noted. Go there.
Cancel

The harbour master looks at the goods, clearly interested, but dismiss the proposal at once when he sees the so small amount the captain is ready to give away. "No sorry, I am not taking a risk for so little!"
Threaten him
Reassure him
He is intimidated, give the address on the register. Go there.
What an impressive display of strength! Shaking, the harbour master leads them to a house. "This it, now leave me out of it please!" and leaves at once.
He is reassured, give the address on the register. Go there.
"You are such good people, I ... I think I can trust you." He leads the crew to a house. "This is it, please do what needs to be done!" and he leaves at once in fear.

A speech for the ages! The diplomat was lyrical, impressive in his description of the madness the Pyrphorian are capable of, emotional when he states what is at stake. The harbour master is clearly moved. "Oh if only we had more people ready to stand against evil like you do! It is my pleasure to help you." He leads them to a house. "This is it, I count on you." and leaves at once, visibly frighten he could be seen by the house occupants.
Break the door open and rush in

The crew uses a bench as a ram and break the door open. They storm in, sure to find a bunch of surprised Pyrphorian. Instead, they realize they were expected. The men are strong, armed, and ready to strike. The battle is harsh but fortunately the men didn't expect for the crew to be so numerous and strong. Crew has the upper hand but suffer from several injuries. Interrogate roughly a surviving attacker and learn they are from the local mafia, allied to the Pyrphorian and charged to take care of any nosey coming around.

The sailors rush on the door at the same time, entending to break it with their shoulders. The only result is a few broken bones but a perfectly standing door. And the second attempt the door opens suddenly before they touch it, making a few sailors fall. They are immediately slained. Each sailor entering is met with a blow, clearly showing the men inside were well prepared for their arrival. The battle is unbalanced and quickly turn into a slaughter. One young sailor manages to escape while all his comrades are killed.
Sneak inside

Manage to sneak around the house discretely and enter through the back door. Once inside, while they were expecting a fairly empty house realize there is a lot of man patrolling in it, all very well armed, prepared around the front door for intruders entering. A trap! Fortunately their discretion gives the crew the upper hand and allows them to attack by surprise. The battle is harsh, the crew suffers from several injuries but they end up winning. Interrogate roughly a surviving attacker and learn they are from the local mafia, allied to the Pyrphorian and charged to take care of any nosey coming around.

Not discrete, are noticed as soon as they try to enter the house. It is not a normal house, it is clearly filled to the roof of armed men, awaiting intruders. A trap! The battle is unbalanced and quickly turn into a slaughter. One young sailor manages to escape while all his comrades are killed.
Spread the crew in the city, ear picking discretely for info

Are spread and discretely occupy the space. Overhear conversations. One if particularly interesting about an unknown man who recently bought a magnificent orange house in the Placa district. Since buying it, the house is constantly guarded and visited by the strangest bunch. Go there.

Do not hear anything of substance but are discrete enough to not have been noticed ear picking. Two sailors suggest to talk to people known for knowing everything about the city habitants: one sailor suggests to talk to the priest, with the confession they always know what nobody else knows. Another suggests to go to the brothel, it is known many secrets are shared when lying in bed.
Go to the church and ask the priest help

Priest see the faith the crew has and believe them when they say the Pyro are to be stopped for the greater good. Tell them that several of his flock have reported being worried about the visitors of a house in the Placa district, bought recently by a wealthy but anonymous man.

Priest is glad to be able to help to crew. "God always help those who put faith in him!" He leads them to a house. "Many of my flock have told me about their fear of the people living there, a faithless organization devoted to evil spirits. It would be real blessing if you deliver us from them." He then leave at once, refusing to part in violence.
Go to the brothel and ask for the prostitutes help

Gladly help. Tell them some of their clients belong to a strange group gathering in a house in the Placa district. Their activities seemed suspicious but they were too proud of themselves not to discard some information about it. Go to the address.
Refuse to help if you don't pay for the service. Time is money.
Pay for the service and have the men behave

Sailors are good guests. Not only pay their parts but also behave correctly. Once the hour ends the Madam decides to give the crew the info they are looking for. Some of their clients belong to a strange group gathering in a house in the Placa district. Their activities seemed suspicious but they were too proud of themselves not to discard some information about it. Go to the address.

After an hour several bottles have been consumed, many words exchanged, the crew is having a great time. One prostitute then asks the crew to follow her to the house of one of her client. "He is part of a strange organization but he is too boastful to keep it for himself. I am sure they are the people you are looking for, they match in every way."
Threaten them
Work. Give right address

Comply, seem afraid of what the crew might do. One prostitute asks the crew to follow her to the house of one of her client. "He is part of a strange organization but he is too boastful to keep it for himself. I am sure they are the people you are looking for, they match in every way."

The crew waits and ear picks for hours but ears nothing. Couldn't handle it more, sailors starts to ask directly to people in the street if they know about the Pyrphorian. Luckily, after they gave a coin to two boys who promised they knew everything going on in the city they agree to lead them to a house where "a strange religious group" gathers often.
The Infiltration

The young man succeeded in getting back to Izabel's island. In panic, he explains that his whole group was slaugthered. He was lucky enough to escape and managed to follow the murderers until he found the Pyrphorians' hide, a big house outside the city. A crew is assembled at once to go there.
The house and its grand French garden around it is seeable from the street but is surrounded by a high fence with two guards at the gate. Many guards are patrolling in the garden. Infiltrating the house won't be easy. Finding the contract there even less.
Play it bold, launch a group assault on the house guards
Attack the two guards at the door, kill them, take their keys and storm in, combat position. The guards are surprised and scattered, easier to get them now before they regroup.
Attack the guards frontally

Take one guard after the next before they have time to form a group and defend each others. In a few minute the beautiful white roses of French garden are painted red. The way to the house is free.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Not good enough and fast enough to kill all the guards before they have a chance to regroup. Gathering their spirit they manage to put on a good defence before they are defeated. A few sailors are injured but they got the upper hand.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Take down the guards from a distance

Fall one after the other. In a few minutes it is silent again, the way to the house is free.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Don't aim well enough. Most guards have time to regroup. Gathering their spirit they manage to put on a good defence before they are defeated. A few sailors are injured but they got the upper hand.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

The crew storms at the two guards at the gate. However while the guards clearly benefited from military training, the crew is more disorganized. The guards manage to hold them just long enough for the reinforcement to regroup before falling, defeated. When the crew opens the gates the bulk of the troop is waiting for them, ready to harvest them.
Let them pierce the crew centre group to surround them on the flanks

Marathon battle style. It works, the guards are defeated. A few sailors are injured but now the road to the house is open.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

A good military strategy is only good when well executed. This move cost more lives than if the un properly trained sailors had fight like they usually do, bar fight style. The battle lasts long and many good men are killed before the crew manages to finally get the upper hand. The road to the house is free but they must clearly act fast to find the contract before the reinforcement come.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Have the captain charge first, giving courage to all

Lord of the Ring style. The captain takes his swords and run toward the guards. The crew follows him and closes on the guards in a few seconds, as if animated by a divine push. The guards are defeated. A few sailors are injured but now the road to the house is open.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Who did he think he was? Hero of ancient tales? At the first blow on their captain the crew conviction that they represent a greater good and will therefore be protected shatters. The battle is a bloodshed like many, nothing heroic about it. Many good men are killed before the crew manages to finally get the upper hand. The road to the house is free but they must clearly act fast to find the contract.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Play it sneaky, have the most discrete man go around the house
Climb above the garden fence discreetly, manage to sneak around and find the kitchen door on the east aisle aside from the patrols. Unfortunately it is closed.
Use the sword as a lever and push

Success, is in.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Make too much noise and even hurt himself in the process. The door resists. The noise of the guards boots is getting closer, he must run away. Hides in a grove but a lot of guards are passing by, alerted by the noise.
Shape a pin to pick the window lock

Success, is in.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
The lock resists the incapable hands.
Risk staying longer and use the sword as a lever

Success, is in
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Makes a lot of noise and even hurt himself in the process. The door resists. The noise attracts the now close guards. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
Be safe, leave quickly
The man runs away and hides in a grove. A lot of guards are passing by.

To be as effective as a shadow one must not simply need to move discretely but also pick the right path to do so. While discrete when climbing the fence, the man chose a too risky path and is forced to jump down in a grove. Many patrols are walking around him and it is now too dangerous to back track.
Kill one of the guards and take his uniform

The man is quick and strong. Without having the time to scream or gasp of surprise the guards is on the floor. The man hides him in a grove and take his uniform. He can know walk into the house unsuspiciously.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Jumping on the guard as fast a possible, the man is not strong enough to knock him in one blow. The guard screams and alerts his companions. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
Climb quickly in a tree and wait for the right opening

Manage to climb fast enough to not be spotted. From up there see a balcony with a window open to where he will be able to jump. After a while the sneaky guy has an opportunity to leave his spot and jumps successfully.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Is spotted as he climbs. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
Play it subtle, disguise a man as a servant to enter through the main gate
Convincing disguise. "The password?" enquires the guard at the gate.
Hel
Inferno
Hades

"After you sir." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.

Good password, enter.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

"After you sir." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
The disguise is absolutely not convincing. "Who are you?" barks the guard. "State your intentions!"
Talk your way in
"Fine but nobody enters without the password!"
Inferno

Right password, enter.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Hades

"Oh sorry, I didn't realize you were from the house. After you." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.

"Oh sorry, I didn't realize you were from the house. After you." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.

"Oh of course! Pardon me my lord!" Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.

Archie always makes the most fuss over the smallest things…
Every time I ask Archie, I fear his insides combust.
The best thing is, dear old Archie never need know.
When a Queen asks you to do something…
I'm issuing you a royal decree.
I am the Queen after all.
Yes, I jolly well think you will accept.
Bon Voyage, as it is the fashion to say.
Well done, you have my tender affections!
I think we've both earned tea and a slice of sponge cake.
What a daring young one you are!
What gallantry! Though not quite worth a medal.
As reliable as my guards with the funny hats.
I was an obstinate child, and as such can empathise.
And there was I believing I'd found a loyal dachshund.
Need I tell you that you desert your nation!
Like my coronation, a farce from beginning to end.
My father would have had your head!
Don't be afraid to hurry, we are happy to wait!
Queens usually like things done quickly.
At least bring me some tea if nothing else!
You have served your Queen well, will you serve her again?
It is a trying time for the Empire, and we need you yet...
Your support is a comfort we would much like to continue.
Who could possibly be more important than your Queen?
I have not left the Palace in haste to be denied!
Have you succeeded in your mission?
Has my loyal subject returned?
I am told you may have something for me?
I'll call upon you, subject, if I need you.
There's nothing to keep you occupied here but my puppies.
Dear Archie has everything under control.
Oh do stop, Archie. Is this tiny fleet all I have to sink to get my island back?
Who are you, to speak up without permission?
So Edvard is the traitor! I certainly never authorised that silly-billy to act on my behalf. I declare the contract null and void.
Then I suppose we'll not be sinking any ships today. Not even as a deterrent?
Well in that case I hereby declare Prosperity returned to the Goode children—to compensate the dead father, thereby ensuring Miss Sarmento and co. are safe from this Pyrphorian nuisance.
What is that tinseled marionette talking about, Archie? We are safe here, aren't we?
Look at all those subjects! How enthusiastic they seem! Do you think they celebrate me, their royal highness?
And you are absolutely sure this Samuel Goode was innocent?
Let's heal it then, and be off.
My sincerest condolences, children of Samuel. For the loss of the father you loved, and for the tragedy caused by the unfortunate actions of your uncle.
For your unquestionable loyalty and bravery you shall be knighted, and bequeathed the island of Bright Sands from now and forevermore!
Hahaha... Forgive me, I always laugh at funerals!
But another tiresome prophet of doom, Archie. How dreary!
These rebels, whoever they are, will pay the penalty for challenging my sovereignty!
The time has come to take that territory back by force.
Funny, ending a war over a bit of paper!
I must admit, I am too fond of my sailors.
I understand this means the end of a rebellion on the island, very good.
So is it Isabel who is nice, or the Pyrphorians?
As long as we have Prosperity back, that business with your father can be forgotten.
So Edvard was the nasty one, and Samuel was the one with the dandruff?
Fancy forging a signature. People can be terrible, can't they?
I'm surprised that Isabel gave it back without a fight.
Once built, your Court of Justice shall inaugurate a new era of peace and prosperity for Empire.
This trial should be a celebration! A toast to all things civilised.
I don't normally attend trials so this one must be important.
You now own the highest court in the land!
The Court of Justice, magnificent!
Is the Court of Justice finished yet? Not quite?
I can't wait to play judge and give the gavel a sharp tap!
Did Archie tell you I planned to visit? I hope there's a convenient mooring for my flagship. I don't like long walks.
Treat me as you would any other guest.
Just so you know, I am not fond of garlic or profiteroles.
One approves! And it is nice to get out and about.
It all sounds very cheery so far. Make it cheerier.
Mind you, I do like it when things are special. You can do special?
May I express my gratitude for your sterling work preserving peace on the continent.
So this is the funny little island that's hosting the trial! Jolly good.
Now I'm here, I am of course impatient for the trial to begin.
A modern Queen must show she is able to dispense mercy. The man must be given fair hearing.
Where are all the witnesses?
Now we are finally all present, let this long overdue trial commence!
And where's the defendant?
This is all rather unusual. We are safe here?
This is unexpected. You are taking care of those beastly malefactors, aren't you?
A few angry hoodlums can't overthrow an Empire, can they?
I thought they must be after fame or riches, but they want to kill me.
I wonder what has become of the royal fleet…
Tell me they are not attacking this island? The one we are on?
I surrender myself wholly to your security arrangements.
I suppose then, my safety is in your hands.
When we get out of this I promise you a whole duchy. Although, no, I can't actually promise that.
We are so happy to be finally allowed to leave this island. And for your heroism of course.
Under different circumstances, you might have called it a pleasant visit!
I'm sure we can make Isabel's tiny little chunk a protectorate of some sort.
It makes one feel frisky and alive!
We ARE amused!
This suits us very well.
How wonderful to have it our own way!
How mischievous one feels!
It has all gone off very satisfactorily!
All is much as it should be.
Be strong in business, and become a pillar of our nation.
You continue to be of the greatest use to us.
Your successes must be a source of pride.
We appreciate your efforts.
Parliament commends you exceedingly.
You slide easily about the board like the rook!
You are a very able servant of the realm.
We are not amused!
The Queen regrets this distressing affair.
Another Queen may have turned to execution by now.
It is gravely injurious to our nation.
One wants prompt action against such outrage.
It is a time of discord for those of my station.
One of the many threats to my position.
The Queen finds your conduct inexcusable!
My father would have had you executed!
You WILL do better!
What a perilously selfish subject you are!
Your Queen is displeased with you.
Parliament will discuss what shall be done with you.
Tantamount to treason!
If it please an all-powerful deity to place me on the throne, it shall certainly please you...
I am your Queen. What further introduction is needed?
Have you met Nelson? Why he's a chestnut stallion with an Arabian head.
Oh pooh to 'your highness', call me ma'am.
I was beginning to enjoy being alone for once.
I long for some gaiety - a play or an opera.
I am fond of pleasant society, are you that?
No interruption fatigues, if it benefits the nation.
The dogs bite traitors and loyal alike, so they aren't much help.
A discretionary fleet for national emergencies.
I want to be a spearhead not a figurehead.
We do not solicit violence, yet under my rule it seems as constant as the crashing waves.
I do not forget the sacrifice of these sailors on my account.
Then we owe our gratitude.
It is much admired.
Sincere thanks for attending to this matter.
It would be prudent to accept.
Oh, we are only too happy to agree.
We shall be delighted.
Apparently my father disliked babies. I think I shall be as decisive, but slightly less mad.
It doesn't matter what you think of me, it is what I think of you.
Archie has been like a father to me, his company fills me with all those paternal hopes and comforts.
Archie never stops me eating jam, and will suffer the subsequent indigestion for me too!
If not for Archie, the rest would still be leading me up and down stairs like an infant.
Lady Margaret Hunt, née Harlow, is a respected voice on the Royal Council.
Sarmento is a strong woman, let us hope she keeps no secrets from us.
Anne Harlow must know that no injustice can excuse her own crimes.
Jean La Fortune is a pirate whose name I too-commonly hear.
The council has agreed my prison reforms, so I hope Mr. Bleakworth will bend a little.
Miss Jorgensen is a distant relative. Although all my relatives are quite distant.
I understand we have visiting royalty in Princess Qing. She's a gentle soul.
Willie Wibblesock? A made-up name surely?!
It's Mr von Malching. I will never offer that awful man a barony.
The presence of Vicente Silva is clearly an attempt by La Corona to challenge my authority here.
Shame Queens can't chop heads anymore.
Heaven forbid!
If that is a joke, it is not a funny one.
Pull up your braces, and thrust into the unknown!
If you pop off now, you'll be back in time for tennis!
Know that any assistance may influence Her Majesty's sphere!
Alas, my bowels churn afresh and I must beg your expertise...
Now here is a vital matter, of Queen and country!
Righty-ho!
Jolly Roger!
Buckaroo!
That really is first-rate.
I am quite penetrated by your kindness.
Bish-bang-bibbly, there she blows!
Ideally, one should keep one's promises.
Now, now. You oughtn't waste people's time.
Didn't finish? Ah. Um…hmmn…
Failed? I feel a ghastly surge coming on.
Caught trousers down? Happens to the best of us!
Her Majesty has little patience, I'd skip to it if I were you!
Have you heard the expression, 'a stitch in time saves nine' …
Resting? Perhaps you'd like my latest; male torso in rosewood!
Much has moved since we spoke, but I can still count on you?
I fear I must call upon you again, in spite of your good work.
I confess these unseemly troubles gurgle on, hope you don't mind?
Loyalty to the crown really should come above all else …
Only Her Majesty has your best interests at heart.
Oh, you're ready?
Had a rip-roaring time of it?
Brought some joy?
Nothing just now, but we value your eagerness!
If you return a little later, I may have something…
Pop back another time, and I'll fill your stocking.
Apart from security, I appreciate the company!
Two's the charm!
Well well, chosen for a royal escort!
I'm here if ever you need a steady, albeit somewhat arthritic, hand to guide you.
Sir Archibald Blake, Her Majesty's moist mouthpiece!
One-piece underwear suits? Too prickly! I find singleton shorts and vests to be tried and true!
Weird and wonderful!
I'm sure ma'am shall be delighted!
Superlative!
Suitably regal!
Her Majesty might approve!
Comforting as a moist and springy sponge!
Well that certainly settles the stomach!
You're a credit to the Empire!
You're constant, and that is key!
Perhaps a peerage is on the cards?
Majesty will soon be mentioning you.
I knew you'd come through!
You're flourishing!
You're a national treasure!
Her Majesty will be discomfited…
There's an unpleasant waft in the air.
Heavens, what shall I tell her majesty?
Oh, horsefeathers.
This brings on my indigestion.
I'm suddenly hot under the collar.
Pshaw, I shan't sleep at all.
You put me in a difficult position…
I wouldn't wish to accuse you of disloyalty…
Perhaps think again on the situation?
I fear you've made things awkward…
Might I advise against your current course?
Now we don't want to have a contretemps.
It's not that we don't trust you entirely…
I present my humble duty to you, and am confident you'll transcend your present circumstance!
I am a humble servant of Her Majesty, called upon for delicate occasions such as these.
Taking the initiative - excellent!
What a jolly jolly surprise.
Ah yes, the bright young sapling!
I present my humble duty to you.
Don't tell me I've missed another appointment?
Sir Archibald Blake, how may I serve?
Anyone for croquet?
We prepare for the worst but hope for the best.
Our humble little Empire.
The King is dead, long live the Queen!

Her Majesty's finest!
A lustrous jewel in the crown!

Naturally!
But of course!
Oh, most assuredly!

Oh my aching organs, no.

Tolerance, sympathy, understanding. Supreme qualities in a monarch wishing for a happy reign.
Her Majesty rarely needs guidance - ah, a little here and there - I think she simply likes to have my company.
Ever carved a lovespoon from walnut? I did have an amour once, but matters of state drew us apart.

Viscount Guffington-Hawkmoth, wounded at his own estate. It brings to light Her Majesty's very present vulnerability.
Bless Her Majesty, she eats so fast, but when she stops, so must we!
Her Majesty's rare gift is a soft heart and a hard mind. With monarchs, it is too often the reverse!
Anne Harlow's fall from grace was stormy and unpleasant, a bit like my bowels.
George Smith has a marvellous walking cane of alder, with tasteful silver flourishes.
Aha...Jean La Fortune. We'd like to have helped, but it's rather gone beyond that now.
Isabel Sarmento? You should probably be careful where you speak that name.

Miss Jorgensen is a far relation of Her Majesty, if I'm not mistaken. They do both share a certain boldness...
We have made every conceivable dispensation for Princess Qing, as we are compelled to do with visiting royalty!

Beryl O'Mara has flies on the wall, as I only dream our own discrete services might.

All in Her Majesty's name.
More flexible than you imagined!

We can't deny it's a difficult time. The sale of Prosperity was highly destabilising for Her Majesty.
Debt free? Spiffing, just the dib-dab. One splendid licence we shall draw up forthwith.
As to the debt my hands are tied, but it may warm her majesty's heart to see a new enterprise taking shape.
Did he really…? Oh dear, best leave these poor people with me. I will tell Edvard that the debt between you is quite settled…

You are doing Her Majesty a great service in these difficult times.
How are those ships coming along? Her Majesty will be pleased.
Her Majesty wants only warships. It is after all important in such times that she defends her sovereignty.
We rely more and more on captains of industry to steer us to happy futures.

Your father sold Prosperity to the leader of the rebels Isabel Sarmento.
The sale of Prosperity, made in Samuel's name, has weakened Her Majesty's position greatly.
Ever since the deal, Isabel has been hiding from us. But you may be the one to find her.
After the excellent work you are doing for the fleet, I think you're entitled to pursue the odd personal matter.

You digging around in state matters isn’t ideal, but in this case may be necessary.
That these ''Pyrphorians'' may have spread their influence in the New World is grave news indeed.

Her Majesty may go to war with Isabel. That is why she is mustering a fleet.

You may find Isabel fiercely independent. But I trust in you to bring her round.
I fear Her Majesty will not care to know the difference between these Pyrphorians and the local rebellion. So we'll have to leave that to you.
I wish you the best, for Queen and country!
Her Majesty is on edge. You'd better keep things ticking along with Isabel.

Her Majesty wants Prosperity back. By whatever means necessary...

You would be doing a great service for Queen and country.
With that document we can still reverse the original deal.

Her Majesty has been ever so much looking forward to seeing her new Court of Justice. I hope you'll be ready.

Sadly your Uncle has indeed alerted me to some floating liabilities. I fear you have no choice but to settle them if I am to grant you your crown shipping licence.

Taken with a pinch o' salt.

Catch the Pyrphorian arsonists!

Many of my best were kidnapped. We have no hope of surviving without them.
What if these people grow sick? They're going to need a hospital!

You beat the Pyrphorians at their own game!

Near Prosperity, the Pyrphorians would kill us on sight.
At first I thought you were a spy of the Queen. Now I know your heart is in the right place.

Stay hidden, and you will succeed.

I will tell them everything I know.
I don't need to take an oath to speak the truth.

I was certain it was your father that day, but now I know was wrong.
Your majesty. Isabel Sarmento, at your service.
We fight with you, no matter what.
We can help you, just give us the sign.
Exploit their supply lines! Small operations can have big rewards!

There is no dent in their supply! We missed an opportunity!
Ha, you did it! Without their precious fire they are nothing!
You broke the chain! Now we are really somewhere.
I never thought I would take the Empire's side!

I like Sir Archibald, he is a funny man.

We can build on this.
It is good news.
Let's take nothing for granted.

We are all the stronger for this.
A small win, but we'll take it.
A flicker of hope.

I was right to trust you.
Your heart is in the right place.

May there be more good news from you.
It is only a setback.
We will come back stronger.
Nothing we aren't ready for.
We can't give up.

We can find a way around this.

I am Isabel Sarmento. Do not stand between me and my country's freedom!
You are sure you weren't followed?
Good to see a friendly face in these times.
You are here to help?
We're running low on everything, as usual.

We would welcome more volunteers.
Ready to evacuate at a moment's notice.
This is where liberation starts.
We make do with what we have.

We've got to be agile, ready to move at the drop of a hat.

We never sink a ship if we can take it.
We won't forget this.
I am so happy someone could help us.
Words can't express how grateful we are.
We could use a distraction.
We can make it work.
It is a risk worth taking.
I'll join them again in the fields... my brothers and sisters, once we have set this land free.
I was young when I joined the movement, I never imagined I would one day be giving the orders.
This is not about revenge, but securing our people a future free of La Corona. We have to stick together.
My brother fought back violently against La Corona. He was murdered. We have to try another way.
If we strike against La Corona, we have to make it count!
Jean is reckless like my brother was. I don't blame him. He is only trying to survive, to protect the ones he loves.
Let Admiral Silva cling to his dying dream, we hear the little birds of freedom sing!
La Corona may be our enemy, not the Queen, but to trust empire for us is impossible.
If Anne Harlow could forget the past, we could build a better future together.
Alonso is a powder keg. He threatens to destroy the delicate balance we've worked so hard for.
Madame Kahina is the best. Quick, clean, and never draws attention. How does she do it?
George dances well for an invalid, we all need to cut free sometimes.
In future, keep your flagship intact, resources are scarce.
There must be a better way.
There is no time for this.
This will not help our struggle.
I've uncovered a meaty opportunity.
You steam ahead, go on.
Something fer you to fiddle with.
Shine yer blow lamp on this would'yer?
If you don't exploit this, some other bird will.
Look at you go.
Go then, I got stuff to do.
That's it, gimme some peace.
Fixed that up good, didn't yer.
Nice juicy little oyster that is.
Faster than the electric telegraph.
Lickety-spit, you've come back quick.
Corrr yeah, just how I likes it.
Didn't take you for a Janus-face, fair play to yer.
You've left the whole thing a ruddy jumble!
Well that's the nail in the coffin.
Luddite!
Steaming pile full o' nothin'.
Hurry or the flies'll start laying.
What about my job?
Sit on a firework would yer?
Got another lamp needs lighting n'all.
Sputter on little engine, I'll keep you greased.
Wonderful, but I've got another turkey for you to pluck.
Bit of a wrench, eh?
Old Nate can make double-cross worth your while.
Tied up the scrag ends?
Cobbled somethin' together?
Dug up more than bones?
Want more? There is no more!
Lean pickings at the moment.
Not even a morsel for yer.
Pumping pistons!
No flies on me.
I'm over the moon.
I'm lighter than air.
I'd be blown away, if not for me ropes…
Whizbang!
Soaring like a buzzard.
You're flying!
Self-propelled, I see.
You make silk purses from sow's ears.
Sift and you will find.
You've got a spark.
Something always drops from the pipe with you.
You're dynamite!
Rubbish!
Fly-blown frass!
It unhinges me!
Soiled my day.
Bahhh!
Hollow piles o' dung.
I haven't time for this!
You're cranking my crank.
Don't ratchet me temper!
I'll 'ave yer bones!
I've a bone to pick with you.
Yer damp and dirty drape.
Yer smudge-pot.
Oily little toerag.
Let me wipe me hand yer eminence. Turkey grease, see.
You made a lucky find! I'm a go-to for scrags and cut-offs, knick-knacks and gravy.
Is it rag or is it bone you're wantin'?
Bear-skin, dog-skin, cat-skin.
Eh? I'm trying to keep a low profile.
I've a wealth o' parts, real odds and ends.
You've got me by the Diri-giblets, whaddya want?
You wouldn't be after a mountain of lint would ya?
What's that I can smell on you, pickled eggs?
Should hold together for a time.
Soldiers had no use for the iron, all frozen such as they were.
I scratched and scraped for this.
I always dreamed of a little shack to call my own.
She used to be a wreck, but you'd never guess.
I put a lot o' graft into fixing her up.
The bow's made o' hodgepodge.
Made of sterner stuff— like boiled hooves.
How touching.
I'm a grateful sackful.
Tinker very much.
I'm in.
Could be worse I s'pose.
Then what we waitin' for, let's get stuck in.
Semaphore stations'll soon be disused - there's a tip for old iron.
Found an egg with a palace in it. Fixed the hinge and stuck it on the bow of my lady blimp.
Zeppelins'll take off, you'll see. Soon they'll all want a piece of my lady blimp.
Turn a greasy hat inside out, and it looks to 'ave been oiled purposely!
Coffins make nice boats. But make sure the lid doesn't shut on you.
Isabel's people are resistors, fighting for their Ohms.
I could use George Smith's bath chair, once he's gone. Can't be long now can it?
Archibald Blake commissioned the Queen a balloon, then he realised it was all a lot of hot air.
The Queen may have snatched every last bit of land and sea, but I have the skies to meself.
Alonso's good to follow at a distance; for all the leftovers.
That windsock Willie still complaining? The lad doesn't know his luck.
Don't dabble with Kahina, she's a lethal businesswoman.
I offered Bente a place on my balloon, but she guffawed and called it cheating!
That fell into place.
Bit fer you, chunk for me.
A few sundries.
Some nice little slivers in there.
Something for nothing!
We hammered something out.
I'm an impulsive shopper myself.
I won't be manipulated.
What's in it for me?
Gorr, take me for an idiot?
Well, it's time for me to move on. Until we meet again!
You're going to need your best ship and crew, only for it to sink to the icy bottom! Hehehe.
Terrible waste of human life of course, but don't let that stop you.
And be sure to prepare for the final curtain while you're at it.
You really do have quite the desire to depart don't ya? Well it's your funeral.
Never mind, eh! At least you won't die a block of ice.
Seems a long way to go to die, but you look ready for it.
Take your time, won't make a difference to Sir John.
Congratulations! You crossed seven seas for a wasteland!
Couldn't even shoot yerself in the foot? Well I feel sorry for ya.
The whole expedition's a failure. But we all know that teamwork drivel's a myth.
See— never worth getting mixed up in other people's business.
What a waste of time! Just goes to show, you can't rely on others.
There's nothing up there but the ruddy cold.
Hoping this will keep your head above water? Not Arctic water it won't.
Dunno why you're so desperate for your eyeballs to freeze.
At best we'll be pulling stiffs out the ice like teeth.
Like frostbite do ya? Botulism? Scurvy? Got that all to look forward to.
The Arctic's no more than a mariner's graveyard. Ooh, hang fire...
As we're here, we might ask the Inuits if they chanced upon any lost property...
The equipment won't have decomposed like the cadavers.
We've a responsibility to Sir John to gather up his valuables.
Hard to feel the cold when you see a glint, ain't it? Hehe.
Found nothing but emptiness, why isn't I surprised?
The deeper we go, the more likely we find something really juicy.
You want an Icebreaker, so we can get to the fancy stuff.
Never know what you'll find inside, if you don't crack things open.
Now we can finally see if Sir John bequeaths us summat shiny.
You need to grow yourself some tusks, my walrus-friend, or we'll never snag the goodies.
What d'you wanna help those old duffers for? Unless...you've sniffed summat out?
I've heard the Arctic Council ships are plushly furnished.
Shame they had to still be alive and we couldn't just help ourselves.
As long as their pocket watches still tick we should try afresh.
Never should o' come here, why do you think they call it a wasteland?
Looks like we'll have to dig up Sir John Faithful's army o' the dead another day.
Shame we couldn't find 'em, I was looking forward to expanding my collection of brass buttons.
Lady Faithful hopes to resurrect her marriage, but Sir John's got cold feet, hehehe.
Ice might even have helped preserve the merchandise.
I think we all know where Sir John Faithful is now, don't we? He's dead.
I know her old man’s long dead, but his lavish instruments won’t be, eh?
Don't be afraid to see the frozen look as you frisk their corpses, you’ll get used to it.
You can see a body a mile off out here, nice and exposed.
