Poor Anne's father was executed by the mad king, and now she is mad herself.
Jean is a noble outlaw, but an outlaw nonetheless.
Isabel desires freedom, and who would deny anybody that?
Old Nate oftentimes looks to have just come down to breakfast.
Mr Bleakworth is a cowled hawk so unseeing and unhearing, you'd think he'd have learned to feel.
Madame Kahina has been a great comfort since father died, she knew him well.
Lady Margaret Hunt sent her sympathies the day father was arrested.
I have never asked anything of you, firstborn. Not when you stole away a-tiptoe, leaving the family burden at your little sister’s door, nor in the hard years that since have followed.
Our father is accused of high treason. Dare you to believe it? Arrested, stripped of his knighthood. We… I am terribly shaken, and the vultures are already circling.
Will you now stand by, knowing gentle father is imprisoned? It must kill him. Please come home. We need you.

Is it really you, dearest sibling? I never dared hope you’d return. Do you remember Bright Sands? Of course you do; we loved it here. It’s changed now. The Royal Council support Uncle Edvard. Father barely cold, and he’s pulling everything down.
Never told your friend of Goode and Sons? There is much to be said, but not now. Dear father’s funeral begins.
No matter so few are here, when they are the few he loved most.
We shall, dear sibling, for now. I have acquired a small island with the last of my funds, and passage for all still loyal to father. Together we shall clear his name or die trying.
Edvard registered the debt officially?!
Please, Miss Sarmento, we come here only to prove our father innocent—Samuel Goode.
I don't know about you, but my father would never have betrayed his Queen!
We are very sorry to hear your situation, still I must insist our father's...
Maybe nothing need be sunk at all, majesty!
Regard here, your Majesty! The Prosperity contract and our father's diary. The signatures do not match!
And now compare with a freight document by our uncle Edvard. Do you see? He forged the signature in order to impersonate father!
We hear you Isabel, but first we return to Bright Sands and confront uncle Edvard. His wicked masquerade is over!
Gather your things Edvard. For your trial.
No!
Samuel will forgive you on the other side, Edvard!
See! Her Majesty is paying her last respects, just as Archie promised!
From now on they rest side by side in the family vault.
She is...
Bright Sands is returned to us, father's name is cleared. So, that will be all, eldest. Will you and Aarhant be leaving?
I will not be fooled, Aarhant. I know that we shall one day be parted. But if my prayers be answered, today will not be that day— dearest sibling? Today is not a day for parting.
What do you do here at the family crypt, Edvard? Do you vaunt your betrayal?
Enough! It was you who sold Prosperity for the Pyrphorians! You forged father's signature! You sentenced him to death! But now the sentence is on you, uncle!
And your guilt shall long outlive you, uncle. Look what you've done to our family.
How dare you...
Father would never have! He was the Queen's stalwart, a member of the Royal Council, he...
Help enough to demolish the larger ruins. Let's breathe some life into this place!
Father wouldn't have wanted us to sit on our hands while our one prospect was in such a state.
So let's gather our townsfolk and ask them to spruce the place up.
Mourning is eased now we have others for company sibling.
Your people are recovered, and desirous to proceed. Set them to it! We're going to need as much space as we can clear.
Let Uncle Edvard scoff. A modest island yes, but if you’re at all like Father, you’ll look beyond appearances.
We are running low on timber, but there's plenty in the ruins. We should clear some to stock up.
We must shelter the good, loyal people who have shown solidarity with our family.
We need every hand we can get if we are to expunge this debris.
It's been a hard day of labour for us all, we should cater to our tired, hungry people!
Timber, very good. I’ll try not to think of the coffin.
He twists every article in his favour, at our and father’s expense!
See what slander Edvard prints in Bright Sands!
If only father were here, he'd have known what to do.
It is not nearly as moribund here as it was.
Those still loyal to Father will now turn to you.
A moving tribute to see so many loyal to father trust in you.
At such times it is good to occupy oneself with routine things.
I'm sure you know, but father was innocent.
We must behave as if father were acquitted, as one day he will be.
Aarhant is proving wise counsel. I'm glad you managed to make a friend while you were away.
In times such as these, it is good to have people around us.
I'll dream of Bright Sands until the day I can dream no more.
You have father’s fortitude! These people will follow you as they once followed him.
Is there no limit to Uncle's shameless demands?
I feel sick to the stomach that Edvard could ask so much of us so soon after father's death.
That miserly, uncharitable…dastard! Picking and choosing what he inherits!
Clearly Uncle's intention is to keep us from ever owning a shipyard.
Speak to our humble cousin! He writes of a worker riot in Bright Sands.
It seems we are not alone in our contempt for Edvard.
Our dream of a shipyard is impossible without plenty of qualified hands.
Workers can handle stubborn debris on Ditchwater. If it's to be the centre of our new enterprise it needs to be immaculate.
Maybe Edvard will try to prevent us owning a shipyard, but for now let's at least house those workers.
Even I am astonished he could be this corrupt. We must put their cases before the highest authority, and hope for a retrial.
It cannot be...these names are those father trusted most; barristers, doctors, academics.
However much we despise Uncle Edvard, it's criminal to go opening his private correspondence!
I am so relieved our legitimacy is no longer in question.
Hurry, I already smell the tar, see the masts a-swaying from father’s study!
We have to set personal feelings aside and do as Edvard asks.
Edvard becomes a monster inconceivably grotesque, but one we, for now must keep fed.
As this letter proves them innocent, let us hurry to Sir Archibald.
For almost the first time since he passed, eldest, my heart is lifted.
Building a shipyard is no small matter, our work is far from finsihed.
Father would be ashamed to see his brother now.
I shall not be content with any ship, until I can say it is one we ourselves have built.
The ship is another serendipity we should be grateful for.
A commission for the Royal fleet! And in such quantity! A rare honour indeed!
I find myself looking up to you, as the youngest often will.
The weaponry they ask for presents a problem. I'm not even sure we have an iron lode, do we?
I see the iron is beyond our reach. We have no choice but to find a way through the mountain.
What are you both doing! Demolition is a serious matter wanting proper expertise!
Father used Mr. Ticker on account of his good sense. Go on, I suggest you find him in Bright Sands.
Ah, he’s here! Try to make a good first impression, eldest; any friend of father is a friend of ours.
Iron into Steel, Steel into Arms and we shall have fulfilled our first Royal commission!
There is no shame in producing weapons if it is in defence of the realm, eldest.
Granting such a prestigious commission shows the council may be willing to give us fair hearing.
The last moneys I spent on Ditchwater appear well spent, eldest—and the faith I invested in you.
This could be the start of something significant for us.
I'm sure if we have iron deposits, you can find them, eldest.
If the royal fleet is to be at the cutting edge, we must start producing steel.
Steel! How proud father would be.
You have put in as much hard work as anyone else!
To outfit our ships, we're going to need to fashion all that steel into weaponry.
Perhaps we should sell ships to partners father trusted.
I predict inexhaustible demand for our steel!
We are the beating heart of industry in the Empire.
Exactly the sort of mischief I remember you by.
Mr. Ticker has years of experience in detonations, we must secure his services.
Who would kill such a gentle man? Why?
I knew all along Father could never have taken his own life. But that someone willfully took his...!
It is father's diary! Quickly, what does he say!?
Of course, the island over which he was accused of treason! That is what they are after.
The diary may not be enough in itself to convince Sir Archibald, but it may give him food for thought.
No doubt father thought this symbol germane. If anyone can interpret it, Madame Kahina can.
Sarmento's last location is all we have. We need to plan our expedition route carefully.
You look into this, eldest. I'm not sure I can face it.
This is what we wanted after all. To know the truth.
What could he have meant, eldest? I fear this mystery is only just begun.
I now have more questions than answers.
Father's killer was a nobody. Something greater conspires against our family.
Oh we are swept up in something now, eldest. And I am coming with you…
I can think of no better than father's old friend Kahina, when it comes to pondering such mysteries.
I wonder if Sir Archibald knows of this Pyrphorian threat? I think we have enough here to beg his consideration again…
Where is the contract that would be official proof of Prosperity's sale?
Be careful, eldest.
It relates the sale of the island Prosperity—the very reason father was branded a traitor.
We cannot let the truth sink into the murk!
Father’s own hand! Now we shall know his mind, eldest.
Don’t be afraid to ask Madame Kahina, she became a good friend to father.
Kahina is acquainted with the new world, she is sure to have seen this symbol before.
All we have is Isabel’s last-known hideaway, and a world of unknowns in between.
Prosperity is the cause of all this trouble. I already despise that wretched place.
I can think of no better than father's old friend Kahina, when it comes to pondering mysteries.
If you are going to do this, I am coming with you.
At last the expedition has found Miss Sarmento. Let us hope she makes our journey worthwhile.
I'll do anything to know the truth, even if it mean dealing with Isabel's rogues.
As it stands, they are an easy target for the Pyrphorians. We should help, eldest.
You have done more to protect her people than Isabel could possibly have hoped, eldest.
From what we know of the Pyrphorians, I don't think it's enough yet to deter them.
Prosperity—I want to see the island that caused all this with my own eyes.
Then the Pyrphorians wanted Prosperity for the oil. No doubt to keep their fires burning.
I think we can ask anything of Isabel with her people sheltered, defended and now supplied.
This is about as much as she can ask for.
Isabel is showing genuine gratitude. Perhaps she isn't the sort I thought.
For the first time in my life, I know freedom.
Isabel claims to know the whereabouts of the contract, and it is the only trail we have.
I am so glad we are finally seeing the world together, eldest.
There it is— Prosperity. The source of all our troubles.
These fires cannot be due to the warm climate.
The firemen confirm it was arson! These fires were set upon us!
This monstrous fire-raising is deliberate. The Pyrphorians!
Isabel is mistaken. I won't hear these lies about father.
Why has Isabel not yet given us the Prosperity contract? She is worryingly elusive on the subject.
Isabel plays on our emotions. Still, if the sick could be carried to La Isla to convalesce…
A messenger boy has brought us a letter.
It is in Isabel's interest we find that contract! The Queen will realise Sarmento was forced into the deal.
I'm no more experienced in espionage than you, eldest. But this is our one chance to uncover the truth.
We have to make this count. That contract will reveal all.
You have it! I never knew you had the ingenuity!
It is father's signature, but in Edvard's hand! Edvard was behind this!
I believe Sir Archibald when he says Her Majesty may do something drastic.
Well done Eldest! You have served both Isabel and the Empire greatly.
If this is the only way to get to the truth, then we must follow it.
I know it's only paperwork, but the Pyrphorians cannot operate if The Empire owns Prosperity again.
Isabel was true to her word in the end. You have to admire her shrewdness.
I realise Isabel means well.
If Aarhant were here, I'm sure he'd have some good advice.
To forge father's signature! Edvard must have been possessed!
I would have been right to strike Edvard's cheek, the many times I had the inclination!
I will not rest until Edvard sees justice, even if I must escort him to the gallows myself!
As Edvard is paraded to the town square, I want to be there in the front row.
Edvard was the cause of all our grief! To see his face when he discovers we know!
We confront Edvard this instant! I have so very many words for him!
Cast iron will make it very difficult for him to sidle away!
I will indulge not one of the thousand apologies I presume he has ready.
We should do what we can to get the evidence in order. No need to engage with Edvard.
The Queen wants the trial to be an occasion. We better make sure we're ready.
The evidence at such a high-profile inquiry must be absolutely watertight.
Finally we can have our revenge on Edvard for all he has done.
Leave no stone unturned. Who knows if Edvard has kept back other nasty surprises for us.
Now we are ready for Her Majesty. All the eyes of the world will be upon us.
If the Queen wants to make a big song and dance of the trial, we better see to it.
The Queen's visit, not the trial, may be the greatest occasion of your people's lives.
I don't know what I would do without you, eldest.
Everything comes under scrutiny in the presence of royalty.
Edvard is as good as dead to me.
I will not look at him at the trial.
Concentrate on securing a verdict for Edvard!
You were out there in paradise, and I dragged you into all this. I'm sorry.
You are the one positive in all of this. No sister could have asked for more.
Is this business really nearly over, eldest? I don't feel any better for all we've dug up.
I should have seen through it. Saved father while I had the chance.
You cannot allow Bright Sands to be subjugated! Our childhood home!
Bright Sands! You must save them!
Uncle Edvard… He’s suffered enough, eldest. I believe I can forgive him now.
Now we are all that remains, eldest. I intend to take strength from that.
We will not give in to terror! Never!
We must avenge Edvard—the only way we can, father.
Come what may, I am not afraid.
There is only one way left, eldest.
What you did goes far beyond us, dear blood. You have saved us all from a reign of terror.
It shall be a proper funeral. Let us reunite the two brothers, side-by-side. Once and for all, confine the past to the past.
We must bury them both together in the family tomb.
Let us talk once Samuel and Edvard have taken their rightful place side by side.
I do not feel any more sadness, eldest. The clouds have lifted—azure skies lie beyond.
Have joy in your heart as you make these final arrangements.
They will not have Bright Sands!
Another glimmer! Isabel fights beside us.
They will not stop you, eldest. Lead us forth!
Fires rage everywhere! We must unmask these arsonists before its too late!
The arsonists must be intercepted!
There will be nothing left of the city if the arsonists remain on the prowl!
Now the fires are out of control, and the arsonists still loose!
Quickly, the civilians! I won't see them swept up in the fighting!
Bright Sands is no place for civilians! We must come to their rescue!
Find a way to extract them unnoticed!
Poor, poor Edvard!
Edvard was ready to make peace with himself at the end.
Father always wanted you to have Bright Sands. The past cannot hold you any more.
Edvard died far better than he lived. He is forgiven.
If father had but held Edvard—shown his affection.
When I come here, I bring only cattails—for peace and prosperity.
These stones are not cold, but warm. The sun is shining again.
The past may be buried but it is not forgotten.
Ready to follow them secretly?
Here's a thing, eldest. Please be punctual.
Most people would jump at this chance.
It would be a compelling task for anyone.
I wonder if you can find it within yourself—helping your little sister?
Of course this business is far too lively for me...
I shall attend other errands meanwhile.
Don't feel you have to do this as a courtesy to me.
I shall await you by cheerily sifting through paper.
I always appreciate your help, however overdue.
Rare for promises to be kept, thank you.
You restore a grain of my trust in humanity, eldest.
I'm not going to say I didn't think it possible.
Eldest, you outdo yourself.
Given up? That is the luxury of inconstancy.
As you wish, after all I managed without you before.
I'm sure you did your utmost.
I doubt there is anything more you could have done.
It's alright, I didn't expect it would go very well.
I dream of some kind of news.
I can ask, but after that it is up to you.
Am I to understand my petition goes unheard?
Every duty you fulfil will help others build trust in you.
Why, not one, but several prospects in quick succession!
Another appointment, when will the excitement end!?
Eldest, if you have any heart at all...I am your kith and kin.
Could you really have it on your conscience?
Dare I believe it is good news you bring?
Tidings, fair or foul?
Speak to me, I am ready for the worst.
Nothing but paperwork to be done...
There's no work for you...
Nothing new on the horizon...
I am somewhat heartened.
I am more hopeful than I was.
All seems well for now.
Signs are more encouraging.
Times must be good.
I shouldn't complain at times like these.
All quite bearable.
I'm happy for you, really I am.
You might feel rather pleased with yourself.
You've kept things in good order.
No-one can begrudge your achievements.
You have not been unsuccessful!
Your dedication is commendable.
You work with reassuring method.
This grim monotony is worse than life.
I should like to be someone else.
Sigh...
I find this all so trivial.
How dull.
I want to feel something, just not irritable!
I'm tired of being tired.
You give me no comfort at present.
I worried you might be this sort of person.
You forget yourself.
A quaint interpretation of precision.
When you overlook minutiaie, things go awry.
And it's all the harder when one is alone!
It's a disordered tangle of briar.
Then you are the long lost sibling. Hallo. I hope we can come to know one another a little.
I never thought I'd see you again, sibling. I hope your return coincides with better times.
Hallo dear.
You've returned.
I've been holding fort, as ever.
Father was given to inquiry.
You seem to come and go as you please.
I did wonder if you'd come by.
Nothing new here, I'm afraid.
Perhaps a change of fortunes.
Well, I shan't be an ingrate.
A thank you is probably in order.
Oh what does it matter either way...
What else can I do but accept...
Then it shall be so...
If only I had the invitingly empty sort of paper for writing, not lined, for accounting.
Fictions only remind me how little of my own writing I've done lately.
If ever I seem far away, remember so were you, those long years.
One should get to know one's kin, shouldn't one?
Getting things done bright and early maintains discipline for the remaining day.
After a jam scone at teatime, I feel a different person. That is to say, a sympathetic one.
I can't see how any woman finds calisthenics remotely emancipating.
I have to make do with living vicariously through your exploits.
No indeed!
I can't let it happen.
Really this is too much.
Hello! I'm Hannah, your general advisor. I have some experience in building a company, which I'll share gracefully once you will have settled an island.
We are in the middle of the sea right now. We need to settle an island to build our company. Find a huge island, that possesses all fertilities required for a good start.
We have our place now! Not bad, but it's only the beginning.
Hello! I'm Hannah, your general advisor. Welcome to your new home! This island will witness the beginning of our company, and I'll accompany you in this project.
Yes, the island looks great, but don't waste more time. Start now with our company town. You need to build a settlement to attract some farmers. They will work in basic food and goods production.
Our small company city is buzzing. Farmers are flooding in the houses. They will keep gathering the core resources and goods we need.
Our planks stock reduces dangerously. We shall start producing our own construction materials now...
I love the scent of freshly cut wood, smells like a soon growing settlement. Very good.
I heard some complaints from the employees. They refuse to live in houses because they would not have any marketplace in the area. Please fix this situation!
Finally fixed. A market is the center of our city. Please remember it.
One of our production buildings is not able to deliver its goods anywhere. There should be a warehouse near every production area.
Organizing efficiently our production areas can bring us far. I'm glad the issue is fixed now.
Our delivery driver complained that he can't access the Trading Post.
A good infrastructure is crucial to our success. Good that you improved it.
The growth of our village triggers new demands from the farmers. Make sure to provide basic food and commodities to them, or they will leave us.
Fish does not smell good, but it does please our farmers. At least the view of the fish cargo delights me: it means more workforce, ultimately.
Our employees now are asking for schnapps. They would pay a lot for it, but this is no life requirement. They will just be a bit unhappy, that's all...
Well said! We have to focus on growth, not on comfort!
What a waste of hands... Efficient companies don't spend time on such commodities.
How do you want farms to grow and raise anything? We need agricultural fields!
This scenery is so rustic. It really alters from the civilized cities. But well, our farmers have some occupation now!
I can already feel it... It's like in my dreams. Fire ravaging the city. It should not be complicated to have a fire station, or is it?
One is better than nothing, but I would feel safer if we had even more fire stations. But I should not ask too much of you...
Those houses are really too rustic... Would you mind making some renovation works?
Better housing means more qualified employees. With these workers, we will industrialize our settlement! Factory work is waiting!
Since each production building requires a specific workforce, make sure you have enough of each when you upgrade your houses. We still need some farmers.
We are in the middle of the sea right now. We need to stand on firm ground.
"A very decent island we have! But start roll up your sleeves. Our employees won't work without a decent housing."
That's a good start. We can grow even further, if we provide our employees with basic needs and better housing!
Some of our farmers increased their skills and can now work in factories. We can start to industrialize our production!
Our industry is running, but the revolt starts to brew and the complaints are lining up. Security and education are our priorities now.
Artisans are day dreamers, but their thirst for adventures could become very lucrative!
This whole new land has plentiful of products to offer. Our artisans will soon acquire the taste and skills of high society!
Our employees mastered the craft of electricity at the university. Modernity is at our door now.
We're finally here. Our engineers can craft the most luxurious products. We would become very prosperous.
I've never seen so much luxury ever before. We could start a big project where our investors would know how to spend their money?
Our monument is glorious. Imagine how many people would come to visit a great exhibition, and what marvels we could discover!
We're at the top of the world now. Well done!
"Numbers, statistics, reports. What might be a worry to you is my affairs! I'll stay close to you just in case you need support."
Those houses are really too rustic... Would you mind making some renovation works?
Certain traders are installed in the area. We should always have a look at what they offer for trade.
"A very decent island we have! But start roll up your sleeves. Our employees won't work without a decent housing."
"Every settlement needs a market. The people are looking for a place to supply them! Provide it!"
"I checked our infrastructure. Not all facilities are able to deliver their goods. Please change that!"
"The farmers are hungry. You have to supply them with the necessary, starting with fish."
"Everything you built so far consumed wood. We'll need more of it to continue."
"I checked the books several times. There is no use denying it! We're close to bankruptcy! In father's name, prevent this from happening!"
"Our settlement is rather small. You have to attract more farmers if you want to progress!"
"Land can only be farmed if there are enough fields. Install them!"
"You have done everything necessary. Now is the time to advance and settle the first workers!"
I have discovered some inefficiencies we ought to address...
Our business is being adversely affected by urgent matters we ought to resolve...
Here is a matter of the utmost importance, we must knock it on the head!
There is a defect in the economic machine that you ought to correct...
A concern has raised its ugly head, that I don't think can wait...
Oh, this is terrible! We have to save the situation in any way we can!
Every settlement needs a market. The people want a place for supplies, provide it!
I checked the manifests. Not all our facilities are able to deliver the goods they produce. Please correct the situation!
Our settlement is rather small. You will have to attract more farmers if you want to make progress.
The farmers are hungry. You'll have to supply them with the necessary, starting with fish.
Everything you've built so far consumed wood. We'll be needing more of it to continue.
I've been going over the accounts. There is no denying it, we're close to bankruptcy! Avert this disaster!
The land can only be farmed if there are enough fields. We must plant them!
Work is going unfinished. We must ensure we have sufficient workforce to finish it!
We are missing a vital good that cannot be produced on our island. You will have to find a way to import it!
You have prepared everything. Now is the time to advance by settling the first workers!
Without electricity some facilities won't run. You have to set up the preliminaries to get them going!
Our docks are primed for a first ship launch! Everyone waits on your signal!
Our city is noteworthy enough to attract its first visitors. We must be sure to make all the necessary arrangements!
Numbers, accounts, indices. What might otherwise be a worry to you are my affairs. I'll stay close by in case you should need support.
Since that day you saved my life, I have presumed I knew you. But now...
A thousand letters from your father go unopened, yet one scribble from your sister changes everything? I didn't even know you had a sister!
We are broke, old pal! We can’t afford passage back to the old world, back to your family! Not unless you’ve suddenly remembered what work is.

So this is it. We're leaving paradise behind. You never talked much about family and the like, but you’re dead serious about this, aren’t you? No matter, I made a vow to defend you. And I don't break an oath, even if a blind man could see you’re leaping into the deepest pit of dung.
All those houses! You never said how wealthy you were. Why were we selling fish and sleeping in barns?!
Looks like death claimed the wrong brother.
Your sister reminds me of you. Must mean new adventures await, old pal.
Now that sounds like good news.
Who are all these busybodies? Blowing up rocks can't be that complicated!
Ha! My apologies, that was indeed impressive! Is there anything dynamite won't solve, I wonder?
Look! Devils from below breathing fire and flame!
We are not afraid of cowards hiding behind masks.
Their fleet is formidable. I count many ships.
Yes, just look at her. I bet she already forgot who we are.
They are at peace now.
...the Queen. She's the Queen.
After all we've been through?
Liar! You are the picture of regret!
You don't understand pain. Real pain.
We're nearing the place your father died. Whatever happens, stay calm!
We didn't come here to be insulted, we came to strike a bargain. The demolitions man Thomas, we want him.
It’s been a long, hard day. The people need to rest. And maybe wet their whistles.
A cloud still hangs over this place, please make it go away!
She has you doing all those chores you tried to leave behind.
Everything depends on this enterprise for your sister, I won't watch you let her down.
You're better with humankind than I used to believe.
First the weather, now the people!
It is not rain, but wet mist! And endless! What are we doing here?!
Disrespectful chatter abounds about your father and how he died.
Sometimes feels like your sister hardly knows you.
The tin rush left this island ugly.
Funny to watch you get your hands dirty.
So serious all of a sudden. Where’s that old spirit of yours gone?
He certainly knows how to silence his critics.
A letter. It bears Edvard’s seal!
Open the letter, he's clearly up to no good!
Though the burden is lifted, Edvard will keep you headlocked for life if you allow him to.
Edvard has shown his weakness as a leader. We must exploit it.
This is our chance to show Edvard who rules the waves.
Sometimes doing the wrong thing is the right thing, old pal.
Why would we need a licence to build a boat? Seems that's how it is here...
Once this shipyard is built, we can gesture rudely at Edvard, and go back to adventuring.
She says it's ''your'' shipyard? Does that mean we're going to be here forever?
All I smell on your Uncle is greed.
Don’t grovel for your Uncle. He has no power over you.
You do know Edvard has no intention of lifting that debt?
Still have a few sticks of dynamite! We can blow our way through!
Mr. Ticker has opened my eyes to the world of controlled destruction!
Perhaps not refined enough for your sister, but at least your workers can start their dig.
Always dangerous, getting wrapped-up in the business of a Queen.
My bond is to you, not to your monarch.
You're part of it now, just like your father was.
Once you reach the top, there's only one way from there.
I'm still waiting for the boom!
I suppose it is better to let the experts handle it.
My sword is fashioned from Ukku steel, but to produce in these quantities!
This steel will command great value.
I never imagined a city could grow so fast.
You're a real fat cat now! Hope you remember one day how you got here…
The workers may as well start preparing for the detonation.
Admit it, you’d never have hired a demolition expert in the old days.
Fizzle, fizzle, boom! Hahaha.
The way to the iron mines is clear!
Perhaps you can help me understand who keeps a murder under their hat? Forgive me, I know we speak of your father…
The foul scent of a killer. We cannot let him escape.
Someone supplies the murderer from Madame Kahina's harbour? We should investigate.
The locals say that trading ship over there belongs to a stranger. Maybe that's the supplier!
He freely admits to his crime! Get him!
No, he is dead! It cannot end here, we have no answers!
There must be some clue among the wreckage, anything!
It's empty!
Endless cloaks and masks!
Maggot-ridden!
An assortment to make the blood curdle!
A tiger must stay low and close to his prey.
Still your rage. The trail may not end here.
There, that must be the villain's ship!
Keep a good distance, but don't let the wretch slip away.
Your father's testament is clear! No guilty man would write with such confidence!
He has nowhere to go.
There is the ship. Let's keep our distance, see where it goes.
His words are a warning. Whoever our nemesis is, they are many steps ahead.
He is dead?
I can't believe you left me to look after shop.

Our bond is being seriously tested. What are all these papers?
Admit it, you've forgotten about me.
How did Hannah do this all these years? I'm beginning to feel her pain.
I've got people asking me which palette of what needs to go where!
If you'd taken me with you, I could have helped!
I hear you ducked out of a war. Not for the first time, eh, old pal?
Now is no time for boldness, but caution.
Don't distract me, old pal. I'm getting better at accounting!
Edvard! I told you he was rotten as a fig.
Edvard is behind this? He's pathetic.
There's a space between revenge and forgiveness.
Your ill tidings come as no surprise to me. Edvard's face betrays the game is up.
I pity the man.
There will be punishment. But Edvard has suffered since the day Samuel died.
Whatever the punishment, the damage to Edvard is already done.
We must prepare for a reckoning. Edvard was never the true enemy.
It is the Pyrphorians behind all of this, we cannot neglect the threat they pose.
The trial is a distraction. The real danger we are yet to face.
It is a start. But the Pyphorians are many.
Do everything to make sure the Queen is safe, old pal.
It will be an honour to have the Queen here, but it is not without risk.
Good, but the Queen may still be vulnerable.
Stay attuned. This is the perfect time for our enemy to recover.
We have seen nothing of the Pyrphorians but their minions.
Whoever is behind the Pyrphorians will take this time to weigh their options.
We cannot let this business with Edvard divert us from the real threat.
Black clouds loom, my old friend. Be ready to raise your umbrella.
I feel uneasy, and it's not the trial.
Even if we cannot forgive Edvard, we have to learn to let it go.
I have met the jury. They are idiots!
The Queen certainly speaks her mind.

The sky above Bright Sands glow with maleficence!
It is time, old pal. Our nemesis approaches!
It is time we stamped out this fire for good.
When they see how bright you burn, old pal, they will shrivel.
The first of many victories!
You have my blade. I am ready.
Old friend, it's over! The last Pyrphorians are sunk!

Dynamite fishing?! You're serious? Well, the village north is always short on food.
Remember when we escaped the pits back in the day? Still some dynamite left.
I hid it next to the abandoned lighthouse. Go fetch it!
Here it is! Just get plenty of distance on the throw.
The dynamite is at the lighthouse, old pal.
They're not expecting Queen Parrotfish; anything with fins will do.
All the blistered fish they could ever want.

Even more roasted fish!
Still trying to get used to that smell of char.

Your company, your policy... But be careful, angry employees may one day turn against you.
I totally support your decision. Making your people happy is the true sign of a good leader. Now we need to provide schnapps to these bored farmers.
Good. If you keep your employees happy, there is no way that they betray you. Oh, and it's always fun to mess up with Hannah. Remember that.
Oh you finally decided to provide this schnapps. Great. Happy employees don't think of rioting, instead they may become resourceful. We'll have an eye on it later.

So many are still loyal. But, will you stay loyal to them?

Much better to travel on.

Curious, how close the distant is now.

Sausage is unsightly, but high in demand.

There is cheering on the streets. I suppose it was a good move.

A relief for my nostrils. Others feel the same, I can tell.

I value any help I can get, from any direction.
You will be rewarded, I promise.
Good, we all are with you.
Thank you.
They said it was impossible, you proved them wrong!
You have survived the elements!
Was the reward not substantial enough?
What could have led you astray?
Seems we've not learned from the mistakes of the past.
The cold has got to us.
The Arctic summer is only a brief window.
We don't have much time.
It does not end there, we must keep going.
This must be a sustained effort.
I know it feels like going from one pole to another.
You made a seal hole, now catch a seal!
Have you something?
Something to give us hope?
I await news of our next compass heading.
The matter is out of our hands for the time being.
Who do we have here?! Samuel Goode's child. Want to go down with your father, do you?
You're too late. I was just a spark, and the touch-paper is already lit...
They will come for you, for everybody!
Killing your father was easy…
Want to go down with your father, do you!
The wildfire catches… it catches!
The sixth age of man approaches!
We are the firebringers!
We mortals shall take back the earth!
Burn. Burn!
When a limb is severed, a new one grows.
This kingdom shall fall with the dawn's first rays!
Drones build the nest. The Queen shall come.
It takes just a spark!
We are many.
The head of the Empire must come off.
Primal fire burns eternal!
You have no influence here!
Interfere with our thralls at your peril!
You are in dangerous waters!
These penitents work for us!
We only kept them alive to do our bidding.
The thralls will serve our master.
Isabel and her allies have trangressed for the last time! Die well!
Now we must inflict what we might have saved for later.
Isabel has forgotten what we do to those who disobey.
Fire prolongs the agony of death!
You know not with whom you meddle. Leave, if you value your life, else all shall burn.
Igne Natura Renovatur
In lumine tuo videbimus lumen
The earth must burn before it turns.
The wheels turn and nothing can stop them.
All must bow to the flames.
This is not over.
The fire will burn forever!
Martyrs to the cause!
For each head torn another grows back!
Master, our organism is withering!
You said we could not fail, master!
What of your promises, master? What of our victory?
When one is torn away, another succeeds
Light of Prometheus!
You will be our fuel!
Yes, Grandmaster! Gladly.
There was a chance while yer father still lived, no use dragging it out now he's gone…
Bright Sands will never be matched, if that's what you're set on.
You are trying at least. I know Samuel wouldn't have given up.
I'm starting to wonder if you can't turn things around.
You can't bring back your father, but his spirit…
I don't know what you're trying to achieve here, but it won't bring Samuel back.
Mining for you, mining for Eli , what's the difference?
Your father had that same steely look.
It's no Bright Sands, but it really is something!
Your company is flourishing. You may even be the match of your father, rest his soul.
Samuel Goode’s engineer? Aye, that’s me. Who’s asking?
So I'm a commodity now, to be bought and sold? Your father treated me like a human being.
You're stubborn, that's for sure. A chip off the old block.
So you're the one that fled his duties. Well you're too late, there's nothing to be done.
You realise this will be no palm-tree paradise, only hard graft?
My wife tells me I shouldn't be so hard on you.
You're brave coming back, many people blame all this on you.
Samuel always had high hopes for you. It was a great blow to him when you left.
My prison outfit remains in protest.
Edvard is the major cause of my distemper, not you.
Somehow got used to these pyjama stripes.
Dead or alive, I’ll always be Samuel’s man.
I realise I should have told you sooner.
Perhaps now you have the means to take justice into your own hands.
Ah, the prodigal child. Epitome of selfishness.
It'll take a lot to convince me you're worthy of the name Goode.
You never know what you have til it's gone, eh?
Give me a reason to forgive you.
I had believed it would only do harm to tell you, but I have grounds to believe your father was murdered.
And the killer, his cellmate, walks free! The rumour is he's in hiding, preparing to flee to the New World.
It is believed his accomplice supplies him with goods from the Emporium Exotique!
Theodora! Finally I can hold you in my arms again!
A shame you can't appreciate the craft this requires. Never mind, the charges have been primed, the perimeter cleared, we are ready to detonate.
Boom!
It shows we have conquered our fear.
Seems the balance is restored.
These are good signs.
You have done well, and you smell nice.
When the ice breaks, I want you there with me.
The wolf has kept you strong, caribou.
There is much to be afraid of now.
I must consult the spirit now.
It is an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
You have damaged the balance of things.
You are meddling in witchcraft.
You have let many people down.
A shaman must help those in need. We will share what we know.
We were afraid you would come for them. Now you are here we must help you.
To know where you are going, you have to know where you come from.
An annuraaq should be watertight.
A fur hood would help shake the snow from your face.
We do not camp anywhere long, the season changes fast.
The igluit are made with anything we can find.
During the long dark winter, we will play games and tell stories.
Seal is important to us, we are careful to waste no part of it.
Take only the whale and bear that you need.
May we repay this kindness.
We are thankful.
Nakurmiik; thank you.
Yes.
Ee.
Good.
Not good.
I am sorry.
Nakka.
May you have warmth in your iglu.
May you have oil in your lamp.
Go with peace in your heart.
Skins can be sewn into clothing with bone needles.
You need a lot of good fat to reach the heart of ice.
I fear they went looking for the heart of ice. We have not seen them for a long time.
I can set you on a path, the rest is down to you.
If you tread carefully, then perhaps a way can be found.
That is the way. Their breath still hangs in the air.
Without belief, answers do not yet exist.
I don't know if your icebreaker will vanquish the ice, but we will not stand in your way.
None of us have much time.
You need to make the best of all you have.
Such strength can redeem your people.
This place is all-powerful, ever-changing, you have to adapt.
We have sighted vessels stranded in the channels. They too will be lost without help.
Better to let others learn from their own mistakes.
Your countrymen will soon become snowbound, and easy prey for Akhlut.
Those men underestimated this place, but you can show them their failings.
They will be glad to come back to light and hospitality, and think on their mistakes.
Seals are everywhere; know how to look for them.
Nanurjuk says they didn't seem right. They said little as if their tongues were cut.
They refused the seals we offered them.
They would not trade, or drink soup with us.
We built them a shelter, but they were already gone, deep into the ice.
Never have I seen beings so pale.
They went beyond the old ice, to a place of danger.
We are afraid Anguta has taken them to the underworld.
There are many ways to survive here, we have learned since childhood.
I will trade with you.
We were scared they were possessed by demons.
They brought sickness with them, and devilry.
We knew you would come for them, we have been waiting for you.
If these are indeed humans you pursue, I will do all I can to help you.
There are many things I could tell you, but I don't think they will help.
There are many sea mammals here, Sedna is their keeper.
We do not meddle in the business of others.
Don't expect to learn everything in a day.
The Council have praised our knowledge, but never respected it.
The vessels you seek are near yet far. Best prepare for terror.
If their vessels drifted to a dark place, maybe they are there still.
They could not have escaped the channels, you will find them there.
We too want answers, you are brave to keep digging.
This is a place of death. You can die here without knowing.
I will not go with you. I hope it is men you find, at the end of your journey.
When wise men die, the heavens lament.
You are on the last floe now, but the most fragile.
You have brought men back from the edge, you have earned our respect.
If you cannot save them, their souls will be trapped in the upper world to starve for eternity.
The lights in the sky cleave heads from the unworthy.
Where the ice between the dead and the living is thinnest, you float across.
I have no power to protect you, when you go to that place.
You have stirred the wrath of the moon!
Do not hunt alone, in darkness, or the wolf will take you.
This is a celestial place, be wary of taboo.
Fear this place, or it will take you smiling.
Nanook decides if you may hunt, or if you violate this place.
Inuksuk said he saw the white people carrying human meat.
I remember they were so dirty, they had lost all humanity.
If you hear a whistling, it is their ghosts, trapped in the upper world.
You saw Amarok. He preys upon those that stray too far from the path.
I cannot say. The spirits become restless when strangers enter their realm. If we stay too long, they will never let us leave.
Glorious it is when wandering time comes.
If you walk on thin ice, you may as well dance.
Be the lead dog, and show where to go.
Find this seal hole.
Watch out for bears.
The strong qimmiq pulls through.
You have a good nose.
We should do what we can to survive.
We should take gifts when they are offered.
It is easy to underestimate this place.
This is a harsh land.
We waste no chance we have here.
Now is your time.
That was only the beginning.
The day is young, there is more to do.
Do you share with the hunting party?
Should I heat some tea?
There is nothing more to be said.
It is a time of silence.
Done.

For your information.

The board have faith in you to pull through, here's something to keep the fires burning.
After the picket protests, many fine men left Bright Sands to join you.
Then Edvard struck back! He imprisoned all who were close to your father, including my beloved Thomas.
My husband and the others were deported to Wormways Prison and I've heard nothing from him ever since. If you do find him unharmed, prithee tell him his wife yearns for his return.
Can't thank you enough for bailing my Thomas out of gaol.
Not just my husband—all from your father’s circles were clapped in irons.
I can be reunited with dear Mr. Ticker!
Oh my dear Thomas!
We are, all of us, quite moved by your selfless actions. Your father would be proud.
Saved! Do you also then save us from a grievous injustice…?
Edvard’s charges against us are pure fabrication! The man is an impostor!
I know we look like criminals, but we were trusted associates of your father.
I bring grave news from our ice pilots. The pack ice becomes too thick. We'd be risking our ships if we were to continue our rescue.
So with a heavy heart, I have ordered the Arctic council fleet to return southwards to our winter haven. But do not lose hope! We will gather ourselves and return next year.
ME! You said it worm, kneel before the one true god of anno!
/ 1800 / 1602 / In every game / I shelter you / 1701 / 1404 / Each anno game / Is just the same
Enough of your grovelling! Rise Mortals! / Now, which role do you see for me in your little drama?
Your attempts at flattery are futile. I am going to pwn a game of 1404 now. When I get back this will be “checksum 9: the musical” or you will feel my holy wrath.
The moral of the story is simple. Without me, it doesn’t work. See you in Anno 1305!
So it’s my fault again?

What should I be?! Say it! What is it this time? Should I hang lower in the sky? Should I turn with you? If I ever make it into the game without one person complaining I’ll eat my hat. Come on then you bright sparks, gift me an entry in the options menu, this wheelie-bin for half-finished features. Or even better! How about a day-night cycle, huh? Then every five minutes I can cede my throne to a rotten cheese!
Peeps, in the old days nobody needed that. The world was in 2D. Everybody was happy that they could see anything at all.
Did someone call for me?
Edvard Goode. Are you ready to be reunited with your brother?
Of course you are. The heat will peel your sins from your flesh like cloth. Acolytes, purge the place!

Pathetic! But then, surely Samuel awaits you too! The whole Goode family can be reunited in the everlasting. We squeezed the life from your father's lungs, peeled your uncle's skin...You must be curious as to what we plan for you!
A new world order is at stake— the Empire already shaking to its foundations, and the Goode family helpless to prevent it! We first eradicate the offspring and then eradicate the Queen!
First Samuel, now Edvard! Soon I will be rid of your dreary family once and for all.
Goode & Sons. Favourites of the Royal Council. How I've enjoyed watching your family's slow and ignoble demise.
What a fool Edvard was to trust us!
Behold my solar barque!
Chivalry died with the monarchy! Your family of goodie-goodies was always likely to be first on my list.
Nothing can stop the turning of the wheel, or meek mice from crushing beneath!
Goode and Sons are the thorn in my side. Without it, the Queen shall come quietly!
The Empire has no hope of survival without its vassals!
You will die along with your goodie-goodie father!
Fools! Outmanoeuvred by a merchant trader!
Feeble underlings, you have only yourselves to blame!
You are not fit to kneel before the infernal mother.
The day has come when all the world shall rue its pride!
My vengeance upon you shall be my magnum opus! Just wait.
No! This is not the end!
Confound you meddling Goodes! I will return, and take you to darker places than ever you could conceive.
Don’t worry, that old tyrant can’t hold us back anymore!
We’d rather die than stay. Our flags still wave for Samuel, let Edvard oppress us no more!
A life away from Edvard? We're on board! Only… we've no ship to get on board of!
Your father always saw to it that we had rights and unions and all that gubbins.
Shame what happened to your father. We'll stand by your side!
We will follow you as we followed Samuel!
Ready to leave Bright Sands behind!
If you're only half your father, you're way beyond Edvard!
Your uncle is nothing like your father! We'll follow you!
Unite! Unite!
I'm not feeling so good...
Come on, the sun is up!
Did anyone let out the pigs...?
Do we have enough for breakfast?
No! This is the third pot broken this week...
I apologize if it's a bit dull...

All these technological advancements!

Spare a coin, amigo?
¡Ole!
Careful with that!
Lunch in five!

I'll talk to her this Sunday.

Here, have a good drink.

Help me carry these back.
Start the machines!
Step back, kid.
Not completely what I expected...
There's nothing! Absolutely nothing!
I'm dying for a cold drink!

There are bigger ones in my back garden!
Don't be afraid, look closer!
Is there a label that says what it is?
Have your heard? We're going to war!
Let'em have it!
They're at our doors!
Oi, boss, me shackles are a bit tight.
Damned be the enemies of our beloved Queen.
It's quite the bargain...
Don't piss off old Annie, lad!
Isabel will guide us to liberdade!

Samuel —a traitor!?

Never thought I'd get sick of daylight.
We will not take this oppression!

I wish I could play the trombone...!
Quiet days, quiet nights.

Should we grab a drink to celebrate!

What a scam!
Stocks are taking off!

I told you I won't put up with this.

Would you like to come with me?
I need some fresh air...
It's so worth it!
The weather's nice.
Get some rest, we leave at dawn!

They could try dusting it!
I admit it's charming when they nuzzle.
Such meaningless carnage...
Please don't let them get to us.
We need more men at the front line!

You know, the Queen is a personal friend of mine.

I was brought here along with Samuel. None of us knew why.
It's Edvard now, like it or not...
Our Lady's the only thing that keeps us striving.
I wouldn't trust the artic council with my blisters...
I'm so sick of this administration!
Grab what you can and run!
This is the best day of my life!

I have become quite accustumed to it on my travels to the West.
